summary: 01/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on Mustafa Hammud, deputy director of the prison service, in Dali, Ad Dali, Yemen. Five people, including Hammud and four others, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2019: Assailants fired seven mortars intended to target an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) base in Mogadishu, Somalia. The shells struck a United Nations Assistance Mission In Somalia (UNSOM) compound, injuring three people. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/01/2019: Assailants equipped with firearms and rocket propelled grenades attacked an army camp in Mandozai, Kandahar, Afghanistan. In addition, multiple explosive devices detonated in a tunnel under the base. At least five soldiers were killed and six soldiers were injured in the assault. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2019: At least three explosive devices detonated targeting the convoy of Rakhine State Chief Minister U Nyi Pu between Nan Kyar and Paung Tut in Rakhine, Myanmar. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA), which denied involvement.

01/01/2019: Assailants opened fire on a border police post in Saytaung, Rakhine, Myanmar. One police officer was injured in the attack. The Arakan Army (AA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for military operations.

01/01/2019: Assailants attacked the residence of an Afghan Local Police (ALP) officer in Dashti Qala district, Takhar, Afghanistan. Two officers and three assailants were killed while three assailants were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/01/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the house of Henry Arcillas Gregorio, a village councilor, in Tagasilay, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. There were no casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/01/2019: Assailants shot and killed Special Police Officer Sameer Ahmad Mir at his residence in Hanjan Payeen, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2019: Assailants raided Yirgou, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. At least seven people, including a village leader, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Ansar al-Islam (Burkina Faso) was involved in the attack.

01/01/2019: A suicide bomber detonated at a police station in Ghadduwah, Sabha, Libya. The assailant was the only reported casualty. This was one of two similar suicide attacks in Ghadwa on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to both the Fezzan Province of the Islamic State and Al-Qaida in the Islamic Maghreb (AQIM).
gname: Fezzan Province of the Islamic State

summary: 01/01/2019: An assailant opened fire on a mosque in Malmo, Skane, Sweden. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2019: Four assailants, including at least one suicide bomber, attacked a Frontier Corps (FC) compound in Loralai, Balochistan, Pakistan. Four soldiers and four assailants were killed and two soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2019: Assailants opened fire on Mayor Alejandro Aparicio Santiago in Tlaxiaco, Oaxaca, Mexico. Two people, including Santiago, were killed and three people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/01/2019: An assailant rented a vehicle and drove into crowds celebrating New Year's Day in Harajuku, Tokyo, Japan. At least eight people were injured in the attack. After ramming the vehicle into the crowd, the assailant fled the scene and was later arrested by authorities. A tank of kerosene was discovered in the vehicle and the assailant indicated that he had planned to set fire to crowds at Meiji Shrine with the kerosene and a sprayer. The assailant, Kazuhiro Kusakabe, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the execution of Aum Shinrikyo members.

01/01/2019: Assailants attacked Fulani civilians in Koulogon village, Mopti, Mali. At least 37 civilians were killed and an unknown number were injured in the raid. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Dozo militia.

01/01/2019: Assailants burned 250 hectares of a rice farm belonging to Governor Samuel Ortom in Gbajimba, Benue, Nigeria. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

01/01/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting police officers in Garas Balley, Banaadir, Somalia. The officers were responding to an earlier projectile attack in the area. At least three officers were injured in the blast. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/01/2019: Assailants highjacked vehicles and abducted people selling khat in Caad, Mudug, Somalia. This was one of three similar attacks in the area on the same day. At least 30 people were kidnapped across all three incidents. Their whereabouts remain unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

01/01/2019: Assailants hijacked vehicles and abducted people selling khat in Miliqo, Mudug, Somalia. This was one of three similar attacks in the area on the same day. At least 30 people were kidnapped across all three incidents. Their whereabouts remain unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

01/01/2019: Assailants hijacked vehicles and abducted people selling khat in an unknown number of villages of Harardhere district, Mudug, Somalia. This was one of three similar attacks in the area on the same day. At least 30 people were kidnapped across all three incidents. Their whereabouts remain unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

01/01/2019: A suicide bomber detonated at a police station in Ghadduwah, Sabha, Libya. In addition to the assailant, at least three people were killed and four people were injured in the blast. This was one of two similar suicide attacks in Ghadwa on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Fezzan Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Fezzan Province of the Islamic State

This was one of three related attacks in Borno on the same day. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incidents.

This was one of three related attacks in Borno on the same day. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incidents.

The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incidents.

This was one of two related incidents targeting the same family in Belfast overnight. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to dissident Republicans.

Four assailants were killed and five soldiers and eight assailants were injured across all five attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

01/01/2019: Assailants attacked a military position in Kelabah, Taizz, Yemen. This was one of five attacks in Taiz on this date. Four assailants were killed and five soldiers and eight assailants were injured across all five attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

Four assailants were killed and five soldiers and eight assailants were injured across all five attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

01/01/2019: An assailant attempted to drive his vehicle into a pedestrian in Bottrop, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in the area on this date. An Anti-Immigrant extremist, identified as Andreas N., claimed responsibility for the incidents and told police that he intended to target foreigners in the attacks.

01/01/2019: An assailant drove his vehicle into a crowd of pedestrians in Bottrop, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. At least four people were injured in the attack. This was one of three related attacks in the area on this date. An Anti-Immigrant extremist, identified as Andreas N., claimed responsibility for the incidents and told police that he intended to target foreigners in the attacks.

This was one of three related attacks in the area on this date. An Anti-Immigrant extremist, identified as Andreas N., claimed responsibility for the incidents and told police that he intended to target foreigners in the attacks.

01/02/2019: An explosive device detonated in Mawiyah district, Taizz, Yemen. At least three children were killed and another person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

01/02/2019: Assailants fired a rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) at the municipal council building in Sirte, Libya. There were no reported casualties, though the building was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Salvation Front (NAS).

01/02/2019: Assailants attacked an army outpost in Morghab district, Badghis, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated incidents targeting army outposts in the district on the same day. At least four soldiers were killed and six soldiers were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

At least four soldiers were killed and six soldiers were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

01/03/2019: An explosive device detonated prematurely while assailants were planting it in Chimtal district, Balkh, Afghanistan. Three assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban and noted that the device was intended to target a security convoy.

01/03/2019: Assailants opened fire on a military vehicle protecting a gas pipeline in Jardan, Shabwah, Yemen. At least two soldiers were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/03/2019: Police officers discovered and defused an explosive device near the police station in Beledweyne, Hiiraan, Somalia. This was one of two explosive devices discovered and defused in Beledweyne on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/03/2019: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in central Beledweyne, Hiiraan, Somalia. This was one of two explosive devices discovered and defused in Beledweyne on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/04/2019: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Kyaung Taung, Rakhine, Myanmar. This was one of four related incidents targeting police posts in the area on this date. One police officer was killed and one officer was injured in the assault. Additionally, 14 people were abducted across the attacks; the hostages were released shortly after the kidnapping. summary: 01/05/2019: Security forces discovered four explosive devices on the roof the Church of the Virgin Mary and St. Mercurius in Nasr City, Cairo, Egypt. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.

01/05/2019: Two assailants opened fire on Jackielyn Antonio in Pasay City, Metropolitan Manila, Philippines. Antonio, a village secretary, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2019: Assailants threw grenades and opened fire on a military checkpoint in Mudiyah district, Abyan, Yemen. At least two soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).

01/05/2019: Assailants opened fire on a bus near Beit El, West Bank. The driver was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Palestinian extremists.
01/05/2019: Assailants in Bayt Fajr opened fire on the Israeli settlement of Migdal Oz in West Bank. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/05/2019: Assailants attempted to attack Goniri, Yobe, Nigeria. There were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the ensuing clash with Nigerian soldiers. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/05/2019: An explosive device detonated along a road near Akashat, Al Anbar, Iraq. Two civilians were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/05/2019: Security forces opened fire and killed two assailants attempting to plant an explosive device in Hessy Salem, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

01/05/2019: Assailants shelled Hayran District, Hajjah, Yemen. An unknown number of civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

01/06/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated targeting a Levies vehicle in Pishin, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least nine people, including Levies officers and civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/06/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated targeting a Frontier Corps (FC) vehicle in Panjgur district, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least two people were injured in the blast. The casualties included an FC member and a civilian. The United Baloch Army (UBA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/06/2019: An explosive device attached to a police vehicle detonated in the 16th police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. Three police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/06/2019: Assailants opened fire on Aziz Ahmad Azizi in the 2nd police district of Kandahar, Afghanistan. Azizi, an appeals court employee, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/06/2019: Assailants abducted at least five civilian from Tall Kusaybah, Saladin, Iraq. An unknown number of hostages were released later the same day, and the fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/06/2019: Assailants shot and killed Joseph Gabia, a Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) member, in Linantuyan, Negros Oriental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

01/06/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle between Abbasi and Zab, Kirkuk, Iraq. Six civilians were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/06/2019: Assailants opened fire on an army sergeant, a barangay captain, and a tanod after a funeral in Dela Fe, Camarines Sur, Philippines. Sergeant Benito Ronquillo Bien was killed while the other two targets were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/06/2019: Assailants opened fire on a passenger van between Palma and Pundanhar in Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. The assailants forced the passengers out of the vehicle before assaulting them with machetes. At least seven people were killed and seven people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

01/06/2019: Assailants threw a petrol bomb at the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) headquarters in Shillong, Meghalaya, India. There were no reported casualties, but the office was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/06/2019: Assailants attacked a police patrol in Kilagi, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least two officers, including a commander, were killed and three people, including civilians, were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/06/2019: Assailants attacked police checkpoints in Fayzabad district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least eight people, including five officers and three assailants, were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

01/06/2019: Assailants opened fire on a military checkpost in Loi Shalman, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP).
01/06/2019: Assailants opened fire on Sardarzada Abdul Hafeez Sajdi in Gresha, Balochistan, Pakistan. Sajdi, a tribal elder, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/06/2019: Assailants set fire to the administration block at Bathembu High School in Msinga, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related incidents targeting schools in KwaZulu-Natal on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/06/2019: Assailants set fire to Mvuzo High School in Pietermaritzburg, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two similar incidents targeting schools in KwaZulu-Natal on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/06/2019: A missile targeting a military camp was safely intercepted west of Taizz, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

01/06/2019: Assailants attacked a military base in Qarjaghai, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least 29 people, including 15 assailants and 14 security personnel, were killed and 10 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related attacks in different districts of Badghis on the same day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attacks.

01/06/2019: Assailants attacked an Afghan Local Police (ALP) checkpoint in Gandab, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least seven police officers were killed and nine other officers were injured in the incident. This was one of two related attacks in different districts of Badghis on the same day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attacks.

01/07/2019: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of Brigadier General Jamal al-Shumayri in Dhubab district, Taizz, Yemen. Al-Shumayri was unharmed, though five soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/07/2019: Assailants raided a prison and assaulted prisoners in Dhamar, Yemen. At least 21 people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

01/07/2019: Assailants abducted Army Corporal Angel Mauricio Acevedo in Villa del Rosario district, Norte de Santander, Colombia. Acevedo was released on February 7, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

01/07/2019: Assailants equipped with machetes and firearms attacked the families of soldiers in Mavivi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 10 people were killed, one was injured, and an unknown number of people were abducted during the raid. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

01/07/2019: Assailants attacked Auno, Borno, Nigeria. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

01/07/2019: Assailants attacked Sajeri, near Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. At least two people were killed, including Husseini Mohammed, an Islamic cleric, and at least one other person was briefly held hostage. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/07/2019: Assailants entered the RTG state radio broadcasting offices and held the staff hostage in Libreville, Estuaire, Gabon. The assailants broadcasted a message calling on the public to join a coup. Security forces stormed the office, arrested the coup leader, killed two other assailants, and released the hostages. The Patriotic Youth Movement of the Gabonese Defence and Security Forces claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Patriotic Youth Movement of the Gabonese Defence and Security Forces

summary: 01/07/2019: Assailants fired a rocket that was intercepted by the Iron Dome Missile Defense System over Ashkelon, Southern, Israel. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement).

01/07/2019: An explosive device detonated against a vehicle at a market in Nawe Chambaran, Paktika, Afghanistan. At least 10 civilians were killed and 13 were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/03/2019: An explosive device detonated at an Alternative for Germany (AfD) party office in Dobeln, Saxony, Germany. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/07/2019: Assailants threw an explosive device at a border police base in Abu Dis, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Three additional devices were discovered and defused near the scene. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/07/2019: Assailants opened fire on Mayor Christopher Cuan outside the municipal hall in Libungan district, North Cotabato, Philippines. Cuan was not harmed, though one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/07/2019: Assailants attacked Frank Magnitz in Bremen, Germany. Magnitz, an Alternative for Germany (AfD) parliamentarian, was injured in the assault. Anti-Fascist Spring Bremen claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the group "wanted to free AfD politician F. Magnitz from his fascist ideas."

01/07/2019: Assailants abducted Isaaya Mbeeta, a Ugandan farmer, near the Ugandan border in North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Mbeeta was released on January 8, 2019 following a ransom payment. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/07/2019: A suicide bomber opened fire before detonating at a People's Protection Units (YPG) recruitment center in Raqqah, Syria. In addition to the assailant, at least five people, including four civilians and one YPG member, were killed and eight other people were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/07/2019: Security forces discovered and defused two explosive devices inside a mosque in Adraskan district, Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/07/2019: Assailants abducted Jose Antonio Bermúdez and his wife Amparo Montañez Valencia in Mapoy, Arauca, Colombia. Valencia was released a few hours later and Bermúdez was released on January 9, 2019. The 110th Front of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 01/08/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a ranger patrol near the Thairat Wittaya 52 school in Pong Sakhor, Pattani, Thailand. Two people, including a student, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

01/08/2019: Assailants raided the house of a retired teacher in Saba Yoi district, Songkhla, Thailand. The teacher, Amata Samothanthawi, was hanged and his vehicle was stolen in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Songkhla on this date. The stolen vehicle was later used in a car bombing. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Barisan Revolusi Nasional (BRN).

01/08/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting police near Tha Muang, Songkhla, Thailand. Two officers were injured and a power transformer was destroyed in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Songkhla on this date. The vehicle used in the bombing was stolen in a previous attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Barisan Revolusi Nasional (BRN).

01/08/2019: Assailants attacked security forces in Temorak, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least 19 security personnel were killed, three were injured, and 10 were abducted in the ensuing clash. The hostages were rescued on February 25, 2019. The victims included police and military personnel. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/08/2019: Assailants set fire to road construction equipment in Hinalaan, Sultan Kudarat, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Two members of the New People's Army (NPA) were arrested and confessed to carrying out the attack.

01/08/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting Security Belt forces at a market in Mahfad district, Abyan, Yemen. At least two people were killed and 12 others were injured in the blast. The victims included militia members and civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).
01/07/2019: Assailants shot and killed Abukar Ibrahim, the Warta Nabada district commissioner, in Warta Nabada, Mogadishu, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/08/2019: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at a security checkpoint in Tikrit, Saladin, Iraq. In addition to the assailant, at least three people were killed and 10 others were injured in the blast; the victims included soldiers, police officers, and civilians. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and accused the victims of being "apostates."
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/08/2019: Assailants opened fire on a Rashtriya Rifles camp in Largam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/08/2019: Assailants opened fire on a Rashtriya Rifles patrol near Litter, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One assailant was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to both Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) and Hizbul Mujahideen (HM).

01/08/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle in Ambar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/08/2019: A ballistic missile detonated prematurely on its launching platform in Tayyar, Saada, Yemen. At least 15 assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Houthi extremists. Sources noted that the missile was intended to target Saudi Arabia.

01/08/2019: At least three assailants armed with pistols attempted to stop the car of former governor Sindh Muhammad Zubair in Karachi, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/08/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated at a market near the Spin Jumat Mosque in Khost, Afghanistan. At least 2 people were killed and 23 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/08/2019: Assailants shot and killed Mamrazi Khan, a land protection department official, in Kohat, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/08/2019: Assailants opened fire on residents and set fire to buildings along Bozoum Road in Bokayan, Nana-Mambere, Central African Republic. At least five people were killed and 12 people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Return, Reclamation, Rehabilitation (3R).

01/08/2019: Assailants attacked the house of Suresh Hupendi and abducted him in Niche Kamta, Chhattisgarh, India. Hupendi was killed shortly after the kidnapping. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victim, Suresh Hupendi, was targeted because he was a police informant.

01/08/2019: Assailants shot and killed Modesto Pasca Carsola in Gapang, Abra, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the New People's Army (NPA) and noted that the victim was accused of being a military informant.
01/08/2019: Assailants opened fire on Frontier Corps (FC) soldiers in Balgatar, Balochistan, Pakistan. Four soldiers were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/08/2019: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device outside of a bank in Cairo, Egypt. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/09/2019: Security forces identified and intercepted assailants attempting to detonate explosive devices in Sultan sa Barongis, Maguindanao, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

01/09/2019: Assailants set fire to a bus in Pucay, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. There were no casualties were reported in the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/09/2019: Security forces discovered and defused three explosive devices at an event for Governor Esmael Mangudadatu in Tabungao, Maguindanao, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/09/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the military escorts of Lieutenant Colonel 'Ali 'Awad al-Mahwari in Mahfad district, Abyan, Yemen. While al-Mahwari, a commander of the Rapid Intervention forces, was not harmed, at least two soldiers were killed and two were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/09/2019: Assailants shot and killed a soldier in Taizz, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/09/2019: Assailants shot and killed Samer Ali, an assistant cameraman for al-Hurrah Iraq Television, in Sadr City, Baghdad, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/09/2019: Assailants raided Lorigan village in Mopti, Mali. At least three people, including one assailant and two civilians, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/09/2019: Assailants shot and killed two soldiers in Hodan, Mogadishu, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/09/2019: Assailants equipped with machetes and firearms attacked Kimoka, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least one soldier was killed, one MONUSCO peacekeepers was injured, and two women were sexually assaulted in the attack. In addition, two people were abducted; their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/09/2019: An explosive device detonated in Haftaghar, Daquq, Kirkuk, Iraq. One civilian was killed and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/09/2019: Assailants attacked council member and district head of the Fatherland party Vadym Mirzoyan in Kryvyi Rih, Dnipro, Ukraine. Mirzoyan was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/09/2019: An assailant stabbed and injured a teenage girl in Armon Hanatziv, Jerusalem, West Bank. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/09/2019: Assailants attacked a Afghan Local Police (ALP) post in Hussainkhel, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least nine police officers were killed and six officers were injured in the assault. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/09/2019: An explosive device targeting the Sui Northern Gas Pipeline near Rahimabad, Punjab province, Pakistan. No casualties were reported in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/00/2019: Sometime between January 6, 2019 and January 12, 2019, security forces intercepted and destroyed two explosives-laden drones near Maran, Sanaa, Yemen. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

01/09/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the Cano-Limon oil pipeline in Pesquera, Arauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two attacks on the pipeline on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

01/09/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the Cano-Limon oil pipeline in Bancas, Arauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two attacks on the pipeline on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).
01/09/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Idlib, Syria. At least one person was killed and another person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
01/09/2019: Security forces discovered and defused explosive devices along a railway track at Habra station in Ashoknagar, West Bengal, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/09/2019: An incendiary device was discovered and defused at the residence of Deputy Chief Laode Syarief, a Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) leader, in Jakarta, Jakarta Raya, Indonesia. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/09/2019: Assailants ambushed a military logistics convoy near Sinak airport in Puncak district, Papua, Indonesia. Two people, an assailant and a soldier, were killed in the ensuing clash. The Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka) claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/09/2019: Assailants killed three people in Mekhlaf Al-Oud, Ibb, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; whoever, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

01/10/2019: Assailants opened fire on defense volunteers guarding a school in Bukoh, Pattani, Thailand. Four volunteers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Barisan Revolusi Nasional (BRN) was involved.

01/10/2019: Assailants opened fire on security checkpoints in Sitoot, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least four soldiers and 10 assailants were killed while five soldiers and eight assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. In addition two soldiers were abducted in the assault. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/10/2019: Assailants attacked a police post in Gortepa, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least 10 assailants and seven police officers were killed and 13 assailants and six police officers were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2019: Assailants attacked the patrol base of the 62nd Infantry Battalion in Hilamonan, Negros Occidental, Philippines. At least one soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

01/14/2019: Assailants attacked a group of soldiers in Cabatangan, Iloilo, Philippines. One soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

01/10/2019: An explosive-laden drone detonated targeting a military parade near Al-Anad Airport in Lahij, Yemen. At least seven soldiers, including the Yemeni army chief of staff, were killed and 19 others were injured in the attack. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for airstrikes.

01/10/2019: Assailants attacked a market in Gasseliki, Sahel, Burkina Faso. At least 12 people were killed and two were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

01/10/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a police van in Kulachi, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least two police officers were injured in the attack. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2019: Assailants abducted five Malian refugees from the Goudebo refugee camp in Dibassi, Sahel, Burkina Faso. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2019: Assailants shot and killed Imad Jabar, Laymunah restaurant owner, in Habbibiyah, Sadr City, Baghdad, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Asa'ib Ahl al-Haqq.
01/10/2019: Assailants shot and killed town Councilor Reneboy Dacalos in South Poblacion, Cebu, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/10/2019: Security discovered and defused two explosive devices in Zarkani, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Sources stated that the devices were intended to target security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2019: Assailants shot and killed a police officer at the Bakara market in Hawl Wadag, Mogadishu, Somalia. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also suspected that Al-Shabaab may have been involved in the attack.

01/10/2019: Assailants raided the Bilingual High School in Kumba, South-West, Cameroon. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, at least three gendarmes were injured as security forces responded to the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

01/10/2019: Assailants opened fire on residents in Bambari, Ouaka, Central African Republic. At least 10 people, including two police officers, were killed and 31 people, including another officer and one assailant, were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Union for Peace in Central Africa (UPC).
gname: Union for Peace in Central Africa (UPC)

summary: 01/10/2019: Assailants attacked peasants in a rice field in Nailwa, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least one person was killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources suspected the involvement of Muslim extremists.

01/10/2019: Assailants set fire to the Shannon Key West Hotel in Rooskey, Roscommon, Ireland. No casualties were reported but the hotel, which was set to provide accommodation for asylum seekers, was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2019: Assailants attacked an unknown number of checkpoints in Qalay-i-Zal district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least 10 security personnel were killed and 11 were injured in the attack. In addition, 25 assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. The victims included soldiers and police officers. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2019: Assailants attacked Muqur district, Badghis, Afghanistan. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/10/2019: An explosive device detonated in Mukha district, Taizz, Yemen. At least one person was killed and two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

01/10/2019: Assailants abducted Sara Sofia Vargas from her residence in Chimichagua district, Cesar, Colombia. Vargas, a cattle rancher, was rescued by security forces on March 3, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 01/10/2019: Assailants fired rockets at civilian homes in Ghayl district, Al Jawf, Yemen. At least two children were killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

01/11/2019: Assailants attempted to extort money from civilians in Magballo, Negros Occidental, Philippines. Security forces responded to the incident, leading to a clash. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

01/09/2019: Assailants attacked the police headquarters in Ab Kamari district, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least 16 people, including six police officers and 10 assailants were killed while 20 people, including 10 officers and 10 assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2019: Assailants attacked a public order police post in Marwa, Herat, Afghanistan. At least four officers were killed and eight officers were injured while the assailants suffered an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

01/10/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Colonel Wakil Ahmad in Bala Shahr, Herat, Afghanistan. At least four officers, including Ahmad, the local police commander, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/11/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting oil tanks at the Aden Refinery in Aden, Adan, Yemen. The blast resulted in a fire that spread to another tanker which also exploded, injuring six people. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/11/2019: Assailants opened fire on Southern Transitional Council figure 'Ali 'Awad al-Kazimi in Mahfad district, Abyan, Yemen. Al-Kazimi was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/11/2019: Assailants shelled a market in Hayran, Hajjah, Yemen. There were an unknown number of civilian casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

01/11/2019: Assailants shelled Shalilah, Hajjah, Yemen. At least eight people were killed and 10 people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

01/12/2019: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Rabat, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least seven assailants and five police were killed and six assailants and two police were wounded in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/11/2019: An explosive device detonated as assailants were planting it along a road in Mizan district, Zabul, Afghanistan. The device exploded killing two assailants and wounding three others. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/11/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police post in Wel Marer, Garissa, Kenya. There were an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

01/11/2019: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting a Safaricom telecommunications mast in Wel Marer, Garissa, Kenya. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

01/11/2019: Assailants shot down a Aerocharter Andina helicopter and abducted three crew members in San Jose del Tarra, Norte de Santander, Colombia. The hostages were released on February 3, 2019. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Popular Liberation Army (EPL), which the group denied.

01/11/2019: Assailants shot and killed four civilians in San Antonio, Valle del Cauca, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Popular Liberation Army (EPL) was involved in the attack.

At least three people, including one soldier and two assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

01/16/2019: Assailants opened fire on Munir Abu Yamamah, a Shabwah Elite Forces commander, in Mahfad, Abyan, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/00/2019: Sometime between January 1, 2019 and January 31, 2019, an assailant forced his girlfriend at gunpoint to wear a Schutzstaffel (SS) hat inside his residence in Green Township, New Jersey, United States. The assailant took photos of the incident and later posted the photos on a fake Instagram account and sent the photos to her Jewish employer after the couple broke up. Michael V. Zaremski claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that Zaremski processed "a large collection of white supremacy and Nazi materials" and the victim stated that he had an "obsession with Adolf Hitler."

01/17/2019: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at General Santander Police Academy in Bogota, Colombia. In addition to the assailant, at least 21 people were killed and 67 people were injured in the blast; the victims included Colombian, Ecuadorian, and Panamanian nationals. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on a convoy transporting Patrick Cammaert, the head of a United Nations (UN) monitoring committee, in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah), which the group denied.

01/17/2019: Assailants established a checkpoint and abducted Adib Nakhla west of Arish, North Sinai, Egypt. Security forces responded to the incident; an assailant was killed and three security personnel were injured in the ensuing clash. The whereabouts of Nakhla, a Coptic criminal investigation expert, remain unknown. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 01/17/2019: Assailants shelled an area about 7 km south of Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack but the shelling caused a major fire at the Tihamah Trading Company. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

01/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of the chief of operations for the 17th Infantry Brigade in Taizz, Yemen. The colonel, identified as 'Abduh Hamud al-Saghir, was unharmed, but two of his escorts were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/17/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at police personnel in Rajbagh neighborhood, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Three police officers were injured in the blast. Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/17/2019: Assailants attacked and killed Majid Hussain, a member of the Muslim community, near Kasti Garh, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Shiv Sena.

01/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on an army post near the residence of the mother of army chief of staff Tukur Yusuf Buratai in Kamuya, Borno, Nigeria. At least six soldiers were killed and 14 other soldiers were injured in the assault while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/17/2019: An explosive device detonated as assailants were planting it in Bahrami Shahid district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least four assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/17/2019: Assailants attacked police posts in the 3rd police district of Ghazni, Afghanistan. Police officers repelled the attack, killing one assailant and injuring two others. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/17/2019: An explosive device detonated as assailants were planting it in Shaifan, Lahij, Yemen. Three assailants were killed and one assailant was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

01/17/2019: Assailants abducted a soldier, Sami Abdul Qawi, in Mukha district, Taizz, Yemen. Qawi's whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

01/17/2019: Assailants abducted Anas 'Ali Yahya Maghlas in Bayt al Faqih, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Maghlas was tortured and then released on February 2, 2019. He died of his injuries three days later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

01/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on Lieutenant Colonel Nidal Qoujah Ali in Nawa' district, Daraa, Syria. Lieutenant Colonel Ali, a local Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) director, was injured in the assault. The Popular Resistance Committees in Daraa claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/17/2019: Assailants fired rockets at residences in Al-Rawdah, Marib, Yemen. At least three people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

01/18/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a police patrol in Tha Yalo, Pattani, Thailand. At least four people, including two police officers and two civilians, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/18/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a ranger patrol along a railway near Todeng, Narathiwat, Thailand. Five army rangers were injured in the blast. This was one of two coordinated bombings targeting the patrol on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Barisan Revolusi Nasional (BRN).

01/18/2019: Assailants dressed as soldiers opened fire on Buddhist monks at Rattananuphab Temple in Khokko, Narathiwat, Thailand. At least two monks were killed and two monks were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Barisan Revolusi Nasional (BRN).

01/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on civilians after prayers in Pignari, Mopti, Mali. Two people, including an imam, were killed, three people were injured, and one person was reported missing during the raid. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to both Ansar al-Islam (Burkina Faso) and Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM).
01/18/2019: Assailants shot and killed a city councilor at his residence in Derpon, Nord, Burkina Faso. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/18/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated near a Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) office in Idlib, Syria. At least 11 people, including HTS members and civilians, were killed and 20 other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 01/19/2019: Assailants attacked Ashigashiya, Extreme-North, Cameroon. At least seven people were wounded and approximately 100 houses were set on fire in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on Hussein Hadafow outside Haji Mohamoud Abgalow mosque in Hodan, Mogadishu, Somalia. Hadafow, the Hodan District Youth Association chair, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

01/18/2019: Assailants abducted 100 people in Hudur, Bakool, Somalia. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab and noted that the victims had failed to respond to an extortion demand and had participated in parliamentary elections. Sources also stated that Al-Shabaab accused some of the victims being spies.

01/18/2019: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Bosaso, Bari, Somalia. Sources noted that the device was planted in a location that was sometimes used as a makeshift security post. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/18/2019: Security forces identified and arrested an individual armed with a grenade in Lolab, Jammu and Kashmir, India. When police questioned the assailant, he claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he was promised information, via social media, on how to join a militant group if he carried out this attack.

01/18/2019: Assailants threw a grenade targeting a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) bunker in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties, though a civilian vehicle was damaged in the blast. This was one of two related attacks on police in the area on this date. Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) and the Jammu and Kashmir Islamic Front separately claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/18/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at a Special Operations Group (SOG) police camp in Gagran, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two related attacks on police in the area on this date. Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/18/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at a police station in Kakapora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/18/2019: Security forces identified and killed five assailants as they were planting an explosive device in Nangarhar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/18/2019: Assailants raided a Dole Philippines plantation and burned equipment in Lilingayon, Bukidnon, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

01/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on family members of pro-government militia members in Ghozari, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least one person was killed in the assault. This was one of two related attacks in Khwaja Sabz Posh district on this day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which denied involvement.

01/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on family members of pro-government militia members in Yangi Qala, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least three people were killed in the assault. This was one of two related attacks in Khwaja Sabz Posh district on this day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which denied involvement.

01/18/2019: Assailants attacked an Afghan Local Police (ALP) outpost in Zakhel, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least seven police officers were killed and three officers were injured in the ensuing clash. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/18/2019: Assailants attacked police outposts in Farah, Afghanistan. At least eight officers were killed and seven others were taken prisoner. The whereabouts of the abducted officers are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/17/2019: An assailant stabbed a civilian at a convenience store in Oslo, Ostlandet, Norway. One civilian was injured in the attack. The assailant, a Russian national, was arrested and claimed responsibility for the incident, telling police that the attack was meant to be part of a larger terrorist attack.
01/18/2019: A grenade detonated in Baidoa, Bay region, Somalia. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/18/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a ranger patrol near Todeng, Narathiwat, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two coordinated bombings targeting the patrol on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Barisan Revolusi Nasional (BRN).

01/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Macaguiling, Sultan Kudarat, Philippines. Two people were killed and one person was injured in the clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/18/2019: Assailants shot and killed Alhadji Bala Dauda, a businessperson, near Wum, North-West, Cameroon. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that separatists carried out the attack.
01/18/2019: Assailants attacked and killed a National Directorate of Security (NDS) member in Maymana, Faryab, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on two Ahle Sunnat Wal Jamaat (ASWJ) members and seminary teachers near Al-Asif Square in Karachi, Pakistan. Both individuals were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/19/2019: Assailants shot and then beheaded a civilian in Kajatian, Sulu, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) and noted that the victim was accused of being a police informant.

01/19/2019: A suicide bomber travelling in a vehicle detonated in Baidoa, Bay, Somalia. At least two people, including the assailant, were killed and one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/18/2019: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire targeting an African Union Mission (AMISOM) troop convoy on a road between Baidoa and Burhakaba in Bay, Somalia. An unknown number of Ethiopian soldiers were killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/19/2019: Assailants detonated an explosives-laden vehicle and stormed a military base housing Somali and United States forces in Bar Sanguni, Lower Juba, Somalia. At least 13 people, including four soldiers and nine assailants, were killed and an unknown number of other soldiers and assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/19/2019: Assailants attacked a wedding ceremony in Gharbi, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least one person was killed, three people were injured, and six others were abducted in the incident. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. A Taliban spokesperson claimed responsibility for the attack, though a second spokesperson later denied responsibility.
01/19/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated near a hospital in Idlib, Syria. At least eight people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/19/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) patrol in Anantnag, Jammu and Kashmir, India. A civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/19/2019: Assailants stabbed and killed Sheikh Abdoulaye Aziz Yattabare, an imam, in Bamako, Mali. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/19/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated outside a courthouse along Bishop street in Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two related incidents in Londonderry on this date; the vehicle was hijacked in a previous attack. The New Irish Republican Army claimed responsibility for the incident and warned people against working with the British.

01/19/2019: Assailants hijacked a pizza delivery vehicle along Quarry Street in Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related incidents in Londonderry on this date; the vehicle was later used in a car bombing. The New Irish Republican Army claimed responsibility for the incident and warned people against working with the British.

01/19/2019: An assailant infiltrated a police outpost as a cook and opened fire at police officers in Zhari district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. One officer was killed and three officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/19/2019: Assailants shot and killed Malik Mir Alam Afridi, an Aman Lashkars leader, in Hayatabad, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Police arrested two assailants who later confessed to carrying out the attack.

01/19/2019: Assailants opened fire on soldiers in Tacpao, Guihulngan, Negros Oriental, Philippines. An unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

01/19/2019: Assailants abducted several people, including Tun Nu, in Sittwe district, Rakhine, Myanmar. Nu, a pastor, was killed on February 1, 2019. The remaining hostages were killed on or before February 7, 2019. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).

01/19/2019: Assailants set fire to a truck in Bheriganga, Karnali, Nepal. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks on trucks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

01/19/2019: Assailants abducted Rafael Murua Manriquez in Santa Rosalia, Baja California Sur, Mexico. Manriquez, the Radiokashana FM director, was killed and his body was discovered on January 20, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/19/2019: An explosive device detonated near a Levies checkpost near Arandu, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One Levies officer was killed in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/19/2019: Assailants, including suicide bombers, equipped with gun trucks and explosives-laden vehicles, attacked Operation Lafiya Dole soldiers in Baga, Borno, Nigeria. At least five assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/18/2019: Assailants ambushed a military outpost in Puncak district, Papua, Indonesia. One soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/19/2019: Assailants set fire to a truck in Baraha Tal Karnali, Nepal. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks on trucks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).
01/19/2019: Gunmen attacked the village of Niondo, Mopti, Mali. One civilian was killed and several others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/19/2019: Assailants abducted soldier 'Ammar Naji al-'Arshani at the Al Birayn Checkpoint in Maafer, Taizz, Yemen. Al-Arshani was killed and his body returned to his family on January 25, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Abbas Brigade.

01/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on a United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) base in Aguelhoc, Kidal, Mali. At least 11 Chadian peacekeepers were killed and 24 were injured in the ensuing clash. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's visit to Chad and the renewal of Chadian-Israeli diplomatic relations.
01/20/2019: Assailants set fire to the Shaid Banafsha Girl's School in Farah, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/20/2019: Assailants abducted a civilian and ordered him to lead them to a Chinese construction site in Shimbirey, Garissa, Kenya. The hostage was released shortly thereafter. This was one of two coordinated attacks on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Al-Shabaab.

01/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on a Chinese construction site in Shimbirey, Garissa, Kenya. At least four people were injured in the ensuing clash. The assailants also sustained an unknown number of injuries. This was one of two coordinated attacks on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Al-Shabaab.

01/20/2019: An explosive device planted on a bus detonated in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. At least three people were killed and nine other people were injured in the blast. This was one of two similar bombings in Afrin on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

This was one of two similar bombings in Afrin on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

There were an unknown number of casualties in the blast. A second explosives-laden vehicle was discovered and defused in the area. The Abu Amarah Battalion claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/20/2019: Security forces discovered an unknown number of explosive devices in Marib, Yemen. The explosives detonated as demining personnel were transporting them for defusal. Five members of the Saudi Project for Landmine Clearance (MASAM) were killed and another employee was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

01/19/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the Transandino oil pipeline in Mallama district, Narino, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

01/20/2019: Assailants attacked the 27 Task Force Brigade and Special Forces School base in Buni Yadi, Yobe, Nigeria. At least four soldiers were injured while there were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Shekau faction of Boko Haram.

01/20/2019: Assailants attacked an area reserved for an American natural gas company and its partners in Maganja, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least one person was beheaded and a number of buildings were set on fire during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

01/20/2019: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Farah, Afghanistan. Five police officers were killed and three officers were taken hostage. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/20/2019: Assailants attacked police outposts in Surkhsang, Zabul, Afghanistan. Two police officers and seven assailants were killed while three officers and 12 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. 01/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in Sherk, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. At least two police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 01/20/2019: Assailants abducted Ehab al-Ansi, the secretary of the Hawak district council, in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

01/20/2019: Approximately 100 assailants attacked and burned down several houses and a Catholic seminary in Bare, Adamawa, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

The whereabouts of the remaining three hostages are unknown. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victims were targeted because they were police informants. Sources stated that the CPI-Maoists targeted the victims in retaliation for the death of over 40 Maoists in April 2018.

01/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on residents of Zaorosongou village in Mambere Kadei, Central African Republic. At least 13 people, including a gendarme and a cleric, were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Return, Reclamation, Rehabilitation (3R) and Fulani extremists.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

01/20/2019: An explosive device detonated as assailants were planting it in Kadaiha, Taizz, Yemen. At least two assailants were killed in blast. Two additional explosive devices were discovered at the scene. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

01/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on a civilian driver on a road in Shattimari, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. At least one person was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

summary: 01/21/2019: Assailants abducted four people, including two officers and two National Guard members, at an urban security post in Sucre, Caracas, Capital, Venezuela. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources characterized the assailants as mutinous National Guard members affiliated with "the extreme right."

Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Bhat was targeted because the group suspected that she had given information to the security forces that led to the killing of her cousin and HM member, Zeenat-ul-Islam.

01/31/2019: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Bernard Madamba y Fabros in Cabangan, Zambales, Philippines. Madamba, a former village councilor, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
