02/22/2019: Assailants equipped with firearms attacked Zabarmari, Borno, Nigeria. An unknown number of civilians were killed and several houses were set on fire in the incident. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.
02/22/2019: An assailant shot and killed Arman Mejia, a barangay chairperson, in City Heights, General Santos, South Cotabato, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/22/2019: Assailants attacked Garin-Amadou, near Bosso, Diffa, Niger. At least four people were killed, one person was injured, and seven people were missing. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

02/22/2019: Assailants equipped with an explosives-laden vehicle attacked the district center of Maruf district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.
02/22/2019: Assailants shot and killed two police officers deployed for elections in Botem, Rivers, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/22/2019: Assailants abducted Alwyn Mendoza, a Nueva Ecija Rep. Magnolia Rosa Caram Antonino staff member, in Cabanatuan City, Nueva Ecija, Philippines. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/22/2019: Assailants abducted Captain Vishal, a military captain, in Kiratpur, Punjab, India. Vishal's whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/22/2019: Assailants attacked the Yahiva tribe in Rahabah, Hajjah, Yemen. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, at least one tribe member was killed and three others were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/22/2019: Assailants attacked Hajur, Hajjah, Yemen. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/22/2019: At least ten assailants, including Adrian Hong Chang, stormed the North Korean Embassy in Madrid city, Madrid, Spain. At least two employees were injured and several were held hostage in the attack. Free Joseon claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/22/2019: Assailants fired a mortar targeting the Red Sea mills in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/23/2019: Assailants fired a thermal missile at the vehicle of 'Abduh Sanad al-Marqashi in Mudiyah district, Abyan, Yemen. Al-Marqashi, a commander, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2019: Assailants attacked a passenger vehicle in Mucojo, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least four people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).
02/23/2019: Assailants attacked Matapata, near Palma, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. One civilian was killed and posthumously beheaded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/23/2019: Assailants attacked Quelimane, Zambezia, Mozambique. Three civilians were killed and 16 others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle carrying assailants intending to carry out an attack detonated prematurely in Ceel Cadde district, Gedo, Somalia. At least 10 assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.
02/23/2019: Assailants shot and killed Osman Elmi Boqore, a Member of Parliament, in Kaaraan, Mogadishu, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/23/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a military patrol near the Golden Aero School in the Mir Ali, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Three people were injured in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2019: Assailants armed with projectiles and firearms attacked Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. At least one soldier was killed and four other soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2019: Assailants opened fire on voters at a polling station in Amukpe, Delta, Nigeria. At least three people were killed and two were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2019: Assailants attacked Swedish journalist Annika H. Rothstein and her security team along the border in San Antonio del Tachira, Tachira, Venezuela. The victims were robbed and held hostage for a short period of time before being released. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to supporters of Nicolas Maduro.

02/23/2019: Assailants equipped with firearms attacked Gaidam, Yobe, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of two related attacks in Yobe on this date. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/23/2019: Assailants attacked Buni Yadi, Yobe, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of two related attacks in Yobe on this date. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/23/2019: Assailants fired a rockets that landed and detonated in Gwoza, Borno, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties but a mosque was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Boko Haram.
02/23/2019: Assailants shot and killed Alfonso Donaire IV, a San Fernando town councilor, in Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/23/2019: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Sadiqabad, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel in Fadhah, Al Bayda, Yemen. At least five soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

02/23/2019: Assailants opened fire on a Syrian refugee family at their residence in Gazi, Istanbul, Turkey. At least one refugee was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/23/2019: Assailants set attempted to attack Abdul Gani Vakil in Shutloo Rafiabad, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Vakil, a Peoples Conference (PC) leader, was unharmed but his car was set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a minibus near Yelenovka, Donetsk, Ukraine. Two civilians were killed and one other was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2019: Assailants abducted an Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) staff member and youth corps member in Ndiokolo, Anambra, Nigeria. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/23/2019: Assailants shot and killed Romeuel Medina, a councilor candidate, in Cataingan, Masbate, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2019: Assailants opened fire on Momwon Omowo Etete in Asarama, Rivers, Nigeria. Etete, an All Progressives Congress (APC) leader, was killed along with two of his relatives. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/23/2019: Assailants shot and killed an ex-officio member of APC Rivers State Executive committee in Ajakaja, Rivers, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2019: Assailants attacked three Popular Mobilization Force (PMF) members attempting to evacuate the bodies of people killed in a previous attack near Tharthar, Al Anbar, Iraq. The three PMF members were injured in the attack. This was one of two incidents in Ramadi on the same day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in Khwaja Ghar district, Takhar, Afghanistan. summary: 02/24/2019: Assailants fired rockets at a khat market in Al-Buq, Saada, Yemen. At least 12 soldiers were killed and 60 people were injured in the attack. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2019: Assailants opened fire on the positions of the Popular Resistance Committee in Abbaysah, Kushar, Hajjah, Yemen. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. 02/24/2019: Assailants, including suicide bombers, opened fire on Boulikoro military base and detonated an explosives-laden vehicle in Koulikoro, Mali. 02/24/2019: Assailants opened fire on municipality workers in Torkham, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. One official was killed and a second official was injured in the attack. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 02/24/2019: Assailants attacked a security post in Dioungani, Mopti, Mali. Two soldiers were injured and seven assailants were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel in Malagim district, Al Bayda, Yemen. The blast killed and injured an unknown number of soldiers. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

02/24/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated at al-Sa'a Square in Idlib, Syria. At least one person was killed and several other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/24/2019: Assailants attacked police officers escorting election results in Eredo, Ogun, Nigeria. At least one police officer was killed and two people, including a police officer and a driver, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2019: Assailants opened fire on Nigerian soldiers in Abonnema, Rivers, Nigeria. At least seven people, including one soldier and six assailants, were killed and two other people were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2019: Assailants attacked the Independent National Electoral office (INEC) and set ballot boxes on fire in Ijebu-Ijesha, Osun, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2019: Assailants attacked Mamove, 18 km west of Oicha, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least two people were killed and an unknown number of others were abducted in the attack. Additionally, eight houses and a health facility were set on fire by the assailants. 14 of the hostages were released on March 3, 2019 and the 22 others were released on March 5, 2019. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

02/25/2019: An assailant shot and killed a soldier, identified as Ahmad 'Ali Sa'id, after pulling him off a bus on Jamal Street, al Masbah roundabout, Taizz, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
02/25/2019: Assailants shot and killed Dr. Sonia Rosero, a local political candidate, in Puerto Asis, Putumayo, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/25/2019: Assailants entered Longa Hermosa Hacienda and threatened employees and the supervisor in Santa Monica, Negros Oriental, Philippines. The assailants then set fire to five tractors and a Trio weapon carrier. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2019: Assailants attacked the Santa Clara International Corporation hydropower plant and set fire to 12 pieces of equipment in Malvar, Oriental Mindoro, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the incident. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the Sta. Clara International Corporation hydropower plant was targeted because "the NPA does not allow plunder and environmental destruction in the island of Mindoro."

02/25/2019: Assailants opened fire on a group of people cleaning roadsides in Afgoye district, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least nine people were killed and three people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

02/25/2019: Assailants attacked a General Service Unit Camp in Daba, Mandera, Kenya. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

02/25/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) members in Tharthar, Al Anbar, Iraq. Three members were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 02/25/2019: Assailants shot and killed a civilian and a soldier in Beledweyne, Hiiraan, Somalia. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2019: Assailants attacked Baiji Refinery in Baiji, Saladin, Iraq. An unknown number of refinery personnel were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 02/25/2019: Assailants shot and killed two Tehsil Municipal Administration (TMA) employees in Dera Ismail Khan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2019: Assailants threw an incendiary device at Faizane Mariam Masjid Mosque along Effingham Road in Durban, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to anti-Muslim extremists.

02/25/2019: Assailants armed with knives, machetes, and fuel set fire to an Ebola Treatment Center in Katwa, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least one patient was killed and one other patient was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Mayi Mayi.

02/25/2019: Assailants opened fire on police officers in Sumpong, Malaybalay, Bukidnon, Philippines. At least one officer was killed and another was wounded in the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for Martial Law being implemented in Mindanao.
02/25/2019: Assailants identified and arrested two suicide bombers in Peshawar district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2019: Assailants abducted five people in Garissa, Kenya. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Al-Shabaab may have been involved in the attack.

02/25/2019: Assailants attacked Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) troops near a buffer zone around Idlib, Syria. At least five soldiers and nine assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Hurras al-Din.

02/25/2019: A landmine detonated against a vehicle carrying traders traveling between Koro and Dinangourou in Mopti, Mali. Six people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Almar district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least three assailants and two soldiers were killed while 11 people, including six soldiers and five assailants, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/26/2019: Assailants abducted two police officers, Naret Iedthong and Ruswaidee Samae, from a tea shop and stole their vehicle in Mu two, Bukit, Cho-airong, Narathiwat, Thailand. Both officers were killed and their bodies were discovered shortly after the kidnapping, and their vehicle was set on fire in a nearby village. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of anti-government extremists.

02/26/2019: A roadside bomb detonated targeting a Thai Rangers patrol in Ban Ubae, Bannang Sata, Yala, Thailand. A second explosive device was discovered nearby and was safely defused. A ranger, Angkharn Ruenkham, was killed and two others, including a ranger and a civilian, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/26/2019: An explosive device detonated in Nuaimiya, Fallujah, Al Anbar, Iraq. At least three construction workers were killed and three were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 02/26/2019: Assailants opened fire on a 1st Military Region soldier (Salih Mudandin) at a gas station in Seiyun, Hadramawt, Yemen. The soldier was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least 40 people were killed, an unknown number of people were injured, and two people were missing across the four attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, source attributed the incidents to Fulani extremists.

At least 40 people were killed, an unknown number of people were injured, and two people were missing across the four attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, source attributed the incidents to Fulani extremists.

At least 40 people were killed, an unknown number of people were injured, and two people were missing across the four attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, source attributed the incidents to Fulani extremists.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists. The funeral was for Boukary Guindo, who had been abducted by assailants some time prior.
