gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 02/26/2019: Assailants opened fire on a Rashtriya Rifles camp in Khudwani, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/26/2019: An explosive device detonated at the residence of a military major, identified as Major Kyaw Swar, in Buthidaung, Rakhine, Myanmar. Swar's wife, Nan Moh Moh Zaw, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/26/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in Yal, Papua, Indonesia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka) claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/26/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle was discovered and defused in Afrin district, Aleppo, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/26/2019: An explosive device detonated at the Office of the General Administration Department compound near Kyaukphyu, Rakhine, Myanmar. At least eight people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/26/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at a police base in Bondhere, Mogadishu, Somalia. One person was killed and two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/26/2019: Assailants attacked a Imghad Tuareg Self-Defense Group and Allies (GATIA) patrol in Gourma-Rharous, Timbuktu, Mali. Three GATIA members were killed and four others were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 02/26/2019: Assailants abducted two people in Goranah, Taizz, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/27/2019: Assailants abducted Yasmin and Haifa' Farhan al-Zarari from Juranah, Maqbanah, Taizz, Yemen. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group has claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/27/2019: Assailants abducted 14 local non-governmental (NGO) aid workers in Buura, Gedo, Somalia. At least five of the hostages escaped shortly after the abduction. The status of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

02/27/2019: Assailants launched balloons carrying an explosive device from Gaza into Eshkol, Southern, Israel. The device exploded in mid-air near a house, causing damage to the house. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/27/2019: Assailants set fire to an Ebola Treatment Center in Butembo, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least one police officer was killed in the attack. An unknown number of people were reported missing and their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Mai Mai Mazembe Militia.

02/27/2019: Assailants stopped a bus and forced a passenger to disembark in Raynar, Chhattisgarh, India. The passenger was shot and killed shortly thereafter. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists and noted that the victim was accused of being a police informant.

02/27/2019: Assailants opened fire on the motorcycle of Rubencio C. Salamorin, a village chairman, in Don Alejandro, Agusan del Sur province, Philippines. Salamorin was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/28/2019: Assailants looted and set fire to an unknown number of residences belonging to members of the Afghan Local Police (ALP) in Taghai Khwaja, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three related attacks on houses in Sangcharak district on this day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/28/2019: Assailants looted and set fire to an unknown number of residences belonging to members of the Afghan Local Police (ALP) in Tewar, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three related attacks on houses in Sangcharak district on this day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/27/2019: Assailants fired mortars that landed on houses in Jidaidat al-Shatt, Diyala, Iraq. Two civilians were killed and three civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/27/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a police convoy near Ponnagyun, Rakhine, Myanmar. Two police officers were killed and two officers were injured. Following the blast, police officers opened fire. It is unknown if the ensuing gunfire resulted in assailant casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).
02/27/2019: An explosive device detonated in Mazari Sharif, Balkh, Afghanistan. Six civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/27/2019: Assailants attacked a police van in Tir Pul, Herat, Afghanistan. At least three police officers were killed and another officer was injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/27/2019: Assailants raided a village and detonated explosive devices targeting 13 homes in Namerah, Hajjah, Yemen. There were an unknown number of civilian casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/28/2019: An explosive device detonated in Habur, Shaqab, Taizz, Yemen. At least one person was killed in the blast. No group has claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/28/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated outside the Faculty of Science of the University of Mosul in Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. At least one person was killed and four people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/28/2019: Assailants opened fire on a teacher in Karak district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The teacher, identified as Islam Badshah, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/28/2019: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting the Maka Almukarramah hotel and the nearby home of Appeals Court Chief Judge Abshir Omar in Waberi, Mogadishu, Somalia. Following the blast, assailants sieged the nearby Shideye Building, opening fire on civilians and soldiers and taking at least four civilians hostage. The fate of the hostages is unknown. At least 26 people, including an assailant and two soldiers, were killed and 131 people were injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks on hotels that occurred in Mogadishu on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/28/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated near the near the Nassa Hablood Hotel in Waberi, Mogadishu, Somalia. It is unclear if the attack resulted in casualties. This was one of two related attacks on hotels that occurred in Mogadishu on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/28/2019: Assailants set fire to six pieces of CAMIA Construction Company heavy construction equipment in Agani, Cagayan, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

02/28/2019: Assailants opened fire on police personnel in the 4th police district of Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least three people, including one assailant and two police officers, were killed and one officer was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/28/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting an Iraqi Volunteer Forces vehicle in Hatra, Nineveh, Iraq. Four volunteer fighters were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/28/2019: Security forces intercepted at least 19 letters containing a poisonous substance at a post office in Tunis, Tunisia. The letters were addressed to journalists, politicians, and trade unionists. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

02/28/2019: Assailants looted and set fire to an unknown number of residences belonging to members of the Afghan Local Police (ALP) in Khider, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three related attacks on houses in Sangcharak district on this day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/28/2019: Assailants opened fire on Justice Mohammad Ayub in Hayatabad, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Ayub, a Peshawar High Court (PHC) judge, was injured along with his driver. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for judges issuing death and imprisonment sentences to TTP members.

02/28/2019: Assailants opened fire on a 57th Infantry Battalion vehicle along the national highway in Sambolawan, Maguindanao, Philippines. At least two soldiers, identified as Nelier Jhon Pinti and Junard Estribor, were killed and two other people, including one soldier, identified as Muqtadir Sampulna, and one civilian, identified as Resty Alvarico, were injured in the assault. The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for military operations.

02/28/2019: Assailants opened fire on Verande Lardera while he was riding his motorcycle along Sinsuat Avenue in front of Superama Hyper Market in Cotabato City, Maguindanao, Philippines. Lardera, a 37th IB staff sergeant, was killed in the assault. The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the death of a BIFM member by the military on 27 February, 2019.

02/28/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at the residence of a former police officer in Cotabato City, Maguindanao, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

02/28/2019: Assailants shelled al-Nasir quarter in At Tuhayat district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least five children were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

02/28/2019: Assailants attacked Bukondo, Kasai-Central, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The assailants stole goods and abducted 13 people during the attack. Three hostages were released shortly after the kidnapping. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/28/2019: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Balkh, Afghanistan. At least five police officers were killed in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/28/2019: An explosive device detonated in front of a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) office in Thelassery, Kerala, India. At least three cleaners were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/28/2019: Assailants attacked Argahandab district, Zabul, Afghanistan. Security forces responded, killing 28 assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/28/2019: Assailants shot and killed Jessie Rebay, a Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) member, in Catubig, Northern Samar, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to New People's Army (NPA).

02/28/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the Cano Limon-Covenas oil pipeline in Saravena, Arauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties, but the pipeline was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/28/2019: Assailants raided Premium Megastructures Aggregates construction firm in Gloria, Oriental Mindoro, Philippines. A police officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

02/28/2019: Assailants opened fire on an army camp in Mbiame, North-West, Cameroon. This was one of two attacks in Northwest on this day. At least one soldier and one assailant were killed across attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to separatists.

02/28/2019: Assailants opened fire on an army camp in Bafut, North-West, Cameroon. This was one of two attacks in Northwest on this day. At least one soldier and one assailant were killed across attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to separatists.

02/28/2019: An assailant armed with a firearm smashed the windows of Al-Rahman Mosque during prayers in Dayton, Ohio, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Anti-Muslim extremists.

03/01/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a G5 Sahel vehicle in Boulkessy, Mopti, Mali. At least nine Malian soldiers were killed and an unknown number of soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/01/2019: A suicide bomber detonated at a restaurant in ad-Dhabit neighborhood, Idlib, Syria. In addition to the assailant, at least seven people were killed and 22 other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/01/2019: Assailants, including suicide bombers, attacked the 215 Maiwand Corps at Camp Shorab in Shur Ab, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least nine assailants and 26 soldiers were killed and 15 people were injured in the ensuing clash. In addition, an unknown number of soldiers were taken hostage; their whereabouts are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident. Source also attributed the attack to Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM).

02/28/2019: Assailants attacked security posts in Arikalik, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least 15 assailants and 15 other people, including soldiers, police officers, and militia members, were killed, while 15 people, including five security forces members and 10 ANA troops, and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/01/2019: Assailants opened fire on 4th Scout Ranger Battalion soldiers in San Roque, San Miguel, Surigao del Sur, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

02/28/2019: Assailants shot and killed Corporal Ekamarin Sriraksa, a Territorial Defense Volunteers (TDV) member, along Bacho-Ban Thon Road, Bacho, Narathiwat, Thailand. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

03/01/2019: An explosive device detonated outside the residence of Colonel Mohamed Ali Ma'ow in Beledweyne, Hiiraan, Somalia. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. It is unclear if Colonel Ma'ow, the regional chief of prisons, was among the casualties. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/03/2019: Assailants attempted to open fire on an electoral delegate in Wadajir, Mogadishu, Somalia. There were no reported casualties as the assailants' weapon malfunctioned. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that the target was also selling khat.

03/01/2019: Assailants set fire to construction equipment in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

03/01/2019: Assailants attacked a military convoy in Duaba, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least 10 security personnel and seven assailants were killed while four security personnel and five assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. In addition, five soldiers were taken hostage; their whereabouts are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/01/2019: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Laman, Badghis, Afghanistan. Soldiers from a nearby army post arrived to provide support to the police. At least two police officers and one soldier were killed while three soldiers were wounded in the ensuing clash. In addition, four assailants were killed and seven assailants were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
03/01/2019: An anti-personnel mine was discovered and defused in Ginatilan, North Cotabato, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/01/2019: Assailants attacked Hays district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/01/2019: Assailants fired mortars targeting pro-government forces in Durayhami, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/01/2019: Assailants opened fire on Joint Resistance forces in along Sanaa road in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/01/2019: Assailants fired mortars at Joint Resistance Forces near the Thabet Brothers' Compound north of Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/01/2019: Assailants fired mortars at Joint Resistance Forces in Al-Jah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/01/2019: A sniper shot and killed a Joint Resistance Forces in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/01/2019: Assailants shot and killed a town councilor candidate, identified as Bartolome Avenido, near his residence in Purok 4, San Jose, Bohol, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/01/2019: Gunmen attacked a Social Democratic Party (SDP) campaign convoy in Oke Aro, Akure, Ondo, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties. An unknown group claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that "no campaign would hold in the area."

03/01/2019: Assailants abducted Octavio Sánchez Correa, a merchant, in Riosucio district, Choco, Colombia. The hostage was released on December 24, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

03/02/2019: An explosive device detonated along Amlar-Lariyar road in Amlar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No casualties were reported, though three houses were damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM). Sources noted that the device was intended to target security forces.
03/02/2019: Two explosive devices were discovered and defused in So Bulak, Lower Olave, Agusan del Norte, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on 1003rd Infantry Brigade soldiers in Cawayan, Bukidnon, Philippines. One assailant was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

03/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on 3rd Special Forces Battalion soldiers in Mabuhay, Agusan del Sur, Philippines. At least one soldier, identified as Corporal Ambert C. Maramag, was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

03/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on 30th Infantry Battalion soldiers in Katikoyan, Camam-onan, Surigao del Norte, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
03/02/2019: An explosive device detonated in Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. One police officer, Captain Mohamed Nour Bashir, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/02/2019: Assailants attacked Tancoulle, near Koro, Mopti, Mali. Three assailants were killed and two defense militia members were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Dozo militia.

03/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on a military checkpoint in Abonnema, Rivers, Nigeria. At least two soldiers were killed and an unknown number of other soldiers were wounded. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/02/2019: Assailants fired mortars at the National Electoral Commission in Warta Nabada, Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three coordinated attacks targeting government buildings in Mogadishu on this day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

03/02/2019: Assailants fired mortars at the Villa Hargeysa in Warta Nabada, Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three coordinated attacks targeting government buildings in Mogadishu on this day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

03/02/2019: Assailants launched mortars at the Presidential Palace in Warta Nabada, Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three coordinated attacks targeting government buildings in Mogadishu on this day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

03/02/2019: Assailants hurled Molotov cocktails at police guarding the Turkish consulate along Agiou Dimitriou Road in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to anarchists.
03/02/2019: Assailants threw petrol bombs at a police station in Koukaki, Athens, Attica, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/02/2019: Assailants opened fire in Agabge, Gwer West, Benue, Nigeria. At least seven civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

03/03/2019: Assailants attacked police checkpoints in Dawlatabad district, Balkh, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and two were injured in the ensuing clash. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the district on the same night. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

03/03/2019: Assailants ambushed police forces on their way to respond to an earlier attack in Dawlatabad district, Balkh, Afghanistan. Seven security forces were killed and five were injured in the ensuing clash, while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the district on the same night. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/03/2019: Assailants abducted Henry Awah, the Northwest Regional Delegate for Ministry of Environment, Nature Protection, and Sustainable Development, and his wife in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. Awah and his wife were released by March 9, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/03/2019: Assailants abducted Franckline Ngwa Che, a senior government official, in Buea, South-West, Cameroon. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/03/2019: Assailants attacked an unknown number of security checkposts in Dawlatabad district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least six assailants were killed and three assailants were injured as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/03/2019: Assailants opened fire on the driver of a fuel tanker at an illegal highway checkpoint in Jawzjan, Afghanistan. Four people, including the driver, were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/03/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at the residence of a Jammu and Kashmir Police officer in Awantipora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM).

03/03/2019: Assailants shot and killed Corporal Sahelbasar Alaja, a 90th Infantry Battalion soldier, in Broce, Datu Odin Sinsuat, Maguindanao, Philippines. The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/03/2019: Assailants, including suicide bombers, attacked a Syrian Army checkpoint near Masasineh, Hamah, Syria. This was one of two coordinated incidents targeting checkpoints near Masasineh on the same day. At least 20 soldiers and five assailants were killed and an unknown number of soldiers and assailants were injured across both ensuing clashes. Ansar al-Tawhid claimed responsibility and stated that the attacks were carried out in revenge for civilian deaths in Hamah and Idlib governorates.

03/03/2019: Assailants, including suicide bombers, attacked a Syrian Army checkpoint near Masasineh, Hamah, Syria. This was one of two coordinated incidents targeting checkpoints near Masasineh on the same day. At least 20 soldiers and five assailants were killed and an unknown number of soldiers and assailants were injured across both ensuing clashes. Ansar al-Tawhid claimed responsibility and stated that the attacks were carried out in revenge for civilian deaths in Hamah and Idlib governorates.

03/03/2019: Assailants attacked ANP checkposts in Nawbara, Farah, Afghanistan. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

03/03/2019: Security forces discovered and defused an unknown number of explosive devices in Chorbora, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

03/03/2019: Assailants attacked Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) positions in Lattakia, Syria. An unknown number of assailants were killed and two soldiers were injured in the incident. Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility for the attack.
03/03/2019: Assailants opened fire on a Kurdish Peshmerga soldier outside is house in Arbil, Iraq. One soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/03/2019: An explosive device detonated prematurely as assailants were planting it in Khowaja Shahab, Herat, Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
03/03/2019: Assailants launched a rocket at Tariq Post in Angoor Ada, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/03/2019: Assailants threw explosive devices over the Gazan border fence in Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the attack, No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/04/2019: Assailants detonated a stun grenade at the residence of a Ministry of Electricity engineer in Basra, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/04/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the Cano Limon-Covenas oil pipeline in Saravena district, Arauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties, but the pipeline was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

03/04/2019: A magnetic explosive device attached to the vehicle of Asadullah Mashouri detonated in Kandahar, Afghanistan. Mashouri, a Wolesi Jirga candidate, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/04/2019: Assailants attacked a security checkpost in Qarghan Tapa, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least 10 security personnel were killed and 10 were injured in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. Seven security personnel were abducted in the attack and ensuing clash. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/04/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated near a bus terminal in Chaman, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least three people were injured in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/04/2019: An explosive device detonated along a train track in Dera Murad Jamali, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/02/2019: Assailants shelled houses in At Tuhayat district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least three civilians were killed and six civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/04/2019: Assailants rammed their vehicle into Israeli security personnel in Nimah, West Bank. Two assailants were killed and three people, including a soldier, a border police officer, and an assailant, were injured in the attack and ensuing clash. This was one of two similar attacks carried out by the same assailants on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

03/04/2019: Assailants threw incendiary devices at an Israeli checkpoint on a highway near Kafr Nima, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two similar attacks carried out by the same assailants on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.
03/04/2019: Assailants shot and killed a Somali National Army (SNA) officer, in Beledweyne, Hiiraan, Somalia. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/04/2019: Assailants attacked a border security post along the Afghan border near Loi Shalman, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. An unknown number of assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/04/2019: Assailants shot and killed Rizwan Iqbal, an Assistant Sub Inspector (ASI), in Orangi, Karachi, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/04/2019: An explosive device detonated in front of Deluxe Market on Jamal street in Taizz, Yemen. One civilian was killed and eight others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/04/2019: Assailants attacked a bazaar in Yangi Qala district, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least two people were killed and seven people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.
03/04/2019: An explosive device detonated in Dali, Ad Dali, Yemen. Four civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/04/2019: Assailants abducted 57 sugarcane plantation workers near Man Kaung bridge in Kutkai, Shan, Myanmar. All of the hostages had either been released or had escaped as of March 12, 2019. The Kachin Independence Army (KIA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/04/2019: Assailants armed with guns and machetes attacked the residence of Dr. George Abang-Ekpungu, a former commissioner, in Kakwagum, Boki, Cross River, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/04/2019: Security forces identified, shot and killed an assailant who was attempting to attack police officers in the 5th police district of Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/04/2019: An assailant opened fire on Mahmor Amputo Barahim in Port Area, Isabela City, Basilan, Philippines. Barahim, the Tong Umus village chair, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, an individual was arrested on March 6, 2019 in connection with the attack.

03/04/2019: Assailants set fire to the vehicle of Serhiy Zolotarev, a council member, in Derhachi district, Kharkiv, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/04/2019: Assailants threw an incendiary device targeting the garage of Andriy Pustovoytov, a council member, in Derhachi district, Kharkiv, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/05/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a gas pipeline between Loti gas field and Pir Koh gas plant in Dera Bugti, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. A Baloch Republican Army (BRA) member was arrested and confessed to carrying out the attack.

03/05/2019: Assailants armed with machetes attacked Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) soldiers in Kitakandya, east of Butembo, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Three people were killed, including two soldiers and one assailant, and one assailant and one soldier were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mayi Mayi.

03/05/2019: Assailants attacked a military base in Busar, Gedo, Somalia. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

03/05/2019: An explosives-laden package detonated when a worker opened it at the Compass House office block of Heathrow Airport in London, England, United Kingdom. There were no reported injuries. This was one of four related incidents to occur over a two day period in England and Scotland. The New Irish Republican Army claimed responsibility for the attacks.

03/05/2019: An explosives-laden package was discovered in the post room of Waterloo Train Station in London, England, United Kingdom. The British Transport Police were dispatched and safely defused the device. This was one of four related incidents to occur over a two day period in England and Scotland. The New Irish Republican Army claimed responsibility for the attacks.

03/05/2019: An explosives-laden package was discovered in the City Aviation office block of London City Airport in London, England, United Kingdom. The police were dispatched and safely defused the device. This was one of four related incidents to occur over a two day period in England and Scotland. The New Irish Republican Army claimed responsibility for the attacks.

03/05/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Asiab Gorg, Balkh, Afghanistan. During the attack, the assailants fired a mortar that struck a civilian residence, killing three civilians and injuring two civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
03/06/2019: Assailants shot and killed a child in Khan Aqa, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/05/2019: An assailant on a motorcycle opened fire on a border forces outpost in the 3rd police district of Kandahar, Afghanistan. The outpost commander, Haji Mandi, was killed along with his bodyguard. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/05/2019: An assailant armed with a ceramic knife stabbed guards at a prison in Conde-sur-Sarthe, Normandy, France. Two guards were injured in the attack. Both the assailant and his partner were shot by police after they barricaded themselves and his partner later died of her wounds. Michael Chiolo, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he carried out the suicide attack in retaliation for the death of Cherif Chekatt, the perpetrator of the December 2018 Strasbourg attack. Chekatt had pledged allegiance to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

03/05/2019: Assailants armed with a wooden stick and a metal pipe attacked Ekachai Hongkangwan in Bangkok, Thailand. It is unclear whether Hongkangwan, an anti-junta activist, was harmed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
03/05/2019: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Es Nari, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Three civilians, including a teacher, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/05/2019: Assailants set on fire the vehicle of councilor Oleksandr Stepanenko in Bilhorod-Dnistrovskyi, Odesa, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, the victim believed the attack was in response to his work protecting the seaside in the resort village of Zatoka.

03/05/2019: Assailants set fire to a vehicle outside the ward office in Gangadev, Rolpa, Province 5, Nepal. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suspected the involvement of the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

03/05/2019: Assailants attacked a vehicle with stones in Tribeni, Rolpa, Province 5, Nepal. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suspected the involvement of the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

03/05/2019: Assailants abducted an off-duty soldier in San Lorenzo, Arauca, Colombia. The hostage was released on December 2, 2019. The 10th Guadalupe Salcedo Front of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 03/06/2019: Assailants, including suicide bombers, attacked a construction company in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least 22 people, including five assailants, were killed and nine people were injured in the attack. The victims included civilians and a member of the National Directorate of Security (NDS). Additionally, security forces safely defused an explosives-laden vehicle and two suicide vests at the scene. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 03/06/2019: Assailants attacked a Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) convoy along Makhmur-Nineveh road in Makhmur, Nineveh, Iraq. At least six soldiers were killed and another 31 were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/06/2019: Assailants opened fire on election delegates in Boondheere, Mogadishu, Somalia. One delegate, Bahsan Bolay, was killed and another person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/06/2019: An explosive device detonated at the Transandino crude oil pipeline in Coataquer, Mallama, Narino, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

03/06/2019: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting a police patrol in Tawakol, Diyala, Iraq. At least one police officer was killed and four officers were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/06/2019: An explosives-laden package was discovered in the mailroom of Glasgow University in Glasgow, Scotland, United Kingdom. Police were dispatched and safely detonated the device. This was one of four related incidents to occur over a two day period in England and Scotland. The New Irish Republican Army claimed responsibility for the attacks.

03/00/2019: Sometime between March 3, 2019 and March 9, 2019, assailants assaulted Nasir al-Na'as in Al-Khums, Murqub, Libya. Al-Na'as, an House of Representatives member, was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Khums Revolutionaries' Union.

03/06/2019: Assailants attacked security outposts in Asia Khan, Balkh, Afghanistan. Two soldiers and a police officer were killed. This was one of two coordinated attacks near the village on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/06/2019: Assailants ambushed security forces responding to a previous attack in Asia Khan, Balkh, Afghanistan. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. This was one of two coordinated attacks near the village on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/06/2019: Assailants attacked Dara-e-Kalan village in Hazrati Sultan district, Samangan, Afghanistan. Police forces responded to the incident. Two police officers were killed and one officer was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/06/2019: Assailants attempted to extort food and money from the staff of Upavan private resort in Lakkidi, Kerala, India. Police officers responded, killing at least one assailant and injuring a second assailant. Two police officers were also injured in the ensuing clash. Additionally, an unknown number of people were taken hostage at the resort and rescued a short time later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

03/06/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting farmers in Addamari, 20 km from Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. At least five people were killed and another 20 were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

03/06/2019: Assailants shelled Zeid Moshki, Taizz, Yemen. Five civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/06/2019: Gunmen attacked a Nigerian military base along Maiduguri-Dikwa Road in Ngwom, Mafa, Borno, Nigeria. At least five assailants were killed in the incident. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.
03/06/2019: Gunmen attacked Kubo, Borno, Nigeria. An assailant was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

03/06/2019: Assailants abducted at least 16 villagers from Pansay area in Namhkam, Shan, Myanmar. Eight hostages were injured and released on March 16, 2019; the fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. The Ta'ang National Liberation Army (TNLA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated, "We arrested them for growing, selling, and buying opium."

03/06/2019: Assailants opened fire on Joint Resistance Forces positions in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/06/2019: A sniper shot and injured a member of the Joint Resistance Forces on Khamsin street in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/06/2019: Assailants armed with sticks beat two vendors in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, India. The two traders were injured in the attack. Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victims were targeted because the group believed they were terrorists.

03/06/2019: Assailants abducted three Bhartia Infra Projects Limited road construction workers along NH-2 between Kangpokpi and Changoubung in Manipur, India. All three hostages were released on March 10, 2019. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Reformation (NSCN-R).

03/07/2019: Assailants set fire to a truck, a bulldozer and a tractor in Imurung, Cagayan, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the arson. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

03/07/2019: Four assailants threatened Senior Master Sergeant Humprey Wah Teves in an attempt to steal his firearm in Bantolinao, Negros Oriental, Philippines. The police officer managed to open fire on the assailants, killing one and injuring another. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

03/07/2019: An assailant threw a hand grenade at General Bus Stand in Jammu, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two civilians were killed and 31 civilians were injured in the blast. Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/07/2019: Assailants fired mortars at a ceremony commemorating the anniversary of the death of a Shia Hazara leader in Dasht-e-Barchi, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least 11 civilians were killed and 95 people, including eight bodyguards, were injured in the attack. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to the Taliban, which the group denied.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 03/06/2019: Assailants attacked Afghan National Army checkposts in Khwaja Pesta, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Three soldiers were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/07/2019: An explosive-laden vehicle detonated in front of Dalsan restaurant near the presidential palace in Xamar Weyne, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least four people were killed and nine people were injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/07/2019: Assailants parked a truck to block a highway between Saravena and Tame in El Oasis, Arauca, Colombia. When soldiers arrived to move the vehicles, explosive device detonated, injuring five soldiers. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

03/07/2019: Assailants attacked a police station in Fortul, Arauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

03/07/2019: An explosive device detonated on a bridge between Saravena and Fortul in Arauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

03/07/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Hussainkhel, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and one officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/07/2019: Assailants opened fire on an Army detachment in Tuka, Maguindanao, Philippines. At least three people, including two soldiers and a civilian, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

03/07/2019: Assailants armed with projectiles and firearms attacked security outposts in Aq Tapa, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least seven security personnel and 8 assailants were killed and eight security personnel and 10 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The victims included Afghan Local Police (ALP) officers, Afghan National Army (ANA) soldiers, and pro-government militia members. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/07/2019: Assailants attacked a military base in Hayatan, Balkh, Afghanistan. One soldier and two assailants were killed and two soldiers were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/07/2019: Assailants equipped with explosive devices opened fire at a police checkpoint along Ring Road in Giza, Egypt. At least three assailants were killed and one police officer was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Hasam Movement.

03/07/2019: Approximately 50 assailants attacked Indonesian soldiers with arrows, spears, and firearms in Yigi, Mugi, Papua, Indonesia. At least three soldiers and an assailant were killed and unknown number of others were wounded in the attack. The Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka) claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/07/2019: Gunmen attacked Tegourou, 12 km outside Bandiagara, Mopti, Mali. One person was wounded. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/07/2019: An explosive device detonated at a house in Craigavon, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/06/2019: Assailants ambushed and opened fire on a vehicle carrying Macario Cruz Gutierrez in Chilton, Chiapas, Mexico. Gutierrez, the former mayor of Pantleho, was injured along with his wife. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/07/2019: Assailants opened fire on Nnamdi Nsorom, an aide to the Imo West Senatorial Candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), in Owerri, Imo, Nigeria. Nsorom was shot and wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/07/2019: Explosive devices were planted at the top of a mountain to cause an avalanche on the vehicle of President Azali Assoumani in Sima, Nzwani, Comoros. President Assoumani was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/07/2019: Assailants flogged two civilians in Sangcharak district, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident and accused the victims of adultery.

03/07/2019: Security forces discovered and defused five explosive devices in Sasang forest, Latehar district, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists and noted that the devices were likely intended to target security forces.

03/07/2019: Assailants attacked a ranger in Virunga National Park in North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The ranger was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/06/2019: Assailants shelled Joint Resistance Forces positions in Al-Jah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/07/2019: Assailants raided women's clothing stores, destroyed mannequins, and abducted store owners in Sawan, Sanaa, Yemen. The owners were released shortly after the abduction. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/07/2019: Assailants opened fire on Jimnu Ladja Hamad in Isabela City, Basilan, Philippines. Hamad, a barangay chairperson, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/07/2019: Assailants opened fire on Mohammad Ismael and his wife, Jackilyn, both Department of Environment and Natural Resources employees, along Callejon Drive in Zamboanga City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Ismael was killed and Jackilyn was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/07/2019: Security forces identified and opened fire on an assailant attempting to plant explosive devices along a road in Beledweyne, Hiiraan Somalia. The assailant was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

03/07/2019: Assailants launched rockets at 22nd May Hospital in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two similar attacks targeting Hudaydah on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/07/2019: Assailants launched rockets at Thabit Ikhwan Industrial Complex in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two similar attacks targeting Hudaydah on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/08/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a gas pipeline near the Sui gas field in Dera Bugti, Balochistan, Pakistan. Four people were killed and two were injured in the attack. The Baloch Liberation Tigers (BLT) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for exploitation of natural resources in Balochistan.

03/08/2019: Assailants fired mortars at Al-Abaysa village in Kushar district, Hajjah, Yemen. There were an unknown number of casualties, though houses, schools, and farms were damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/08/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at a mobile police squadron in Saravena, Arauca, Colombia. At least four civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

03/08/2019: An explosive device detonated at a North Oil Company employee residence in Khadra, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/08/2019: Assailants attempted to abduct Mohammad Yasin Bhat, a soldier who was home on leave, in Qazipora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State was involved in the attempted attack.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 03/08/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting the vehicle of Colonel Hisham al-Najm, the Director of National Security in Nineveh Province, outside a restaurant in al-Muthanna, Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. Two people were killed, including one civilian and one member of security forces, and 10 others, including civilians and security personnel, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/08/2019: Assailants opened fire on a military post in Woulwa, near Gueskerou, Diffa, Niger. In addition to 27 assailants, at least seven soldiers were killed and at least 20 soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the assault. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/08/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the residence of Rohan Gurung, the Nepal Association of Foreign Employment Agencies president, in Basundhara, Kathmandu, Province 3, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the group had "warned Gurung to end his illegal activities."

03/08/2019: Assailants equipped with firearms and machetes attacked civilians in Lubwasi, near Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least six civilians were killed and several houses were set on fire in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).
03/08/2019: An explosive device detonated along Bheji-Elarmadgu road, in Chhattisgarh, India. One person was killed in the blast. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/08/2019: Assailants shot and injured a civilian in Lisfannon Park, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/08/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated as it was being defused in Jarabulus, Aleppo, Syria. Three Operation Euphrates Shield soldiers were killed and another soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

03/08/2019: Assailants threw explosive devices inside an Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) office in Ibesikpo Asutan, Akwa Ibom, Nigeria. The devices detonated, destroying the office, and there were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
03/08/2019: Assailants attempted to burn electoral materials but were repelled by civilians in Gbajimba, Benue, Nigeria. Two civilians were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/08/2019: Assailants abducted Devaki Malla, a Nepal Communist Party (NCP) province lawmaker, in Bagadi, Kedarchyu Rural Municipality-5, Province 7, Nepal. Malla was released the same day. The Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "We took Malla under control to convey our party’s views regarding the government’s latest move against our party."

03/08/2019: An explosive device detonated while an uprising commander was attempting to defuse it in Qarghai, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Two people, including the commander, were killed. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/08/2019: Assailants shot and killed Noor Mohammad Shinwari, a mosque muezzin, in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
03/08/2019: Assailants opened fire on Sultan Bashir Musa Konte at a mosque in Bosaso, Bari, Somalia. Konte, a tribal elder, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/08/2019: Assailants attacked Afghan soldiers in Zakhel, Kunduz, Afghanistan. One soldier was killed and a second soldier was injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/08/2019: Assailants attacked pro-government militia members in Joy Bahs, Balkh, Afghanistan. Two militia members were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
03/08/2019: Assailants shot and killed a civilian suspected of working as an informant for special forces in Kandahar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/08/2019: Assailants attacked a joint police and army base in Laman, Badghis, Afghanistan. One soldier and six assailants were killed and 19 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/08/2019: Assailants opened fire on Fatah leader, Ahmed Helles, in Gaza Strip, West Bank and Gaza Strip. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.; however, sources attributed the attack to Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement).

03/08/2019: Assailants attacked the vehicle of the chieftain of the Peoples Democratic Party, Emilia Nte, in Nyeada, Katsina, Nigeria. Nte was abducted and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. Additionally, an officer was killed during the kidnapping. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/08/2019: Thomas J. Heard, a transgender black woman, sprayed white civilians with pepper spray at the 125th Street and Lenox Avenue subway station in Harlem, New York City, New York, United States. One man was injured in the attack. This was one of five incidents that occurred in New York and was perpetrated by this assailant. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

03/08/2019: Thomas J. Heard, a transgender black woman, sprayed white civilians with pepper spray on a street in Harlem, New York City, New York, United States. Five people were injured in the attack. This was one of five incidents that occurred in New York and was perpetrated by this assailant. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

03/08/2019: Thomas J. Heard, a transgender black woman, sprayed white civilians with pepper spray at the 96th Street and Broadway subway station near Broadway, New York City, New York, United States. One woman was injured in the attack. This was one of five incidents that occurred in New York and was perpetrated by this assailant. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

03/08/2019: Thomas J. Heard, a transgender black woman, sprayed a white couple with pepper spray in the Bronx, New York City, New York, United States. One woman and one man were injured in the attack. This was one of five incidents that occurred in New York and was perpetrated by this assailant. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents. Heard reportedly claimed that she "hated white people" before attacking the couple.

03/09/2019: Assailants opened fire on police officers at a gas station in Corinto, Cauca, Colombia. At least one officer was killed and another officer was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.

summary: 03/09/2019: Assailants threw an explosive device at a police station in Toribio, Cauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties as the device missed the station and landed at an unoccupied civilian residence. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 03/09/2019: Assailants opened fire on Alexander Cunda in El Progreso, Guatemala, Miranda, Cauca, Colombia. Cunda, an indigenous leader, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.

03/09/2019: An explosive device detonated at the provincial police station along Yatra Sawasdee road in Muang Satun, Satun, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of 16 related bombings in Phatthalung and Satun over a 24-hour period. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Barisan Revolusi Nasional (BRN).

03/09/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated at the provincial police station along Yatra Sawasdee road in Muang Satun, Satun, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of 16 related bombings in Phatthalung and Satun over a 24-hour period. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Barisan Revolusi Nasional (BRN).

03/09/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police outpost in Ponnagyun, Rakhine, Myanmar. At least nine police officers were killed and two officers were injured in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Arakan Army (AA) claimed responsibility for the incident, though a spokesperson for the group later denied that the group's central command ordered the attack.
03/09/2019: An explosive device detonated in Tulul al-Baj, Saladin, Iraq. One civilian was killed and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/09/2019: Assailants raided a village and set fire to 22 houses in Kisombe, Minembwe, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least two people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources attributed the attack to a Twigwaneho militia.

A police officer was killed and two people, including one assailant and one health worker, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mayi Mayi.

03/13/2019: An assailant drove his vehicle into the vehicle of Francesco “Franky Boy” Cali outside his residence in Todt Hill, Staten Island, New York City, United States. When Cali, a Gambino crime boss, came outside, the assailant shot and killed him. Anthony Comello claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources suspected that Comello was influenced by the far-right conspiracy theory known as the "QAnon theory," which indicates "that there is a deep-state plot against Donald Trump." Moreover, according to Comello's attorney, Comello believed "he was helping President Donald Trump defend democracy" and that Cali was part of the "deep state." Sources also noted that Comello wrote "MAGA Forever," "Q," "United We Stand," and "Patriots in Charge" on his hand while in court.
