03/16/2019: Assailants punched and kicked a civilian at a checkpoint at a bridge near Stanytsia Luhanska, Luhansk, Ukraine. The civilian was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Luhansk People's Republic.

03/16/2019: Assailants abducted an unknown number of civilians in Kushar district, Hajjah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of four similar attacks in Hajjah around this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/16/2019: Assailants abducted 15 civilians in Aflah Ash Shawm district, Hajjah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of four similar attacks in Hajjah around this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/16/2019: Assailants abducted an unknown number of civilians in Aflah al-Yaman district, Hajjah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of four similar attacks in Hajjah around this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/16/2019: Assailants abducted an unknown number of civilians in Miftah district, Hajjah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of four similar attacks in Hajjah around this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/16/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting Hajji Zamari, a provincial police chief, in Gul Kalachan, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Zamari and three others, including a tribal elder, were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/17/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a Sufi shrine in Wazir, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed and five others, including a civilian and four police officers, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/17/2019: An explosive device planted on a vehicle detonated in Puli Khumri district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Five civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on an unknown number of police, military, and militia checkposts in Harkilik, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least 22 soldiers and 15 assailants were killed while 10 soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. In addition, three soldiers were taken hostage by the assailants. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/17/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a Jaffar express train in Nasirabad district, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least four people were killed and 31 people were injured in the blast. The Baloch Liberation Tigers (BLT) claimed responsibility for the attack.
03/17/2019: Assailants attacked an Ethiopian African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) base in Hudur, Bakool, Somalia. No casualties were reported. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/17/2019: An explosive device detonated on the car of a customs official in Mandali, Diyala, Iraq. The customs official and two other civilians were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/17/2019: Assailants kidnapped Joel Yougbare in Djibo, Sahel, Burkina Faso. Yougbare, a catholic priest, was hanged and his body was discovered on April 27, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/17/2019: An assailants stabbed a soldier and stole his firearm near Ariel Junction, West Bank. The assailant then shot and killed the soldier, identified as Gal Keidan, before opening fire on three passing vehicles at the junction. One civilian, identified as Rabbi Ahiad Ettinger, was shot and later died in one of the vehicles. The assailant then stole the vehicle and drove to Gitai Avishar Junction, where he shot and injured another soldier. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP).
gname: Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP)

summary: 03/17/2019: Assailants threw a hand grenade at a police post in Wedow, Banaadir, Somalia. A police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/17/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) vehicle in Wedow, Banaadir, Somalia. Several soldiers were killed and injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/17/2019: Assailants attacked Fongo Ndengt, West, Cameroon. Four assailants were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

03/17/2019: Assailants attacked Dioura military camp in Dioura, Mopti, Mali. At least 23 soldiers were killed, an unknown number were injured and 17 others were taken hostage during the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for alleged abuses perpetrated by the government against members of the Fulani community.

03/17/2019: An explosive device detonated in Al-Yusufayn, Lahij, Yemen. One civilian was killed and a second civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/17/2019: Assailants shot and killed Johnny Albino, a farmer, in Tuko, Trinidad, Negros Oriental, Philippines. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victim, Johnny Albino, was targeted because he was a military informant.

03/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on a Civilian Active Auxiliary (CAA) soldier in Batongboang, Trinidad, Negros Oriental, Philippines. One soldier was killed in the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Virgilio Vergara between Buri and Cogon, Alangalang, Leyte, Philippines. Vergara, the Buri village head, was killed and his wife was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/17/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting security forces vehicles along Bypass Road in Hangu, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/17/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle carrying soldiers in Kompienga, Est, Burkina Faso. Three soldiers were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Muslim extremists.

03/17/2019: Assailants set fire to the Church of St. Sulpice in 6e arrondissement, Paris, France. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of anti-Christian extremists.

03/17/2019: An explosive device detonated in Aleppo, Syria. At least one person was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/17/2019: An assailant armed with a knife attempted to enter the Cave of the Patriarchs in order to carry out an attack but was apprehended by police beforehand near Lapid road in Hebron, West Bank. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to a Palestinian extremist.
03/17/2019: A toy Styrofoam plane with a grenade was flown from Gaza Strip and landed along Telor Road 234. between Reim and Urim, Southern, Israel. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/17/2019: Assailants attacked soldiers near Ponnagyun, Rakhine, Myanmar. One assailant was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).

03/17/2019: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Sinjar, Nineveh, Iraq. At least three people, including one soldier and two militiamen, were killed, and seven others, including five assailants, were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK).

03/17/2019: Assailants attacked a mine in Mambasa, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least three mine employees, including two Chinese nationals, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/17/2019: Assailants abducted five Citizen Charter Program workers in Tarin Kot district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. The workers were released on April 17, 2019. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on Leonardo Gabriel Hernandez, a TV journalist and social activist, in La Ceiba, Nacaome, Valle, Honduras. Hernandez was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/18/2019: Assailants armed with projectiles and firearms attacked a checkpoint in an attempt to storm Balcad, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. There were an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
03/18/2019: An explosive device detonated in eastern Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Six civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/18/2019: An explosives-laden bicycle detonated targeting a police patrol in Paroa, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least two police officers and a civilian were injured in the blast. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/18/2019: Assailants attempted to attack a Nowruz celebration in Qazaniyah, Diyala, Iraq. Security forces identified and killed four assailants, including two suicide bombers. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/18/2019: Assailants attacked Ghadduwah, Sabha, Libya. One civilian was killed, a second civilian was injured, and three civilians were taken hostage in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. This was one of two coordinated attacks in this area on this day. The Fezzan Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident, though sources doubted the groups involvement.
gname: Fezzan Province of the Islamic State

summary: 03/18/2019: Assailants attacked a grocery store in Ghadduwah, Sabha, Libya. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks in this area on this day. The Fezzan Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident, though sources doubted the groups involvement.
gname: Fezzan Province of the Islamic State

summary: 03/18/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting Saber Khan in Sherwazi, Logar, Afghanistan. Khan, the Baraki Barak district police chief, was killed and two officers were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/18/2019: An assailant opened fire on civilians on a tram in Utrecht, Netherlands. Four civilians were killed and eight civilians were injured in the attack. The assailant, Gokmen Tanis, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated in a note left at the scene, "in support of Islam." Moreover, he further stated "I do this for my faith, you want to kill Muslims and you want to steal our faith from us, but you will not succeed. Allah is great." Sources also noted that Tanis had previously been arrested for links to the Islamic State.
03/18/2019: An explosive device detonated in Dali, Ad Dali, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on civilian residences in Naqqash, Hubaysh, Ibb, Yemen. There were an unknown number of casualties and an unknown number of people were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to tribesmen.
03/18/2019: Assailants shot and killed a laborer outside his residence in Reshipora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on the Philippine Army’s 61st Infantry Battalion in Osorio 1, San Remigio, Antique, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
03/18/2019: A landmine detonated targeting a convoy in Gwoza, Borno, Nigeria. Eight civilians were killed and seven were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/18/2019: Assailants shot and killed a senior police officer, identified as Juje Razo, in Marifosque, Sorsogon, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

03/18/2019: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire on police officers in Dantewada district, Chhattisgarh, India. At least one police officer was killed and six officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

03/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on army checkpoints in Khogyani district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least three assailants were killed, two assailants were injured, and one assailant was arrested in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/18/2019: Assailants attacked Michika, Adamawa, Nigeria. At least 16 people, including 11 assailants, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

03/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on election officials and civilians in Noymile, Baghaichhari, Chittagong, Bangladesh. At least eight people were killed and 23 other people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected he involvement of the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) - Bangladesh.
03/18/2019: Assailants attacked Lassa, Borno, Nigeria. Three people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

03/18/2019: Assailants entered civilian homes and attacked a district police office in Htammariz, Mrauk U, Rakhine, Myanmar. The outcome of the incident is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).
03/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on the Chairman of Chak Jhumra Press Club in Faisalabad, Punjab, Pakistan. Two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on Abdullah Muqbel in Taizz, Yemen. Muqbel, an army officer, and his bodyguard were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/18/2019: Assailants launched explosive devices and opened fire on a riot police squad in San Miguel, Cauca, Colombia. It is unknown whether there were any casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 03/19/2019: An explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated near the KM4 intersection in Mogadishu, Somalia. A Criminal Investigation Department (CID) official was injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/20/2019: Assailants abducted two telephone company employees between Kongoussi and Djibo in Soum, Sahel, Burkina Faso. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/19/2019: Assailants opened fire on soldiers inspecting Al-Yabis project in Tarmiyah, Saladin, Iraq. At least one soldier was killed and two soldiers were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/19/2019: Assailants abducted Emmanuel Ndoumbe Bosso in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. Bosso, the head coach of the Young Sports Academy (YOSA) was released later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

03/16/2019: Assailants stopped a commercial vehicle Zalingei-Kass road in Kass district, South Darfur, Sudan. Seven passengers were beaten and property was stolen in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/19/2019: Assailants opened fire on a Levies checkpost in Lal Khattai, Balochistan, Pakistan. Six Levies officers were killed and several others were injured in the attack. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the recent deaths of TTP members in police operations.

03/19/2019: Assailants attacked a vehicle carrying mine workers in Nejo, Oromia, Ethiopia. Five miners were killed. The victims a Japanese national and an Indian national. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/19/2019: Assailants attacked a military outpost in Farah, Afghanistan. At least 23 assailants were killed and 44 assailants were injured in ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/19/2019: An explosive device accidentally prematurely in Anin, Taizz, Yemen. Four assailants were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/19/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting civilians in Herat, Afghanistan. At least one civilian was killed and six others were injured in the attack. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 03/19/2019: Assailants opened fire on civilians and set fire to houses in Tse Uoreleyev, Guma, Benue, Nigeria. At least 10 people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

03/19/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting children in Al-Tarfaya, 35km south of Baqubah, Diyala, Iraq. Two children were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/19/2019: Gunmen opened fire on Awami League official Suresh Kanti Tonchangya in Alikhong, Chittagong, Bangladesh. Tonchangya was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/19/2019: Assailants opened fire on farmers in Lassa, Borno, Nigeria. The four farmers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

03/19/2019: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Sukhendu Das, a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) gram panchayat president, in Cachar district, Assam, India. Das was killed and his colleague was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/19/2019: Assailants attacked military positions in Sirwah district, Marib, Yemen. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/19/2019: An assailant attacked an elderly man holding a pro-life/anti-abortion sign outside a Planned Parenthood along Valencia street in San Francisco, California, United States. The victim was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/19/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel near a sports facility in San Juan de Lozada, Meta, Colombia. At least two Third Land Operations Battalion members were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/18/2019: Assailants intercepted two trucks and set both on fire along a road in El Quince, Antioquia, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

03/19/2019: Assailants opened fire on military and police personnel along Pan-American Highway in Mondomo, Cauca, Colombia. At least one police officer was killed and seven security personnel members, including soldiers, police officers, and indigenous guards, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 03/20/2019: Assailants hurled fragmentation grenades at Vulcano Task Force working on the Cano Limon-Covenas oil pipeline in Filo de Gringo, Norte de Santander, Colombia. At least one worker was killed and four others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

03/20/2019: Assailants abducted Emmanuel Ngafeson Bantar in Ntabesi, Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. Bantar, a former Ministry of Justice official, was released on March 31, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Separatists.
03/20/2019: Assailants stabbed and killed a priest in Ngaoundere, Adamawa, Cameroon. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/20/2019: Assailants abducted 20 students from the University of Buea in Buea, South-West, Cameroon. The students were injured and released on March 21, 2019. Separatists claimed responsibility for the incident and forced the hostages to sing the "Ambazonian anthem."

03/20/2019: Assailants stopped buses and held 80 passengers hostage along Buea-Kumba highway near Muyuka, South-West, Cameroon. The hostages were rescued seven hours later. No casualties were reported, though property was stolen in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

03/20/2019: An assailant, armed with a knife, petrol cans, and a lighter, hijacked a school bus carrying 51 children and three adults in Crema, Lombardy, Italy. When police intervened, the assailant set the bus on fire. The 54 hostages were rescued shortly thereafter. At least 12 people were injured in the attack. An unaffiliated individual, identified as Ousseynou Sy, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he wanted "to punish Europe for their policies on migration" and that "he hates white people for having 'invaded and colonized' Africa, forcing Africans to emigrate and 'die in the Mediterranean.'"

03/20/2019: An explosive device detonated in Silopi district, Sirnak, Turkey. One soldier was killed and a second was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

03/18/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting police personnel in Puli Khumri district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and one other officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/19/2019: Assailants fired rockets and artillery at a Redeployment Coordination Committee (RCC) headquarters in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Houthi extremists.

03/20/2019: Assailants raided a health center in Maleki, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two attacks in Maleki on this day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

03/20/2019: Assailants raided civilian residences in Maleki, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two attacks in Maleki on this day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

03/20/2019: Assailants attacked a joint African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) and Jubbaland Forces (JF) convoy on the outskirts of Ceel Waaq district, Gedo, Somalia. At least five soldiers were killed and several other soldiers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/20/2019: An assailant stabbed Khalid Hameed in Bahawalpur, Punjab, Pakistan. Hameed, a college professor, was killed in the attack. Khateeb Hussain claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out because the victim was conducting "un-Islamic" activities.
03/20/2019: Assailants shot and killed a Koranic school teacher in Waberi, Mogadishu, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/20/2019: Assailants shot and killed a Somali soldier in Shibis, Mogadishu, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/20/2019: Assailants shot and killed Dr. Nnamdi Ogueche, the secretary of the local government council, along Ezeagu-Umulokpa Uzo-Uwani Road in Olo, Ezeagu, Enugu, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.
03/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on a security patrol in Nambalnar Kandi, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/20/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle between Peddakodepal and Naimed in Bijapur district, Chhattisgarh, India. At least nine people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).
03/20/2019: Assailants shot and injured Hiram Moreno, a journalist, in Salina Cruz, Oaxaca, Mexico. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/20/2019: Assailants in a vehicle threw explosive devices at Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) soldiers guarding Joseph's Tomb in Nablus, West Bank. The soldiers opened fire on the vehicle, killing both assailants. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

03/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on Naciancino Pacalioga Jr. in Esperanza Lanao del Norte, Philippines. Pacalioga Jr., a former Dumingag mayor and vice-mayor, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/20/2019: Assailants abducted six civilians near Mount Mghila in Jelma district, Sidi Bouzid, Tunisia. All six hostages were released later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on a civilian residence in Myebon, Rakhine, Myanmar. One civilian was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).
03/20/2019: Assailants attacked a passenger vehicle in Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/20/2019: Assailants ambushed mobile brigade police officers near Mugi, Nduga, Papua, Indonesia. One police officer was killed and three others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/20/2019: Assailants shot and killed Florence Canet, a Philippine Army asset, in Igmaya-an, Negros Occidental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/13/2019: Assailants abducted and killed Reverend Father Clement Ugwu, a catholic priest, in Ndiuno Obinofia, Ezeagu, Enugu, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

03/00/2019: Sometime between March 17, 2019 and March 23, 2019, assailants launched an explosives-laden drone targeting engineers at the King Khalid air base near Khamis Mushayt, Asir, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties in the attack; however, two jets were damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/20/2019: Assailants attacked Hajur, Hajjah, Yemen. An unknown number of people, including tribal leader Ali Hasan Adbaa, were abducted and their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/21/2019: Assailants attacked the Al-Hutam tribes in Radaa, Al Bayda, Yemen. One assailant was killed and another was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/21/2019: An explosive device hidden in the washroom of a mosque detonated targeting Nowruz festival attendees near the Kart-e Sakhi Shrine in the 3rd police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. This was one of four related bombings targeting individuals celebrating Nowruz in Kabul on this day; three of the explosive devices detonated while a fourth device was discovered and defused. At least six civilians were killed and 23 civilians were injured across the three blasts. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 03/21/2019: An explosive device detonated behind a hospital targeting Nowruz festival attendees on Kabul University road near the Kart-e Sakhi Shrine in the 3rd police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. This was one of four related bombings targeting individuals celebrating Nowruz in Kabul on this day; three of the explosive devices detonated while a fourth device was discovered and defused. At least six civilians were killed and 23 civilians were injured across the three blasts. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 03/21/2019: Assailants abducted the mayor of Markoye and his driver in Oudalan, Sahel, Burkina Faso. The driver was released on March 22, 2019, while the fate of the mayor is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/21/2019: An explosive device attached to a civilian vehicle detonated near the KM4 roundabout in Mogadishu, Somalia. Mohamed Abdi Kariye, an engineer, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

03/21/2019: Assailants opened fire on a military base in Bulo Marer, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least two assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. In addition, the assailants and the soldiers sustained an unknown number of injuries. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/21/2019: Assailants attacked Karidi, Gueskerou, Diffa, Niger. At least eight people were killed in the raid. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

03/21/2019: Assailants attacked Nigerian soldiers in Ngazai, near Monguno, Borno, Nigeria. Ten soldiers were killed in the incident. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/21/2019: Assailants ambushed Nigerian soldiers in Kangarwa, Borno, Nigeria. Six soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

03/21/2019: Assailants set fire to the General People’s Congress (GPC) party headquarters in Taizz, Yemen. This was one of four related incidents in Taizz on this date. At least 20 people were killed, 60 people were injured, and 50 people were abducted across the ensuing clashes, which lasted until March 24, 2019. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Al-Islah Party.

03/21/2019: Assailants attacked the Abu Abbas Brigade headquarters in Taizz, Yemen. This was one of four related incidents in Taizz on this date. At least 20 people were killed, 60 people were injured, and 50 people were abducted across the ensuing clashes, which lasted until March 24, 2019. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Al-Islah Party. Sources also attributed this attack to Houthi extremists.

03/21/2019: Assailants attacked a military convoy near Bardaale, Bay, Somalia. At least three assailants were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

03/21/2019: Assailants fired a grenade targeting a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) camp in Sopore, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One civilian and two police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/21/2019: An explosive device detonated in North Waziristan district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. A civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/21/2019: An explosive device was discovered and defused on Kabul University road in the 3rd police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. This was one of four related bombings targeting individuals celebrating Nowruz in Kabul on this day. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 03/21/2019: An explosive device hidden in an electricity meter detonated targeting Nowruz festival attendees near the Kart-e Sakhi Shrine in west Kabul, Afghanistan. This was one of four related bombings targeting individuals celebrating Nowruz in Kabul on this day; three of the explosive devices detonated while a fourth device was discovered and defused. At least six civilians were killed and 23 civilians were injured across the three blasts. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 03/21/2019: Assailants attacked residential buildings in Taizz, Yemen. This was one of four related incidents in Taizz on this date. At least 20 people were killed, 60 people were injured, and 50 people were abducted across the ensuing clashes, which lasted until March 24, 2019. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Al-Islah Party. Sources also attributed this attack to Houthi extremists.

03/21/2019: Assailants set fire to al-Mudhafar hospital in Taizz, Yemen. This was one of four related incidents in Taizz on this date. At least 20 people were killed, 60 people were injured, and 50 people were abducted across the ensuing clashes, which lasted until March 24, 2019. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Al-Islah Party.

03/21/2019: Assailants attacked a military column between Yaygaungchaung and Setaung in Rakhine, Myanmar. Two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).

03/21/2019: Assailants opened fire on Yogesh Verma, a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) lawmaker, in Lakhimpur, Uttar Pradesh, India. Verma was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/21/2019: Assailants attacked Mucojo, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/21/2019: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint in Nangarhar, Afghanistan. One assailant was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/21/2019: An assailant attacked an elderly man holding a pro-life/anti-abortion sign outside a Planned Parenthood along Valencia street in San Francisco, California, United States. The victim was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/21/2019: Assailants entered a civilian residence and held seven people hostage in Hajan, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Six hostages were released or rescued and one hostage and two assailants were killed in the ensuing clash with security forces the following day, March 22, 2019. Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded that the family "bring back one of their daughters who was shifted to Sopore after Ali had started threatening her to get married to him."

03/22/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the Transandino oil pipeline in San Francisco, Ricaurte, Narino, Colombia. There were no casualties in the attack, but the blast caused an oil spill. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

03/22/2019: Assailants opened fire on youth in the desert of Tubayshiyah, Saladin, Iraq. At least one civilian was killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 03/22/2019: Gunmen abducted a Maliki scholar, Sheikh Muhammad Al-Amin Farkash, from Derna, Libya. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/22/2019: Assailants attacked a Chadian Army base in Dangdala, Lac, Chad. At least 23 soldiers were killed and the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

03/22/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a taxi between Bandiagara and Diombolo, Mopti, Mali. One person was killed and two others were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/22/2019: Gunmen attacked the village of Diombolo, Mopti, Mali. Four people were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/22/2019: Assailants opened fire on the Anantnag Municipal Council Chairman and his personal security officers at the Municipal Council Office in Dangerpora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One security officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/22/2019: Assailants threw a hand grenade at the Russian consulate in Chalandri, Athens, Attica, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Informal Anarchist Federation and the International Revolutionary Front jointly claimed responsibility for the incident and alleged that Russia was torturing anarchists, who had been arrested. The groups also "dedicated" the attack to Mikhail Zhlobitsky, the perpetrator of the Arkhangelsk attack in October 2018.

03/22/2019: Security forces discovered and defused a letter bomb at a post office in Limerick, Ireland. The New Irish Republican Army (IRA) claimed responsibility for the incident and sources noted that the letter was addressed for a transport hub in London, England, United Kingdom.

At least 157 people were killed and at least 32 others were injured across attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Dan Na Qmbassagou.

03/23/2019: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at the gate of the Ministry of Labor and Public Works Complex in Shingani, Mogadishu, Somalia. Following the blast, four additional assailants entered the compound and opened fire while a second explosives-laden vehicle detonated at another part of the compound near Banaadir police station. In addition to the five assailants, at least 11 people, including Deputy Minister Saqar Ibrahim Abdalla, were killed and 17 people were injured in the blasts and ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for registering soldiers and spies to combat the group, as well as for reconstructing the National Theater in violation of Islamic law.

03/23/2019: An explosive device detonated near an Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp in Darkheynley, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least three people were killed and three other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/23/2019: An explosive device detonated at a security checkpoint in Mogadishu, Somalia. At least two people were killed and one person was injured in the blast. The victims included soldiers, civilians, and a local lawmaker. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

03/23/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a military patrol in Mogadishu, Somalia. At least four soldiers were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
03/23/2019: Assailants kidnapped three gold miners in Koutougou, Sahel, Burkina Faso. The hostages were killed later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 03/30/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at the Qurtuba mosque in Sirte, Libya. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/30/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a health center in Barmal district, Paktika, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties, but the clinic was destroyed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/30/2019: A grenade detonated near a security vehicle at Al Kara' market in Dar Sad, Adan, Yemen. At least 15 people, including civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/30/2019: Assailants opened fire on a passenger bus in Yendere, Cascades, Burkina Faso. Three civilians and two assailants were killed in the attack and ensuing clash with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

03/30/2019: A suicide bomber attempted to detonate an explosives-laden vehicle targeting a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) convoy at the Jawahar Tunnel near Banihal, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The explosives partially detonated, injuring the assailant; no other casualties were reported. Owais Amin, a member of Hizbul Mujahideen (HM), was arrested and claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM).

03/30/2019: Assailants opened fire on Arjumand Hussain Bhat in his shop in Baramulla, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Bhat, a social activist and drug addiction center coordinator, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/30/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) bunker outside a State Bank of India branch in Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One CRPF officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/30/2019: Assailants abducted journalist Matloob Husain Mosavi from his home in Korangi, Karachi, Pakistan. Mosavi’s family was locked in a room during the attack and subsequently released. Mosavi's whereabouts remain unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/30/2019: A police officer opened fire on his colleagues at a police checkpoint in Shahr-e Safa, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least nine officers were killed in the assault. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/30/2019: Assailants attacked police officers in Band Taimor, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least three police officers and five assailants were killed and one police officer and three assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/30/2019: Assailants attacked civilians in Gaya, Adamawa, Nigeria. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

03/30/2019: Assailants opened fire on a Joint Resistance Forces bulldozer attempting to open a roadblock to allow a UN convoy to pass along Khamsin street in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/30/2019: Assailants razed an unknown number of villages in Madagali, Adamawa, Nigeria. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

03/30/2019: Assailants razed an unknown number of villages in Michika, Adamawa, Nigeria. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

03/30/2019: Assailants opened fire on a village chief, identified as Datu Bimbo Ayunan, in Makilala, North Cotabato, Philippines. Ayunan was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/30/2019: Assailants shot and killed a Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) member in Busayrah, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/30/2019: Three explosive devices were discovered and safely defused in Mallam Fatori, Borno, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

03/30/2019: Assailants set fire to six vehicles at Creighton's Garage in Finaghy, Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The New Irish Republican Army claimed responsibility for the incident and "warned recovery firms to 'stay out of all republican areas with immediate effect.'"

03/30/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a villa in Venzolasca, Haute-Corse, Haute-Corse, Corsica, France. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources noted that the attack occurred prior to French President Emmanuel Macron's visit to Corsica and suspected that the attack may have been related to nationalist violence.

03/30/2019: Assailants raided a Su Htoo San Company road construction site in Twinkin Alaung, Chin, Myanmar. Several vehicles were set on fire and 13 workers were abducted in the attack. Five workers were released on April 1, 2019 and the remaining eight hostages were released on August 19, 2019. The Arakan Army (AA) claimed responsibility for the incident and accused the construction workers of being spies.

03/31/2019: Assailants opened fire on Nabwi Mosque in Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least two people, including prayer leader Maulana Abdul Hayee, were killed and two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/31/2019: An explosive device detonated in Az Zahir, Al Bayda, Yemen. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/31/2019: Assailants opened fire on municipal councilor Jolomar Hilario at his house in Inolingan, Negros Occidental, Philippines. Hilario was killed in the attack while his wife and children were forced to lie on the floor. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/31/2019: Fifteen assailants opened fire on the San Remigio Police Station in Osorio 1, San Remigio, Cebu, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

03/31/2019: Assailants abducted a civilian in Al-Qahafa, Taizz, Yemen. The civilian, identified as Ahmed Qaed Omar, was killed the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

03/31/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian residence in Montgomery Close, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/31/2019: Assailants fired five rockets towards Israel that landed prematurely and struck the security fence in the Gaza Strip. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/31/2019: Assailants shot and killed Seliam Wangsa, a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) worker in Nginu, Arunachal Pradesh, India. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Isak-Muivah (NSCN-IM). Sources noted that the target was a former member of the group.

03/31/2019: Assailants attacked members of the al-Zurqa tribe in Hajjah, Yemen. At least six people, two of whom were injured, were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists and noted that the victims were accused of attacking a Houthi leader in the area.

03/31/2019: Assailants detonated explosive devices at a primary school functioning as a polling station in Sadipur, Dhaka, Bangladesh. No casualties were reported in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however police arrested two supporters of an electoral candidate in connection with the attack.
03/31/2019: Assailants attacked Hamkan, Sahel, Burkina Faso. Three people were killed, including the Sheikh Werem, the village's religious leader. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/31/2019: Assailants set fire to Vivian United Pentecostal Church in Vivian, Louisiana, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/02/2019: Assailants attacked a convoy of soldiers, police, and teachers in Kan Ague, Patikul, Sulu, Philippines. At least two police officers and several assailants were wounded in the attack. It is unknown whether there were any other casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

04/01/2019: Assailants attacked Afghan National Army (ANA) checkposts in Ludina, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least 10 soldiers and 20 assailants were killed while two other soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2019: Assailants attacked a police checkpost in Hazrati Sultan district, Samangan, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were killed and two officers were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2019: Assailants attacked a military base in Sozma Qala district, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least five soldiers were killed, five soldiers were injured, and six soldiers were taken hostage in the incident. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/01/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a military patrol on the outskirts of Sheikh Tami, Buhriz, Diyala, Iraq. Two soldiers were wounded in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/01/2019: Assailants set fire to the vehicle of Ekachai Hongkangwan in Soi Lat Phrao 109, Bangkok, Thailand. Hongkangwan, a anti-junta activist that had just attended a rally protesting the mishandling of recent elections, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian in the forest near Nuguru, Telangana, India. One civilian was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).
04/01/2019: Assailants opened fire on two transgender people in Peshawar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One person was injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2019: Assailants abducted Panda Emmanuel, a deputy mayor, from his residence in Sanje, South-West, Cameroon. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/00/2019: Sometime between April 1, 2019 and April 9, 2019, assailants set fire to a charcoal truck in Lower Shebelle, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

04/01/2019: Assailants raided the house of Ali Muhammad Mehar, the Minister of Narcotics Control, in Karachi, Pakistan. Mehar was injured and an unknown number of his servants were briefly held hostage during the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Anitapan, Compostela Valley, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/01/2019: At least 1-4 explosive devices were discovered and safely defused in Magangit, Compostela Valley, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/01/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused outside a treasury office in Bastia, Corsica, France. This was one of two related attacks in Bastia on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused outside a Department of Public Finances office in Bastia, Corsica, France. This was one of two related attacks in Bastia on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2019: Assailants set fire to residences in Kaumutiyah, Borno, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties in the raid. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/01/2019: An explosives-laden package addressed to Mayor Chiara Appendino was discovered and defused in Turin, Piedmont, Piedmont, Italy. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of L'Asilo.

04/01/2019: Assailants abducted Kashyap Boruah, an Upidta Energy Oil Company employee, from Innao, Arunachal Pradesh, India. Boruah was released on April 29, 2019, following the payment of a ransom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, two members of the Arunachal Pradesh Deprived People's Front (APDPF) were arrested in connection with the attack.

04/02/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle of the Hadarim Battalion in Seiyun, Hadramawt, Yemen. Additionally, the assailants stole the victims' weapons and fired upon them. At least four militia members were killed and an unknown number were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).

04/02/2019: An explosive device detonated as security forces were chasing an assailant in Tadian, Mountain Province, Philippines. At least one police officer was killed and eight other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/02/2019: Assailants entered a Doctors Without Borders (MSF) hospital, threatened staff, and abducted a patient in Aden, Adan, Yemen. The hostage was shot and killed shortly after the abduction. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/02/2019: The Saudi Air Defense system intercepted and destroyed two explosives-laden drones targeting Khamis Mushayt, Asir, Saudi Arabia. Five civilians were injured by falling debris. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

04/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on a security checkpoint at Kombe market in Penda Mboko, Litoral, Cameroon. Three gendarmes were injured and one police officer was reported missing. The whereabouts of the officer are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of separatists.

04/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on a boat carrying fishermen between Jilib and Gendershe, in Lower Shebelle, Somalia. One fisherman was killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

04/02/2019: An assailant set fire to Greater Union Baptist Church in Opelousas, Louisiana, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Holden Matthews, an unaffiliated individual, confessed to carrying out the attack and stated that he carried out the attack in order to gain attention for his black metal music. Matthews was charged with a federal hate crime and sources suspected that the attack was racially motivated. Sources also noted that Mathews wrote in a Facebook post that he could not "stand all these baptists around here, bunch of brainwashed people trying to find happiness in a religion that was forced on their ancestors just as it was on mine."

04/02/2019: Assailants attacked a military base in Khash Rod district, Nimroz, Afghanistan. At least three soldiers and 13 assailants were killed while six soldiers and 10 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/02/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused on a forest road in Mohanpur, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

04/02/2019: Assailants set fire to four tractors, a truck, a sugarcane loader, and bunk houses at Hacienda Nieva in To-oy, Negros Occidental, Philippines. At least 20 workers were held hostage during the arson attack and were released a short time later. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/02/2019: An explosive device detonated near a police vehicle in Mansuriyah, Diyala, Iraq. Two police officers were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/02/2019: Assailants attempted to launch incendiary balloons into Israel from Gaza Strip. There were no reported casualties in the attempted attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

04/03/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a restaurant in Kalawag, Sultan Kudarat, Philippines. At least one person was killed and 17 people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM). Sources also suspected that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the recent killing of BIFM members.

04/03/2019: Assailants opened fire on a military base in Panare, Pattani, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to anti-government extremists.
04/03/2019: Assailants shot and killed Abdul Majeed Dar, a Panchayat member, at his residence in Sholi Pora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/03/2019: Assailants fired projectiles into Rabsah, Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Three civilians were killed and two were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists, which the group denied.

04/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police camp in Shaikhah, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least 11 assailants and eight police officers were killed and 15 assailants and five officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/03/2019: An explosive device detonated while a child was playing with it at the Fateh school in Hamdan, Sanaa, Yemen. Two students were killed and 15 others were wounded by the device the student had found on his was to school. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/03/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at the residence of Hashim Hassun al-Dujayli, a Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) member, in Dujail, Saladin, Iraq. At least two people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/03/2019: Assailants attacked civilians in Samboko, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of two attacks in North Kivu on this day. At least 30 civilians were kidnapped across both attacks. All but three hostages were released as of April 5, 2019. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. The Allied Democratic Forces (ADF) claimed responsibility for the incident and "demanded that the FARDC [DR Congo Armed Forces] halt offensives against them so they could buy goods in the region."

04/03/2019: Assailants attacked civilians in Makulu, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of two attacks in North Kivu on this day. At least 30 civilians were kidnapped across both attacks. All but three hostages were released as of April 5, 2019. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. The Allied Democratic Forces (ADF) claimed responsibility for the incident and "demanded that the FARDC [DR Congo Armed Forces] halt offensives against them so they could buy goods in the region."

04/03/2019: Assailants attacked police officers in Jalawla, near Qaryat 'Awsa, Diyala, Iraq. At least one police officer was killed and three others were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 04/03/2019: An assailant attacked a car and attempted to stab the passengers in Hawara, West Bank, West Bank and Gaza Strip. The assailant was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

04/03/2019: An explosive device detonated when a child mistook it for a cricket ball in Pariyaram, Kerala, India. The boy, identified as Vijil, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/03/2019: Assailants threw Molotov cocktails and rocks at Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) soldiers in Qalqilya, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigade.

04/03/2019: Assailants attacked Nayif Nawwaf al-Hashish between Yaduda and Kharab al-Shahm in Daraa, Syria. Al-Hashish, a National Reconciliation Committee leader, and his grandson were killed while his wife was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/03/2019: Assailants shot and killed Joseph Molatudi, a treasurer for the Socialist Revolutionary Workers Party (SRWP), at his residence in Finetown, Gauteng, South Africa. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/03/2019: Assailants launched mortar shells at an United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) camp in Kidal, Mali. Two Chadian peacekeepers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/03/2019: Assailants abducted a Sudanese soldier in Mukha district, Taizz, Yemen. The soldier was killed shortly after the abduction. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Amaliqah Brigades.

04/03/2019: Assailants attacked Maculo, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. Two civilians were decapitated in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources suspected the involvement of Muslim extremists.

04/03/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a police patrol in Villanorte, Caqueta, Colombia. Two police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 04/04/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated between Yardimeli Hospital and General Kahiye Police Academy in Xamar Jabjab, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least eight people were injured in the blast. The casualties included police officers and civilians. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/04/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Anaz, 300 km west of Ramadi, Rutbah, Al Anbar, Iraq. At least three people harvesting truffles were killed and another person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 04/04/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a public bus on Malang Jaan road in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least five civilians were wounded in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 04/04/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a motorcycle in At Tuhayat district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Three civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/03/2019: Assailants opened fire on checkpoint and oil well 26 in Nahrawan, Diyala, Iraq. Facilities Protection Service repelled the assault and there were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/04/2019: An explosive device detonated prematurely as a Kyrgyzstani assailant was planting it in an intelligence officer's vehicle in Kyiv, Ukraine. The assailant was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/03/2019: Assailants fired a rocket at Bourzanga gendarmerie in Bourzanga, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/04/2019: Assailants attacked security outposts in Morghab district, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least 13 soldiers were killed and 22 others were injured in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. In addition, an unknown number of soldiers were reported missing. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/04/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a market in Puli Khumri, Baghlan, Afghanistan. One civilian, a doctor, was killed and 13 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/04/2019: An explosive device detonated in Naqib, Diyala, Iraq. Two people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/04/2019: An assailant set fire to Mount Pleasant Baptist Church in Opelousas, Louisiana, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Holden Matthews, an unaffiliated individual, confessed to carrying out the attack and stated that he carried out the attack in order to gain attention for his black metal music. Matthews was charged with a federal hate crime and sources suspected that the attack was racially motivated. Sources also noted that Mathews wrote in a Facebook post that he could not "stand all these baptists around here, bunch of brainwashed people trying to find happiness in a religion that was forced on their ancestors just as it was on mine."

04/04/2019: Assailants shot and killed a soldier in Rebuken, Maguindanao, Philippines. The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out because the victim was allegedly transporting an explosive device.

04/04/2019: Assailants opened fire on a State Road Transport Corporation (SRTC) bus on polling duty in Turkwangam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/04/2019: Assailants attacked Iraqi federal police in Daquq, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least five police were killed and one other police officer was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 04/04/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting civilians in Khabb wa ash Shaaf district, Al Jawf, Yemen. One civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/04/2019: An assailant opened fire on the house of John Filion, a Toronto city councilor, along Finche Avenue East, Toronto, Ontario, Canada. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/04/2019: Assailants attacked Kesse, Zangba, Basse-Kotto, Central African Republic. This was one of five coordinated incidents in Zangba on the same day. summary: 04/04/2019: Assailants opened fire on the house of barangay chair Priscillo Albores in Sudlon II, Cebu, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/04/2019: Assailants opened fire on barangay chair Aurelio Laspuña's house in Sinsin, Cebu, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/04/2019: Assailants attacked and killed a Doctors Without Borders nurse between Batangafo and Bouca in Ouham, Central African Republic. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/04/2019: Assailants abducted Bertoldo Rangas and Ermil Madrona in Surigao del Norte, Philippines. Rangas, a local village councilor, and Madrona, a Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) soldier, were killed later in April 2019 and their bodies were discovered on June 9, 2020. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/05/2019: Four assailants opened fire on off-duty Border Patrol Police (BPP) officers at the Nurul Ibadah mosque in Than To, Yala, Thailand. Two police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

04/05/2019: Assailants kidnapped four people from Bansud, Oriental Mindoro, Philippines. Three of the hostages were released on April 6, 2019. The final hostage was released on April 22, 2019. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out because the victims "were accountable for counterrevolutionary activities, putting at risk civilian's security and fundamental human rights."
02/05/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle in Dagana, Mopti, Mali. Three people were killed and 12 were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/05/2019: Assailants opened fire on a government vehicle in Basra, Basra, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/05/2019: Assailants attacked a Catholic Church in a village near Silgadji, Soum, Sahel, Burkina Faso. At least four worshipers were killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/05/2019: Assailants attacked Army positions in Waynan, near Asaf Murays, Ad Dali, Yemen. This was one of four coordinated incidents in Ad Dali on the same day. There were an unknown number of casualties across all four ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

04/05/2019: Assailants attacked Army positions in Hamra, Ad Dali, Yemen. This was one of four coordinated incidents in Ad Dali on the same day. There were an unknown number of casualties across all four ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

04/05/2019: Assailants attacked Army positions in Sawlan, Ash Shuayb, Ad Dali, Yemen. This was one of four coordinated incidents in Ad Dali on the same day. summary: 04/06/2019: Assailants abducted Ashang Kasar in Senapati, Assam, India. Kasar, a North East India Development Party (NEIDP) candidate, was rescued shortly after the kidnapping. The National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Isak-Muivah (NSCN-IM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/06/2019: Assailants set up an ambush by piling a bunch of road signs in the middle of the road near West 68th Avenue and Beech Street in Arvada, Colorado, United States. When a police officer arrived at the scene to clear the debris, the assailants threw a plastic bottle with chlorine at the officer and a bystander. Both were injured by the toxic chemicals emanating from the bottle. Five assailants were arrested and at least four plead guilty and were sentenced. The assailants were identified as Gavin Beret Dawson, Isaac Carl Koch, Maxwell Cade McCann, and Braiden John Ulmer.

04/07/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting the Energy Police Directorate in Mashtal, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least five people, including the BJP official, three police officers, and a driver, were killed in the attack. An additional explosive device was discovered on a secondary route for the convoy. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the deaths of CPI-Maoist leaders by authorities in Dantewada. Sources also noted that the attack may have been related to upcoming elections.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

Sharma, a Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) leader and medical assistant, and his personal security officer, identified as Rajinder Kumar, were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) and Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility and stated that the attack was carried out "as part of IS's 'revenge' campaign for its Syrian affiliate."

04/17/2019: Assailants shot and killed a soldier in Beled Hawo, Gedo, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/17/2019: A suicide bomber detonated prematurely on a highway in Faryab, Afghanistan. The assailant was the only reported casualty. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/17/2019: Assailants threw a petrol bomb at the residence of National Conference leader and former Member of the Legislative Assembly, Ali Mohd Dar, in Doni Wari, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle carrying military personnel in Khudwani, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/17/2019: An explosive device detonated outside Chaudhary Group of Industries at Dumkauli Bazaar in Devachuli, Province 4, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

04/17/2019: An explosive device detonated near a vehicle transporting elections officials in Balandapada, Odisha, India. Following the blast, assailants then opened fire on the vehicle. At least one official, identified as Sanjukta Digal, was killed in the attack. This was one of two related incidents targeting elections officials on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

04/17/2019: An explosive device detonated near two vehicles transporting election officials in Phiringia, Odisha, India. Following the blast, assailants then stopped the vehicles, forced the passengers to exit the vehicles, and then set both vehicles on fire. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related incidents targeting elections officials on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

04/17/2019: Assailants raided a Ganesh Yadav road construction site in Giridih, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties, but at least three machines were set on fire during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

04/16/2019: Assailants abducted and killed a civilian, identified as Chudka Besra, in Kenduadih Basti, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.
04/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on Sakariya Waemamah in Ban Taseh, Yala, Thailand. Waemamah, an assistant village head, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/17/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Narayanpur, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

04/17/2019: Assailants stabbed and killed Raju Ram Gode, a home guard, in Nelasnar, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

04/17/2019: A grenade detonated outside of the house of Anil Gupta, a local Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader, in Bakaliaghat, Assam, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. 04/19/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting civilians fleeing Kadah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least one person was killed and several others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.
