04/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on Abdul Qayoom Pandith in Jablipora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Pandith, a contractor and Peoples’ Democratic Party activist, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/20/2019: Assailants attacked Bolon, Adamawa, Nigeria. At least 13 civilians were killed in the attack. This was one of three related incidents in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/20/2019: Assailants attacked Bolki, Numan, Adamawa, Nigeria. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any civilian casualties. This was one of three related incidents in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/20/2019: Assailants attacked Bujum, Adamawa, Nigeria. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any civilian casualties. This was one of three related incidents in the area on this date. 04/20/2019: Four suicide bombers detonated near Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) soldiers in Rashidin neighborhood, Aleppo, Syria. 04/19/2019: Assailants attacked and killed Captain Mahmoud Abdul Aziz Saif al-Humaidi, a police official, in Jumhori, Taizz, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/21/2019: A suicide bomber, identified as Alawudeen Ahmed Muwath, detonated explosives at St. Anthony’s Shrine on Kochichikade Street in Colombo, Western, Sri Lanka. This was one of eight coordinated attacks in Sri Lanka on Easter Sunday. In addition to eight suicide bombers, at least 258 people, including four United States citizens, were killed and at least 500 others were injured across the blasts. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Christians and citizens of "coalition countries" were targeted in the attacks. Authorities, however, questioned the veracity of this claim. Jamaat al-Tawhid al-Watania also claimed responsibility for the attacks. Additionally, sources attributed the attacks to National Thowheeth Jama'ath and Jammiyathul Millathu Ibrahim.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/21/2019: A suicide bomber, identified as Abdul Latif Jameel Mohamed, detonated explosives at the Tropical Inn on College Avenue in Dehiwala, Western, Sri Lanka. This was one of eight coordinated attacks in Sri Lanka on Easter Sunday. In addition to eight suicide bombers, at least 258 people, including four United States citizens, were killed and at least 500 others were injured across the blasts. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Christians and citizens of "coalition countries" were targeted in the attacks. Authorities, however, questioned the veracity of this claim. Jamaat al-Tawhid al-Watania also claimed responsibility for the attacks. Additionally, sources attributed the attacks to National Thowheeth Jama'ath and Jammiyathul Millathu Ibrahim.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/21/2019: A pipe bomb was discovered and safely defused near Bandaranaike International Airport in Katunayake, Western, Sri Lanka. This was one of eight coordinated attacks in Sri Lanka on Easter Sunday. In addition to eight suicide bombers, at least 258 people, including four United States citizens, were killed and at least 500 others were injured across the other seven attacks. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Christians and citizens of "coalition countries" were targeted in the attacks. Authorities, however, questioned the veracity of this claim. Jamaat al-Tawhid al-Watania also claimed responsibility for the attacks. Additionally, sources attributed the attacks to National Thowheeth Jama'ath and Jammiyathul Millathu Ibrahim.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/21/2019: Assailants opened fire on a security checkpost in Shawal, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One soldier was killed and a second was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/20/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a Somali National Army (SNA) vehicle in Sabiid, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Two soldiers were killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/20/2019: An explosive-device detonated targeting a military fuel tanker truck in Balli Doogle, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Two soldiers were killed and an unknown number of soldiers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/21/2019: Assailants opened fire on the residence of Jawad al-Musawi in Banuk, Adhamiyah, Baghdad, Iraq. Al-Musawi, a Member of Parliament and Istiqamah Party of the Sa'irun Alliance member, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, a mosque muezzin was arrested in connection with the attack.

04/21/2019: Assailants, including a suicide bomber, attacked a police station in Al-Zulfi, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. Four assailants were killed and three soldiers were injured in the incident. The Najd Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibliity and stated the attack was carried out in retaliation for the imprisonment and killing of members of the group around the world.
gname: Najd Province of the Islamic State

summary: 04/21/2019: Assailants opened fire on a military camp in Guire, Koulikoro, Mali. At least 11 soldiers and an unknown number of others, including assailants, were killed and injured in the attack. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/21/2019: Assailants attacked and killed a soldier in Qarabagh district, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/21/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy in Tareedisho, Banaadir, Somalia. Two AMISOM soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/19/2019: An explosive device detonated in Shirin Tagab district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least one person was killed and another person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/21/2019: Assailants set fire to trains at Cape Town train station in Foreshore, Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa. No casualties were reported, though several train cars were damaged in the blaze. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/21/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Kauran, Maguindanao, Philippines. A police officer was injured in the blast. This was one of two similar attacks in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

04/21/2019: Assailants attacked a Civilian Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) base in Kauran, Maguindanao, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two similar attacks in the same area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).
04/21/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol team near Burewala, Punjab, Pakistan. Two police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/21/2019: Assailants attacked security forces in Nayon Taung, Rakhine, Myanmar. There were no reported casualties. In addition, five explosive devices were discovered and defused at the scene of the clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).

04/22/2019: Assailants detonated explosive devices and opened fire targeting a police vehicle in Maungdaw district, Rakhine, Myanmar. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Rohingya Salvation Army (ARSA).

04/21/2019: Assailants attacked the Libyan Democratic Rally headquarters and abducted four people in Nawfaliyin, Tripoli, Libya. One of the hostages, Dr. Rihab Banubah, was released. The fate of the remaining three hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/21/2019: Assailants attacked government forces positions in Khadra, Ad Dali, Yemen. This was one of three related incidents west of Ad Dali on the same day. Dozens of assailants were killed and injured across all three ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

04/21/2019: Assailants attacked government forces positions in Tabbasha, Ad Dali, Yemen. This was one of three related incidents west of Ad Dali on the same day. Dozens of assailants were killed and injured across all three ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

04/21/2019: Assailants attacked government forces positions in Zaqma, Ad Dali, Yemen. This was one of three related incidents west of Ad Dali on the same day. Dozens of assailants were killed and injured across all three ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

04/22/2019: Assailants detonated explosive devices targeting Al-Wateef bridge in Hamk, Ibb, Yemen. There were no reported injuries but the bridge was completely destroyed. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) and believed the attack was intended to prevent the transportation of goods.

04/22/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated near a bus stop in Dera Murad Jamali, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least 10 people, including two Counter Terrorism Department (CTD) officials, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/22/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Hodan, Mogadishu, Somalia. Two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

04/22/2019: Assailants abducted 24 members of the Salozai tribe in Chaparhar district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. The hostages were rescued by security personnel later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 04/22/2019: Assailants attacked Madfa, Baaj, Nineveh, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/22/2019: Assailants threw an incendiary device at a Turkish consulate at Weinbergstrasse 65 in Zurich, Switzerland. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/22/2019: Assailants threw a hand grenade at the Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) office in Sopore, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/22/2019: Explosive devices were discovered and safely defused at the Little Flower School in Sangaiporou, Imphal, Manipur, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Kangleipak Communist Party (KCP) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out to warn the school for "allegedly dragging the outfit in the admission imbroglio."

04/22/2019: Assailants extorted money from civilians in Qarabagh district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Eight assailants were killed in an ensuing clash with responding security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/22/2019: Assailants attacked park rangers at Virunga National Park in Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least five rangers and a driver were killed and another ranger was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
04/22/2019: Assailants abducted two civilians in Kanungu district, Uganda. The hostages were released the following day after a ransom payment. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/22/2019: Assailants opened fire on Bernardino "Toto" Patigas in front of Escalante National High School in Alimango, Negros Occidental, Philippines. Patigas, a local councilor and Bayan Muna leader, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/22/2019: Assailants planted two explosive devices outside an under-construction chapel in Pimbalayan, Sultan Kudarat, Philippines. One of the devices detonated as security forces attempted to defuse it. There were no reported casualties in the blast and the second device was successfully defused. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

04/22/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a Mohmand Rifles patrol in Torkhel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one soldier was killed and two soldiers were injured in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/22/2019: Two explosive devices detonated near an Assam Rifles transit camp at Minuthong Bridge, Imphal East, Imphal, Manipur, India. A teacher was injured in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/22/2019: Assailants abducted Wahidah 'Abdallah Wahidah Najm al-Sulaymani, the Deputy Defense Minister of the Government of National Accord (GNA), in Tripoli, Libya. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Nawasi Brigade.
04/22/2019: An explosive device detonated in Arihah, Idlib, Syria. At least one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/22/2019: Two explosive devices detonated in Kaing Gyi, Rakhine, Myanmar. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).

04/23/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police officer providing security for a polio vaccination team in Bannu, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The officer was killed in the attack. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out because the victim was guarding a polio team who provided "the poisonous polio vaccine under a calculated conspiracy."

04/23/2019: Assailants attacked Saint Frederick Comprehensive High School in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. The assailants fired shots in the air, disarmed the gateperson at gunpoint and abducted Mubang Michel, the proprietor of the school. Michel was released later in the day after being tortured. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/23/2019: Assailants stormed the residence of Mayor Awoh Ndang Denis and set it on fire in the outskirts of Fundong, North-West, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties. Separatists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the victim providing intelligence to the military, which had earlier set fire to two residences in the area.

04/23/2019: Assailants opened fire on a Municipal Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Office (MDRRMO) rescue vehicle transporting two injured soldiers in Bandiangon, North Cotabato, Philippines. At least one civilian was injured in the assault and it is unknown whether there were any casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/23/2019: Assailants detonated explosive devices and opened fire at soldiers in Beri, Samar, Philippines. Six soldiers were killed and six soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/23/2019: Assailants shot and killed a soldier in Baqubah, Diyala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/23/2019: Assailants fired grenades at a military training camp in Jowhar, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. One soldier was killed and five soldiers were injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/23/2019: An assailant drove his vehicle into a crowd of civilians in Sunnyvale, California, United States. At least eight people were injured in the attack. Isaiah Joel Peoples was arrested in connection with the incident and authorities stated that Peoples "targeted the victims based on their race and his belief that they were of the Muslim faith."

04/23/2019: Assailants opened fire on a Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) position in Kauwa, Borno, Nigeria. At least three assailants were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

04/23/2019: Assailants attacked the Al Hudaydah military airport in Hudaydah, Yemen. At least 24 assailants were killed in the ensuing clash with security forces. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

04/23/2019: Assailants stopped a passenger bus in Liki, Sahel, Burkina Faso. Four passengers were shot and killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Muslim extremists carried out the attack.

04/23/2019: An explosive device detonated in Bandarchua, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

04/23/2019: An explosive device planted on a motorcycle detonated in Dera Allah Yar, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least 12 civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/23/2019: An explosive device targeting a United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) vehicle detonated in Mir Hassan, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/23/2019: Assailants attacked the Indian Forest Service office in Kuanria, Odisha, India. There were no reported casualties but several guns were stolen in the incident. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities doubted the veracity of this claim.

04/23/2019: An explosive device detonated in Pachpedi, Chhattisgarh, India. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

04/23/2019: An assailant attempted to set fire to the North Austin Muslim Community center in Austin, Texas, United States. There were no reported casualties as the fire failed to ignite. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; though sources believed the attack to be religiously motivated.
04/23/2019: Assailants threw explosive devices at voters in Domkal, West Bengal, India. At least one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/23/2019: Assailants threw an explosive device at voters in Raninanagar, West Bengal, India. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/23/2019: Assailants attacked Ibrahim al-Ghazlan in Daraa, Syria. Al-Ghazlan, a former Free Syrian Army (FSA) leader, was killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/00/2019: Sometime between April 8, 2019 and May 7, 2019, assailants attacked and injured two civilians in Kader, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

04/00/2019: Sometime between April 8, 2019 and May 7, 2019, assailants attacked and killed two civilians accused of being police informants in Tahakadod, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

04/23/2019: Assailants abducted Abdul Rahman Kudaish, a lawyer, along Jamal Street in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. The whereabouts of Kudaish are unknown. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/23/2019: Assailants opened fire and killed Joel Canatoy, a former New People's Army (NPA) member, in Butuan district, Agusan del Norte, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/24/2019: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Maricela Vallejo Orea in Sierra de Zongolica, Veracruz, Mexico. Orea, the mayor of Mixtla de Altamirano, was killed along with her husband and their driver. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police officer guarding a polio vaccination team in Ghalo Tangai, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2019: Assailants abducted Shufai Big Ndzendzev, second in command to Fon Semh Mbinglo III, in Kumbo, North-West, Cameroon. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of separatists.
04/24/2019: An explosive device detonated in Tafriqah, Diyala, Iraq. A merchant, Husayn Farhan, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2019: Assailants attacked police checkpoints in Anar Dara district, Farah, Afghanistan. At least 14 assailants and two police officers were killed in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2019: Assailants attacked security checkposts in Ruyi Du Ab district, Samangan, Afghanistan. Four soldiers were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. It is unknown if the assailants sustained casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/24/2019: An assailant opened fire civilians in Zahra, Taizz, Yemen. Three civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

04/24/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Yusuf “Dhedo” Mohamed Wa’ays, the Governor of Bari, near Jubba Hotel in Bosaso, Bari, Somalia. The governor was unharmed; however, three soldiers were injured in the blast. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2019: Assailants opened fire on the residence of Pulakesh Mahanta, a BJP leader, in Lajum, Margherita, Assam, India. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2019: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Yathrib, Saladin, Iraq. At least three security personnel were killed and one other was injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/24/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at the Cabanatuan Electric Corp. (Celcor) compound in Bitas, Nueva Ecija, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2019: Assailants armed with projectiles and firearms attacked military forces in At Tuhayat district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were an unknown number of assailants killed and injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

04/24/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police convoy travelling to defuse an explosive device in Anar Dara district, Farah, Afghanistan. At least nine police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/24/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated near a Hay’at Tahrir a-Sham (HTS) governance building in Jisr al-Shughur, Idlib, Syria. At least 17 people were killed and 27 other people were injured in the blast; the victims included HTS members and civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/24/2019: Assailants opened fire on Berto Guiamadel on his way to a market in Shariff Saidona, Maguindanao, Philippines. Guiamadel, a local councilor, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/24/2019: Assailants opened fire on Claver Miral along a highway in Hermano, Misamis Oriental, Philippines. Miral, a local village chief, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/24/2019: Assailants, including at least one suicide bomber, attacked Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) soldiers in Al-Ghab Plains Hamah, Syria. At least six soldiers and three assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to a group previously affiliated with Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham.

04/24/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely detonated outside the house of a retired public works engineer in Haobam Marak Chingtham Leikai, Imphal West, Imphal, Manipur, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2019: Assailants fired on a military helicopter in the process of unloading soldiers and supplies in Nduga district, Papua, Indonesia. At least two soldiers were wounded in the attack. The Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/24/2019: An assailant set fire to the house of a prominent real estate developer in La Jolla, San Diego, California, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack, but the door of the house was damaged. This was one of two related attacks carried out by the assailant on this day. Daniel Hector Mackinnon was arrested the next day when he attempted to return to the United States from Mexico. Sources noted that the developer was targeted "based on the nature of the business and/or their professional/political ties.” Mackinnon plead guilty to one count of malicious damage to building by means of fire and was sentenced to seven years in prison for “politically motivated arsons.”

04/24/2019: An assailant drove his vehicle into a Raytheon building before setting it on fire in Kearny Mesa, San Diego, California, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack, but the building was damaged. This was one of two related attacks carried out by the assailant on this day. Daniel Hector Mackinnon was arrested the next day when he attempted to return to the United States from Mexico. Sources noted that the building was targeted "based on the nature of the business and/or their professional/political ties.” Mackinnon plead guilty to one count of malicious damage to building by means of fire and was sentenced to seven years in prison for “politically motivated arsons.”

04/25/2019: Assailants opened fire on Pathomphong Kaewthong, a volunteer ranger, and his wife, Nureehan Dengla, in Kadunong, Pattani, Thailand. Kaewthong and Dengla were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to anti-government extremists.

04/25/2019: An explosive device detonated prematurely as an assailant was planting it at Jahan University in Kart-e-Naw area, 8th police district, Kabul, Afghanistan. The assailant was killed and three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/25/2019: Assailants opened fire on a polio vaccination team in Sultanzai, Balochistan, Pakistan. One member of the team was killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/25/2019: Assailants opened fire in Chobongo Market in Khao Tum, Pattani, Thailand. One person was killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/25/2019: Assailants attacked Jurn, Nineveh, Iraq. At least two Albu-Badran tribe members were killed in the incident. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 04/25/2019: Assailants opened fire on Apolinario Lebico, a village chief, and Jeremy Capoquian, his son-in-law, in Las Navas, Northern Samar, Philippines. Lebico was killed and Capoquian was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/25/2019: Assailants shelled a school in Wadi al-Qadhi, Taizz, Yemen. At least one person was killed and six people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.
04/26/2019: Assailants shot and killed Wilmar Calutan, a village chief, in Beri, Calbiga, Samar, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/25/2019: An explosive-laden drone was discovered and shot down over the Arab coalition headquarters in Buraiqeh, Adan, Yemen. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/25/2019: An explosive device detonated in a park in Taza Khurmatu, Kirkuk, Iraq. Two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/25/2019: An assailant stabbed and killed Yusuf Sha'if 'Awn Humrah, a child, in Maqbanah, Taizz, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
04/25/2019: A sniper shot and killed Aziz al-Wahsi, a child, in Wadi al-Madam, Al-Jomhouri, Taizz, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/25/2019: Assailants opened fire on Security forces in Jumhuri, Taizz, Yemen. A civilian was killed and eight civilians were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Abbas Brigade.

04/25/2019: Security forces identified assailants as they were planting an explosive device along railway tracks in Nasirabad district, Balochistan, Pakistan. As security forces approached, the assailants opened fire. One assailant was killed in the ensuing clash and the explosive device was defused. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/25/2019: Assailants attacked a military base in Sabiid, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/25/2019: Assailants attacked an ethnic-Tuareg leader in Inates, Tillaberi, Niger. Rhissa Ag Amdagh was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).

summary: 04/25/2019: Assailants attacked a security convoy in Dashti Qala district, Takhar, Afghanistan. Two soldiers were killed and five were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/25/2019: Assailants abducted Federal Bureau of Revenue Assistant Director Riaz Khan Miyani and three other people in Kot Murtaza, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. All four hostages were released on July 18, 2019. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/25/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting security forces in Rashad, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least three security officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/25/2019: An explosive device detonated in Annaram, Telangana, India. No casualties were reported but a dog was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/26/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting an under construction Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) office in Hariharganj, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Jharkhand on this day. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded that citizens boycott the upcoming Palamu Lok Sabha election, which was scheduled for April 29, 2019.

04/26/2019: Assailants set fire to construction equipment at an under-construction bridge in Turi, Jharkhand, India. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Jharkhand on this day. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded that citizens boycott the upcoming Palamu Lok Sabha election, which was scheduled for April 29, 2019.

04/25/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Aliawa, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. At least one civilian was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/25/2019: Assailants opened fire on a campaign convoy in Inolingan, Negros Occidental, Philippines. Michael Garcia, a local councilor, and Mark Garcia, the brother of Vice Mayor Ella Celestina Garcia-Yulo, were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/25/2019: Assailants opened fire on Muwaffaq al-Ghazzawi in Muzayrib, Daraa, Syria. Al-Ghazzawi, a former Jaysh al-Mu'tazz Billah leader, was killed and three other people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
04/25/2019: Assailants attacked Boulde, Mopti, Mali. At least 15 people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/25/2019: Assailants opened fire on Ariel Sotomayor in Mayao Crossing, Quezon, Philippines. Sotomayor, an Ibabang Dupay village councilor, was killed and a passerby was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/25/2019: Gunmen opened fire and injured Imran Lemar, a journalist, in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/26/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting security forces in Razmak, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One security member was killed and three were injured in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/26/2019: Assailants attacked a Nigerian Army base in Mararrabar Kimba, Borno, Nigeria. One NDS officer was killed and three others, including another NDS officer, a border police officer and a civilian, were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/02/2019: Assailants attacked a local police outpost in Chahar Dara district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed. This was one of two similar attacks in Kunduz on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/02/2019: Assailants attacked a pro-government militia outpost in Dashti Archi district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Five militia members were killed in the attack. This was one of two similar attacks in Kunduz on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/02/2019: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Chinar, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Four police officers were killed and three others were wounded. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/02/2019: Assailants attacked a pro-government militia outpost in Aqcha district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. Two militia members were killed and three others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/02/2019: Assailants attacked a pro-government militia outpost in Saray Andkhoy, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least seven people, including three militia members and four civilians, were killed and another two militia members were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/02/2019: Assailants kidnapped two communal leaders and one of their sons in Iscuande, Narino, Colombia. All three hostages were executed sometime prior to May 8, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on a civilian vehicle in Chargo, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Three civilians were killed and another two were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the Taliban were responsible for the attack, which the group denied.

05/02/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel in Uribe, Meta, Colombia. Seven people, including two soldiers and five civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources suspected the involvement of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 05/01/2019: Assailants detonated explosive devices and opened fire on a military base in Motilandia, Norte de Santander, Colombia. One soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

05/02/2019: Explosives-laden bodies, killed in an attack the previous day, detonated while community members were searching for them near Tiguila, Mopti, Mali. Six civilians were killed in the blast. This was one of three related attacks near Tiguila across May 1-2, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/02/2019: Assailants shot and killed Rami Mohammed al-Mosaabi, a High Council of the Revolutionary Movement leader, at Caltex Roundabout in Mansura, Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/02/2019: Assailants attacked police officers in Shinkay district, Zabul, Afghanistan. Five police personnel, including the district police chief and head of the intelligence department, were killed and another three police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
05/02/2019: Assailants shot and injured a former Bhartiya Janta Party (BJP) activist in Kuchmulla, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on an Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) position in Museke, near Tchomia, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least four soldiers were killed and three other soldiers were injured in the assault. It is unknown whether the assailants suffered any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/02/2019: Security forces identified and killed a suicide bomber and another assailant in Tal Afar, Nineveh, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 05/02/2019: Assailants attacked Murposa, Adamawa, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks in Adamawa on this day. Five civilians were killed across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists were involved in the attack.

05/02/2019: Assailants attacked Bankam, Adamawa, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks in Adamawa on this day. Five civilians were killed across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists were involved in the attack.

05/02/2019: Assailants attacked Wuro Hausa, Adamawa, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks in Adamawa on this day. Five civilians were killed across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists were involved in the attack.

05/02/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting soldiers at a military base in Baga, Borno, Nigeria. Three soldiers were killed and eight others were wounded in the blast. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/02/2019: Assailants attacked an Israeli settler in Hawara, West Bank, West Bank and Gaza Strip. The settler was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

05/02/2019: An explosives-laden motorbike detonated in Qabasin, Aleppo, Syria. At least eight people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).
05/03/2019: An explosive device detonated near a civilian home in Basra, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/03/2019: Assailants attacked a military base in Magumeri, Borno, Nigeria. At least five soldiers were killed and 19 others were injured in the incident. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any assailant casualties. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/03/2019: Assailants attacked security forces in Burka district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least 37 people, including seven security personnel and 30 assailants, were killed and 14 others, including four security personnel and ten assailants, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/03/2019: A landmine detonated targeting a police vehicle in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/03/2019: Assailants attacked Ntapuala, Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. This was one of two attacks in Macomia on this day. At least four people were killed across the two attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

05/03/2019: Assailants attacked Banga Velha, Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. This was one of two attacks in Macomia on this day. At least four people were killed across the two attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

05/03/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting civilian vehicles in Anin, Hadramawt, Yemen. At least six people were killed and four other people were injured in the blast. Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP) claimed responsibility for the blast.

05/03/2019: Assailants opened fire on a civilian vehicle in Shirqat, Saladin, Iraq. At least one person was killed and four others were wounded in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 05/03/2019: Assailants set fire to Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) positions in Laudjo, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related arson incidents in and around Laudjo on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

05/03/2019: Assailants set fire to civilian residences in a village on the outskirts of Laudjo, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related arson incidents in and around Laudjo on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

05/03/2019: Assailants set fire to civilian residences in a village on the outskirts of Laudjo, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related arson incidents in and around Laudjo on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

05/03/2019: Assailants set fire to civilian residences in a village on the outskirts of Laudjo, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related arson incidents in and around Laudjo on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

05/03/2019: Assailants set fire to civilian residences in a village on the outskirts of Laudjo, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of five related arson incidents in and around Laudjo on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

05/03/2019: An improvised explosive device detonated near a vehicle in Inates, Tillaberi, Niger. Six civilians were killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).

summary: 05/03/2019: Assailants abducted a deputy police chief and a local commander in Sozma Qala district, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. Both hostages were later killed by the assailants. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
05/03/2019: Assailants attacked civilians in Dih Yak district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/03/2019: Assailants attacked and killed the wife and son of an Afghan Army soldier in Hassan Khail, Paktia, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Taliban.

05/03/2019: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle carrying Rogelio Concepcion, a municipal councilor, and his staff in Balaoan, La Union, Philippines. Concepcion and four of his aides were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/03/2019: Assailants detonated an explosive device at a Bhartiya Janta Party (BJP) office in Chandni Chowk, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack; however, an unknown number of workers were held hostage during the incident and released after the explosive devices detonated. Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident in pamphlets left at the scene and demanded that citizens boycott the ongoing elections.

05/03/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel performing election duty at Central High School in Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/30/2019: Assailants attacked Qatn, Hadramawt, Yemen. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/03/2019: An explosive device detonated in Aurangabad district, Bihar, India. A civilian was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

05/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on Telésforo Santiago Enríquez, a journalist and founder of a community radio station, in Juchitan de Zaragoza, Oaxaca, Mexico. Enríquez was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/03/2019: Assailants opened fire on Punjabi laborers in Lajjay, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least six workers were killed and another worker was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/03/2019: Snipers opened fire on Israeli Defense Force (IDF) soldiers, including Colonel Liron Batito, at the Israel-Gaza Border in Southern, Israel. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ).

05/03/2019: Assailants attacked a team burying an Ebola victim in Katwa, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/03/2019: Assailants opened fire on Mahmoud al-Araj, a soldier, near the al-Kuraimi Bank in Taizz, Yemen. Al-Araj was killed and a civilian was injured in the attack. This was one of three attacks on soldiers in Taizz on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/04/2019: Two explosive devices detonated outside of a civilian residence in Mukhaysah, Diyala, Iraq. At least one civilian was killed and two others were wounded in the blasts. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 05/04/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in front of the Mosul Education Community Center in Al-Majmua al-Thaqafah, Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. At least two civilians were wounded in the blast. An unknown group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/04/2019: Assailants executed four people accused on being affiliated with Iraqi Volunteer Forces in Badush, Nineveh, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 05/04/2019: Assailants attacked activist Francia Marquez in Santander de Quilichao district, Cauca, Colombia. Two security guards were injured in the attack. A 17-year old was arrested for their role in the attack.

05/04/2019: Assailants opened fire on a security checkpoint in Boldak Nika, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least seventeen people, including three police officers and 14 assailants, were killed and 11 others, including four police officers and seven assailants, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/05/2019: An explosive device detonated in Chah e Kohsani, Herat, Afghanistan. At least three children were killed and two other children were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/05/2019: Assailants attacked Hareri Hosle, Mandera, Kenya. At least one police officer was wounded and food and weapons were stolen during the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/04/2019: Assailants attacked Nicate, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. Seven people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

05/04/2019: Assailants attacked a Somali National Army (SNA) base in Barire, Lower Shebelle , Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/04/2019: A sniper shot and killed an Iraqi Volunteer Forces fighter near Muqdadiyah, Diyala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 05/04/2019: Assailants set fire to two vehicles transporting medicine for a vaccination campaign in Hombori, Mopti, Mali. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/04/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting Puntland security officials in Bosaso, Bari, Somalia. There were an unknown number of casualties, including deputy Muhammad Ali Mire, in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/04/2019: Assailants armed with firearms and knives attacked the Libyan National Army's (LNA) 73 Infantry Brigade in Sabha, Libya. At least seven soldiers were killed in the attack. This was one of three related attacks on the LNA in Sabha on this date. The Fezzan Province of the Islamic State, the Sumud Brigade, and the Misrata Brigades each separately claimed responsibility for the incidents.

summary: 05/04/2019: Assailants armed with firearms and knives attacked the Libyan National Army's (LNA) Battalion 166 headquarters in Sabha, Fezzan, Libya. At least seven soldiers were killed in the attack. This was one of three related attacks on the LNA in Sabha on this date. The Fezzan Province of the Islamic State, the Sumud Brigade, and the Misrata Brigades each separately claimed responsibility for the incidents.

summary: 05/04/2019: Assailants armed with firearms and knives attacked the Libyan National Army's (LNA) Battalion 160 in Sabha, Fezzan, Libya. At least ten soldiers were killed in the attack. This was one of three related attacks on the LNA in Sabha on this date. The Fezzan Province of the Islamic State, the Sumud Brigade, and the Misrata Brigades each separately claimed responsibility for the incidents.

summary: 05/04/2019: Assailants fired a rocket in Gaza, Gaza Strip, West Bank and Gaza Strip. The rocket detonated prematurely, killing two Palestinian civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement), which the group denied.

05/04/2019: Assailants fired a rocket at a house in Kissufim, Southern, Israel. No casualties were reported. This was one of nine rocket attacks in Israel within 24 hours. Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement) and Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incidents.

05/04/2019: Assailants fired a rocket at Shaar HaNegev regional council, Southern, Israel. The rocket landed in a yard next to a house. No casualties were reported. This was one of nine rocket attacks in Israel within 24 hours. Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement) and Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incidents.

05/05/2019: Assailants set fire to the Government Middle School serving as a polling station in Keegam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/04/2019: Assailants shot and killed Gul Mohammad Mir, the Anantnag district vice president for the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), at his house in Nowgam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/04/2019: Assailants abducted a civilian accused of being a police informant from Mardhar, Maharashtra, India. The hostage was killed shortly after the kidnapping. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/04/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Sayed Ha, Takhar, Afghanistan. Three pro-government militia members were killed and four others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
05/04/2019: Assailants shot and killed Edgardo Podpod Vinas, a barangay chief, in La Roche San Miguel, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/04/2019: Assailants in Iraq launched mortar shells targeting a military base in Hakkari, Turkey. Three soldiers were killed and one soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

05/04/2019: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Qadis district, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least seven police officers were killed and three other police officers were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/04/2019: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting Hazart Mohammad Rodwal, the Ahmadabad district chief, in Gardez, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least three people, including the assailant, were killed and four others, including Rodwal, were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/04/2019: Assailants attacked Hajar, Ad Dali, Yemen. It is unknown if there were any casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/03/2019: Assailants intercepted a transport bus and opened fire on a soldier in Taizz, Yemen. The soldier, identified as Abdelkhaliq Abdulrahman Saif al-Hajj, was killed in the attack. This was one of three similar attacks on soldiers in Taizz on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/03/2019: Assailants attacked a soldier at the headquarters of the Taizz Military Axis in Taizz, Yemen. The soldier, identified as Ali Abdullah al-Subaihi, was killed in the attack. This was one of three similar attacks on soldiers in Taizz on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

Komarov, a journalist that wrote about corruption and embezzlement, was injured, placed in a medically-induced coma, and died from his injuries on June 20, 2019. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the victim was targeted for his work as a journalist.

05/04/2019: Assailants attacked Cambalidio, Camarines Sur, Philippines. There were no reported casualties, but the pipes of a water system were burned in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

Following the blast, additional assailants stormed the compound and opened fire on the officers. Two additional suicide bombers detonated in the compound. At least 28 people, including 18 police officers, two civilians, and eight assailants, were killed and 60 other people were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however sources noted that the attack followed rumors "that some children were being poisoned and dying from contaminated polio vaccines."

The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

At least 20 soldiers were killed, an unknown number were injured, and two were abducted across both attacks. The outcome of the abductions is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

05/05/2019: Assailants abducted two civilians accused of being police informants from Bijapur district, Chhattisgarh, India. Both hostages were killed later on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

05/05/2019: Assailants attacked military forces positions in Hamr, Qatabah, Ad Dali, Yemen. There were an unknown number of casualties in the incident. This was one of three attacks in Ad Dali on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/05/2019: Assailants attacked military forces positions in Hajar, Ad Dali, Yemen. There were an unknown number of casualties in the incident. 05/05/2019: Assailants attacked military forces positions in Sailat al-Abbari, Qatabah, Ad Dali, Yemen. There were an unknown number of casualties in the incident. This was one of three attacks in Ad Dali on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/06/2019: Assailants opened fire on a military detachment in a village in Malibatuan, North Cotabato, Philippines. It is unknown whether anybody was wounded in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

05/05/2019: Assailants opened fire on the house of Amnuay Yotkaew, an assistant village head, in Khuan Ran, Songkhla, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in the area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/05/2019: Assailants detonated two explosive devices targeting a Border Patrol Police Command vehicle responding to an earlier attack in Khuan Ran, Songkhla, Thailand. Five officers were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/06/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in Altun Kupri, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least three police officers were killed and another officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 05/04/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police station in Toribio, Cauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.

summary: 05/06/2019: Assailants attacked a military base in Diankabou, Mopti, Mali. At least five assailants were killed and three soldiers were wounded in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

summary: 05/06/2019: Assailants opened fire on a security forces vehicle in Datta Khel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One soldier was killed and three were injured in the attack. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/06/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at a school being used as a polling station in Chatapora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/06/2019: Assailants threw a petrol bomb at a Government Middle School serving as a polling station in Batnoor, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No casualties or damage were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/06/2019: Assailants threw an explosive device at a Government Middle School serving as a polling station in Rahmoo, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/06/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at a polling station in Tiken Batpora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties as the grenade failed to detonate and was later safely defused. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspect that the attack may have been motivated by anti-Muslim sentiments targeting the family's Ramadan decorations.

summary: 05/07/2019: Assailants attacked soldiers in Sheikh Zuweid, North Sinai, Egypt. This was one of two related incidents in North Sinai on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, the attack occurred while votes were being counted for the recent elections.

05/16/2019: Assailants threw homemade explosive devices at a ranger base in Bangoi Sinae, Yala, Thailand. At least one ranger was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by anti-government extremists.

05/16/2019: Assailants opened fire on villagers and set fire to residences and a school in a neighborhood in Palma, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least one person was killed and 48 civilian residences were damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/16/2019: Assailants attempted to attack the Al Hudaydah airport in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Six assailants were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/17/2019: Assailants opened fire at the residence of Brigadier 'Abd-al-Hafiz al-Saqqaf, the Ibb governorate police chief, in Sanaa, Wahdah, Amanat Al Asimah, Yemen. It is unknown whether there were any casualties in the ensuing clash with guards. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/17/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the house of the head of the Basra Water Department in Basra, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2019: An explosive device detonated in a field in Yousif Bag, Diyala, Iraq. A civilian, identified as Ali Maykhan, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/17/2019: An explosive device detonated against a vehicle in Mubarak, Diyala, Iraq. A teacher, identified as Nabil Akbar, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) carried out the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/17/2019: Assailants attacked and wounded an assistant director general at the Ministry of Construction, Housing, and Municipalities in Baghdad, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/17/2019: Assailants with bows and firearms attacked Shibate, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. One assailant was killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2019: Assailants attacked a Jubaland Forces (JF) and Kenyan African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) base in Diif, Lower Juba, Somalia. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2019: An explosive device attached to a government vehicle detonated in the 9th Police District, Kabul, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed and another was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2019: An assailant, in an insider attack, stole weapons from a security outpost and used them against the pro-government militia members in Kolbaqal, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. One militia member was killed. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/17/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Urozgani, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/17/2019: Assailants shot and killed a police officer in Miran Shah, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, pamphlets targeting the police officer had been handed out a few days before the attack.
05/17/2019: Assailants opened fire in the Degaan Bazaar in Datta Khel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one person was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on Maulana Khan Daraz, a tribal elder, in Degan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Daraz was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/17/2019: An explosive device detonated in Sarwakai, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one child was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2019: Assailants threw grenades and opened fire on a police vehicle on the Superhighway near Chakar Hotel in Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan. One assailant was killed and two police officers were injured in the ensuing clash. Security forces safely defused a grenade that had failed to detonate. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2019: Assailants detonated explosives at a panchayat office in Timurpalli, Odisha, India. There no reported casualties in the blast. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for recent operations against the group.

05/17/2019: Assailants set fire to a Palestinian field in Burin, West Bank, West Bank and Gaza Strip. There were no casualties in the attack. This was one of three similar incidents in the West Bank on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Israeli settlers.

05/17/2019: Assailants set fire to a Palestinian field in Orif, West Bank, West Bank and Gaza Strip. There were no casualties in the attack. This was one of three similar incidents in the West Bank on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Israeli settlers.

05/17/2019: Assailants set fire to a Palestinian field in Asira al-Qibliya, West Bank, West Bank and Gaza Strip. There were no casualties in the attack. This was one of three similar incidents in the West Bank on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Israeli settlers.

05/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on a fuel truck at the Sadarak-Dyuluchu border checkpoint in Dyuluchu, Igdir, Turkey. At least one customs officer was injured and the truck was destroyed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/16/2019: Assailants attacked security forces in Tangai, Helmand, Afghanistan. Eight police officers were killed and 11 others were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2019: Assailants attacked Kilhewa, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Nine civilians and one soldier were killed and it is unknown whether anybody was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).
05/17/2019: Assailants shot and killed Staff Sergeant Miranda Lumbatan, an off-duty soldier, in Tanuel, Maguindanao, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated targeting a district chief’s vehicle in Obe district, Herat, Afghanistan. At least four civilians were killed and 14 others, including the district chief, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/18/2019: An assailant threw a grenade at a police checkpoint in Kama district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Five people, including three civilians, were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 05/18/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in Dawasah, Nineveh, Iraq. Two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, two individuals were arrested in connection to the attack.

05/18/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) vehicle in Tessalit, Kidal, Mali. At least three Chadian peacekeepers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

05/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on a checkpoint at an oil field in Zillah, Jufra, Libya. At least two guards were killed and four others were kidnapped during the attack. Three of the hostages were successfully rescued and another escaped on the same day of the abduction. The Fezzan Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Fezzan Province of the Islamic State

summary: 05/18/2019: A landmine detonated in Bardaale, Bay, Somalia. Captain Fallar Liban Nurow, a member of the Bardaale District Council, was killed and three soldiers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/18/2019: An explosive device was discovered and defused on a road in Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle along the Khaf-Herat railway project in Ghoryan district, Herat, Afghanistan. Two people, including an Iranian engineer and an Afghan police officer, were killed and several people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2019: Assailants attempted to plant explosives at a building in Taizz, Yemen. Security forces thwarted the attack, arresting three assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/17/2019: Assailants shot and killed five government employees in Bondhere, Mogadishu, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

05/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on an Ethiopian military base in Bardere district, Gedo, Somalia. At least two soldiers were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2019: Assailants set fire to a civilian residence in Ibrahimiya, Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of 12 related attacks on houses in Ibrahimiya on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)
