summary: 05/19/2019: Assailants attacked the Evangelical Church Winning All (ECWA) in Dankande, Kaduna, Nigeria. Ten female choristers were abducted at the ECWA. The assailants left, after gaining information on where the Pastor Emmanuel Ibrahim lived, and abducted the Pastor, his daughter and 15 others. The outcome of the abductions is unknown. One civilian was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by Fulani extremists.

05/18/2019: Assailants detonated an improvised explosive device (IED) in the house of Chair of Balan Bihul municipality Dayananda Goit in Balan-Bihul, Province 2, Nepal. Shyam Goit was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
05/18/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused outside of a residence in Banbridge, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) forces in Timbuktu city, Timbuktu region, Mali. At least one Nigerian peacekeeper was killed and one other peacekeeper was injured in the attack. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2019: Assailants shot and killed a government employee in Kaaraan, Mogadishu, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that the attack was carried out because the victim was allegedly harassing villagers.

05/18/2019: An explosive device detonated near the vehicle of the deputy police commander in Washer district, Helmand, Afghanistan. Two people, including the deputy police commander and a guard, were killed and two other officers were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/18/2019: Assailants shot and killed a gendarme in Arbinda, Sahel, Burkina Faso. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on Madu Musaha camp, a refugee camp, in Dikwa, Borno, Nigeria. Two civilians were killed and 12 others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

05/18/2019: Assailants attacked a market in Lassa, Borno, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

05/18/2019: Assailants stopped a vehicle carrying civilians in Kele, Ouham-Pende, Central African Republic. Ten Cameroonian drivers and three passengers were abducted. Three of the hostages were released on May 21, 2019 and the remaining hostages were released on June 17, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Return, Reclamation, Rehabilitation (3R).
05/18/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at the house of a doctor in Imphal, Manipur, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2019: Assailants set fire to the pro-Israeli Daystar television studio in Abu Tor, Jerusalem, West Bank, West Bank and Gaza Strip. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Dalori, Borno, Nigeria. Two people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

05/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on a security guard after attempting to steal his weapon at Bab-e Fatima Imambargah in Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan. The security guard was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/18/2019: Assailants stabbed C.O.T. Naseer, an independent candidate, in Thalassery, Kerala, India. Naseer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2019: An explosive-laden balloon detonated targeting an IDF base east of Rafah, Gaza Strip, West Bank and Gaza Strip. No casualties were reported in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attribute it to Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement).

05/18/2019: Assailants attacked a checkpost in Kanjak, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. One assailant was killed and another assailant was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/18/2019: An explosive device detonated prematurely in Dangam district, Kunar, Afghanistan. One assailant was killed and another assailant was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/18/2019: Assailants set fire to the basement of a Thessaloniki metro construction site in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Moles claimed responsibility for the incident, stating that the attack was carried out in opposition to the metro construction, which the group believed would "push out poorer families from the city centre and increase living costs for all residents."
05/18/2019: An explosive device detonated in Atmeh, Idlib, Syria. At least one person was killed and two other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/19/2019: Assailants attacked a military vehicle on the Logar-Paktia highway in Puli Alam district, Logar, Afghanistan. At least five people, including three soldiers and two civilians, were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/19/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting Jamal al-Shammari, a local council member, in Kanaan, Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/19/2019: Assailants opened fire on a checkpoint in Koury, Yorosso, Sikasso, Mali. Seven people, including two gendarmes, one customs officer, and four civilians, were killed in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Yorosso on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

05/19/2019: Assailants opened fire on the subprefecture offices in Boura, Yorosso, Sikasso, Mali. One guard was injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Yorosso on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

05/19/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated near the Transportation Cooperatives headquarters in Xamar Weyne, Mogadishu, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two attacks in Mogadishu on this day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/19/2019: An explosive device planted under a vehicle detonated across from Djibouti School in Wadajir, Mogadishu, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two attacks in Mogadishu on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

05/19/2019: Assailants launched rockets at the United States embassy in Karkh, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Operations of Martyr Ali Mansour claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out "in retaliation for US President Donald Trump pardoning a soldier over the 2009 killing of an Iraqi detainee." Sources also suspected the involvement of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

05/19/2019: Assailants threw hand grenades and opened fire on a police checkpoint in the 7th Police District , Kabul, Afghanistan. At least five people, including two assailants and three police officers, were killed and another five people, including two assailants and three police officers, were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/19/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a tourist bus carrying South African tourists in Al-Haram, Giza, Egypt. At least 16 civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Hasam Movement.

05/19/2019: Assailants attacked an army base in Gubio, Borno, Nigeria. At least one soldier and five assailants were killed and three soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. Additionally, six soldiers were reported missing following the incident and their whereabouts are unknown. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/19/2019: Assailants set fire to wheat fields in a village in Makhmur, Nineveh, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/19/2019: Assailants set fire to wheat fields in a village in Makhmur, Nineveh, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/19/2019: Assailants hurled a fragmentation grenade during a festival in Teorama, Norte de Santander, Colombia. Seven individuals, including five civilians and two soldiers, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

05/19/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at a drinking spot in Maroua, Extreme-North, Cameroon. At least one person was killed and 28 other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

05/19/2019: Assailants threw a hand grenade at the home of the head of Ghadeer Municipality in Ghadeer, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties although the home was damaged. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/19/2019: Assailants opened fire on a military base in Wajid district, Bakool, Somalia. At least 14 assailants and three soldiers were killed and an unknown number of assailants and soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/19/2019: Assailants raided Ngalonga, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least two villagers were killed and more than 100 houses and two mills were set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/19/2019: Around 500 assailants ambushed a polling team and their security detail with machetes and rifles near Langbang, Arunachal Pradesh, India. Being outnumbered, members of the Central Reserve Police Force and India Reserve Battalion handed over the Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) without returning fire. There were no reported injuries. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National People's Party (India).

05/19/2019: Assailants shot and killed a Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) worker at his residence in Zungal Pora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Separatists.

05/19/2019: An assailant threw three Molotov cocktails at the Anshe Sholom Bnai Israel Congregation and the JCC Jewish Community Center in Lakeview, Chicago, Illinois, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/19/2019: Assailants threw an explosive device at a polling booth in Kolkata, West Bengal, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/19/2019: Assailants threw an explosive device at civilians in Deganga, West Bengal, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/19/2019: Assailants threw an explosive device at civilians in Raidighi, West Bengal, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/19/2019: An explosives-laden barrel was discovered and defused near the police academy in Shalalat, Nineveh, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/19/2019: Assailants attacked Dille, Borno, Nigeria. An unknown number of people, including the village head, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

05/19/2019: Assailants attacked the Great Man-Made River Project and cut of the water supply to Tripoli, Libya. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ahneish Militia.
05/19/2019: Assailants threw an explosive device in Kolkata, West Bengal, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/19/2019: Assailants threw explosive devices in Kolkata, West Bengal, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/19/2019: Assailants abducted and killed Qi Ching Thoai, the brother of an Awami League leader, in Rajbila, Chittagong, Bangladesh. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/19/2019: Assailants stabbed three prison guards and executed fellow inmates, including members of the Islamic Renaissance Party of Tajikistan, in Kirpichny prison in Kirpichny, Districts of Republican Subordination, Tajikistan. At least 32 people were killed, including three guards, 15 inmates, and 17 assailants, and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack and ensuing prison riot. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on Paula Andrea Rosero Ordonez near Samaniego, Narino, Colombia. Ordonez, the Samaniego ombudsman, was killed and her husband was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/20/2019: Assailants abducted tribal chieftain Rodito Buklas in Tagbuaya, Agusan del Norte, Philippines. Buklas was executed the following day on May 21, 2019. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/20/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Dara Afghanya, Kapisa, Afghanistan. Four civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/19/2019: A roadside bomb detonated targeting a bus carrying Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) in Balad Ruz, Diyala, Iraq. Seven PMF personnel were killed and 26 were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/20/2019: A roadside bomb detonated targeting civilians in Tal Afar, Nineveh, Iraq. One civilian was killed and three were wounded in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/20/2019: Explosive devices detonated targeting farmers in Tal Sawban, Nineveh, Iraq. Two farmers were killed and three were injured in the blasts. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/20/2019: Assailants fired a ballistic missile that was intercepted over Taif, Makkah, Saudi Arabia. This was one of two missile attacks targeting Makkah on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) were responsible for the attack.

05/20/2019: Assailants fired a ballistic missile that was intercepted over Jeddah, Makkah, Saudi Arabia. This was one of two missile attacks targeting Makkah on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) were responsible for the attack.

05/20/2019: Assailants fired a thermal missile at a taxi cab in Fakhir, Qatabah, Ad Dali, Yemen. At least one person was killed and an unknown number of other people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
05/20/2019: A sniper shot and injured a woman near Hajar, Ad Dali, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/20/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at a police station in Shopian district, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/20/2019: Assailants shot and killed Fijie Ignalig, a Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU) member, in Santo Rosario, Surigao del Norte, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

05/20/2019: A suicide bomber detonated near a joint Operation Inherent Resolve (OIR) and Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) convoy in Al-Shadadi, Al Hasakah, Syria. There were no reported casualties aside from the death of the assailant. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on Albert Chikwe (Ojinji) in Udo, Delta, Nigeria. Chikwe, the village chief of Abugba, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

05/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on a Special Auxiliary Police (SAP) patrol near the Hudanga dam site in Saraikela Kharsawan district, Jharkhand, India. Three police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

05/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol near Koparsi, Maharashtra, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

05/20/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting District Reserve Guards in Gogunda, Chhattisgarh, India. Two police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

05/20/2019: An explosive device detonated as it was being planted in Shahidan Mina, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least one assailant was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State.

summary: 05/20/2019: Assailants abducted Chief Laleye Dusin Amusat, a traditional chief, and another person between Esa Odo and Ilare, Osun, Nigeria. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

05/20/2019: Assailants ambushed a police officer escorting farmers and their produce in Vaasealong, Taraba, Nigeria. One police officer was killed and at least two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Tiv Militia.

05/20/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the house of K.J. Sharlette in in Pilathara, Kerala, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Pilathara on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India- Marxist.

05/20/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the house of V.T. Padmanabhan in Pilathara, Kerala, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Pilathara on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India- Marxist.
05/20/2019: An explosive device detonated in Kankinara, West Bengal, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/20/2019: An explosive device detonated in Ghoshpara, West Bengal, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on Michael Felipe Ribo in Buenavista, Eastern Samar, Philippines. Ribo, a police officer, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

05/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on Arnel Lim-it in Bagte, Eastern Samar, Philippines. Lim-it, a soldier, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
05/20/2019: Assailants attacked Ercin Çevik, a journalist, in Antalya, Turkey. Çevik was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/20/2019: Assailants threw an explosive device near the Labony traffic island in Bidhannagar, West Bengal, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2019: Assailants attacked an activist while being transported by the National Protection Unit in Choco, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2019: Two explosive devices detonated inside the garage of a police colonel in Muqdadiyah, Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/21/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of a military commander, identified as Major Abdul Latif al-Himiary, in Taizz, Yemen. No casualties were reported, though the vehicle was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/21/2019: An assailant opened fire on a soldier in Shoz Bazar, Shindand district, Herat, Afghanistan. One soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2019: Assailants attacked residents in Koundjili, Ouham-Pende, Central African Republic. This was one of two related incidents in different villages in Ouham-Pende on the same day. At least 50 people were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incidents to Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation (3R).

05/21/2019: Assailants attacked residents in Lemouna, Ouham-Pende, Central African Republic. This was one of two related incidents in different villages in Ouham-Pende on the same day. At least 50 people were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incidents to Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation (3R).

05/21/2019: Assailants abducted an unknown number of people in Adhaim, Diyala, Iraq. At least one hostage was killed as of May 24, 2019. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 05/21/2019: Assailants attacked the Najran airport with an explosives-laden drone in Najran, Saudi Arabia. It is unclear if the attack resulted in any casualties or damages. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2019: Assailants abducted an unknown number of people in an unknown number of villages in Ceel Maygaag, Galguduud, Somalia. This was one of two related attacks in which 100 people were abducted across five villages on the same day. The whereabouts of the hostages are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

05/21/2019: Assailants abducted an unknown number of people in an unknown number of villages in Xiindheere, Galguduud, Somalia. This was one of two related attacks in which 100 people were abducted across five villages on the same day. The whereabouts of the hostages are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

05/21/2019: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of Tirong Aboh, the sitting MLA for the National People's Party (NPP), in Bogapani, Arunachal Pradesh, India. 11 people, including Aboh, were killed and four others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Isak-Muivah (NSCN-IM).
05/21/2019: An assailant shot and killed Ernesto Sibug, a village councilor, in Barangay 136, Manila, Metropolitan Manila, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) bunker guarding a State Bank of India branch in Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2019: Assailants shot and killed Fijie Ignalig, a Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU) member, in Anomar, Surigao del Norte, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

05/21/2019: An explosive device detonated in the backyard of a residence in Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspect the owner of the house was targeted for having Catholic friends.

05/21/2019: Assailants revealed the head of a secondary school teacher and attacked Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

05/21/2019: Assailants abducted two tribal elders who were attempting to work towards the release of youths from a previous incident in Ceel Buur district, Galguduud, Somalia. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

05/21/2019: Assailants launched a rocket targeting a civilian residence in Almar district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least 15 civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the Taliban was responsible for the attack.

05/21/2019: Assailants attacked a temporary military base camp in EJ Dulay, Northern Samar, Philippines. Three people, including two assailants and one soldier, were killed and an unknown number of other people were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

05/21/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the Cano Limon-Covenas oil pipeline in Arauquita district, Arauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties, but the pipeline was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).
05/21/2019: An assailant shot and killed Beato Pascua, a village head, at his residence in Ganaderia, Nueva Ecija, Central Luzon, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/21/2019: An assailant attempted to throw an incendiary device at vehicles along Road 60 in Betar Illit, West Bank, West Bank and Gaza Strip. Israeli Defense Force (IDF) soldiers opened fire on the assailant and injured him before he could deploy the device. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/21/2019: Assailants attacked military positions in Qatabah district, Ad Dali, Yemen. At least 16 people, including six soldiers and 10 assailants, were killed and an unknown number of soldiers and assailants were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
05/21/2019: Assailants attacked a police patrol in the 11th police district, Kandahar , Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2019: Assailants kidnapped and tortured Wontai Vondou Olivier, a secondary school teacher, in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. Olivier was killed in the attack. Separatists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Wontai Vondou Olivier was targeted for being a spy.

05/21/2019: Assailants fired projectiles at Al 'Amaliqah Brigades positions and civilian residences in Hays, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. One soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/22/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a military caravan in Campo Dos, Norte de Santander, Colombia. Six soldiers were injured in the blast. A second explosive device was discovered and safely defused in the area. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

05/22/2019: Assailants opened fire on the chief executive of the Thathong Subdistrict Administrative Organization, Sama-ae Sama, in Charang Tadong, Yala, Thailand. Sama was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2019: Assailants attempted to kidnap Jimmer Omisol in Carmen, Agusan del Norte, Philippines. Omisol, a police master sergeant, resisted and was killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Jimmer Omisol was targeted because the NPA believed he planted evidence related to drugs against civilians and forced them to drink urine before imprisoning them.

05/22/2019: Assailants, including suicide bombers, in an explosives-laden vehicle on their way to carry out an attack refused to stop at a police checkpoint in Ghazni, Afghanistan. Police at the checkpoint opened fire and the vehicle detonated. At least eight people, including four assailants, two civilians, and two police officers, were killed and 15 people, including civilians and police officers, were injured in the blast. The Taliban and the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/22/2019: Assailants attacked the Alas oilfield in Dawr, Saladin, Iraq. At least one police officer was killed and three others were injured in the attack. It is unknown whether the assailants sustained any casualties. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/22/2019: Suicide bombers detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting officials en route to the presidential palace at a National Intelligence Security Agency [NISA] checkpoint about near Villa Somalia, Warta Nabada, Mogadishu, Somalia. In addition to the assailant, at least five people were killed and 12 others were wounded in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2019: Assailants launched missiles targeting the Bagram Airbase in Bagram, Parwan, Afghanistan. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2019: Assailants attacked Lot village in Lot, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least four civilians were killed and two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2019: Assailants, including suicide bombers, attacked Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) soldiers in Kafr Nabudah, Hamah, Syria. At least nine soldiers and 14 assailants were killed and an unknown number of other soldiers and assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham and the National Liberation Front (NLF-Syria) separately claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2019: Assailants opened fire on local traders accused of being government spies in Darkheynley, Mogadishu, Somalia. The two traders were killed in the assault. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/22/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Salarzai, Balkh, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2019: Assailants set fire to a school in Sakoani, Est, Burkina Faso. No casualties were reported, though property was stolen from the school. An unknown group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2019: Assailants attacked Mora, Extreme-North, Cameroon. At least one person was killed and an unknown number of others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

05/22/2019: Assailants attacked Camp Sagme in Sagme, Logone-et-Chari, Extreme-North, Cameroon. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2019: Assailants opened fire on Simón Gama García, secretary-general of the town of Coyuca de Catalan, in Guerrero, Mexico. Garcia was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/22/2019: An explosive device detonated near a police vehicle on a road in Darkheynley, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least one person was killed and a police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2019: Assailants fired at least 13 mortars that landed and detonated in Kanaan, Diyala, Iraq. At least one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the incident was carried out by the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/22/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in Jarabulus, Aleppo, Syria. At least ten people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/17/2019: Assailants attacked Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) posts at Jabal Shahshibo in Hersh al-Karakat, Hamah, Syria. At least 13 soldiers and six assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. This was one of two similar incidents in Suqaylabiyah district on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

05/22/2019: Assailants attacked Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) posts in Sahel al-Ghab, Hamah, Syria. It is unknown whether there were any casualties in the ensuing clash. This was one of two similar incidents in Suqaylabiyah district on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

05/22/2019: Assailants attacked military positions in Azariq district, Ad Dali, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/22/2019: Assailants fired projectiles into residential areas in Khoura, Ad Dali, Yemen. There were no reported casualties, but several houses were damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2019: Assailants fired projectiles in Shab Al Osood, Ad Dali, Yemen. One 10-year-old was killed in the attack. No group claimed resposnibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/23/2019: Assailants set fire to farmland and crops in Ali Saray, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two attacks in Kirkuk on this day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 05/23/2019: An explosive device detonated in an agricultural field in Ali Saray, Kirkuk, Iraq. Two people were injured in the blast. This was one of two attacks in Kirkuk on this day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/23/2019: Assailants threw and explosive device at the residence of an employee for Imam 'Abdallah Bin 'Ali shrine in Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/23/2019: Assailants fired a rocket at Al-Bashir Mall in Hayy al Askari, Najaf, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/23/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Aino Mena, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least ten people, including Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) members and civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/23/2019: Assailants attacked Pulkhman checkpost in Sozma Qala district, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. Two Afghan National Army personnel were killed and six others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) group claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 05/23/2019: Assailants raided Chianichani, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. A health clinic was set on fire and an unknown number of people were injured in the ensuing clash. In addition, 28 civilians were abducted in the attack; 22 hostages were released on May 27, 2019. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources also attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 05/23/2019: Assailants attacked a security post in Dih Bala district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Security forces repelled the assault, killing and injuring an unknown number of assailants. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 05/23/2019: Security forces safely intercepted an explosives-laden drone fired at Najran airport in Najran, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/23/2019: Assailants shot and killed Ustadz Abdurahman Abubakar, an Islamic scholar, in Malambuhangin, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least seven assailants were killed and six people, including three assailants and three police officers, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/00/2019: Sometime between May 20, 2019 and May 23, 2019, assailants set fire to farmland in Raqqah, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

05/23/2019: Assailants abducted Muhammad Abu-Ghamjah, a High Council of State member, in Qaser Bin Ghashir, Tripoli, Libya. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2019: Assailants abducted five civilians in Khastak, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. The hostages were shot and killed on June 22, 2019. This was one of two incidents in Badakhshan on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban and stated that the victims were accused of spying for the government.

05/23/2019: Assailants armed with explosive devices attacked a Golden Dawn office in Acharnes, Attica, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Durutti Brigades claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/24/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused under the car of Colonel Ahmed Abdullah Karda in Aden, Adan, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/24/2019: An explosive device detonated inside the Al-Taqwa mosque in Kabul, Afghanistan. At least three people, including religious scholar Mufti Samiullah Raihan, were killed and 16 others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/24/2019: Assailants attacked Shirqat, Saladin, Iraq. Three civilians were killed, three were injured, and agricultural fields were burned in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

An unaffiliated individual, identified as Mohamed Hichem Medjoub, claimed responsibility for the incident and pledged allegiance to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

It is unknown whether the incident resulted in any injuries. This was one of two coordinated attacks near the army barracks overnight. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incidents.

05/24/2019: Assailants attacked a security checkpost in Sabzi Karha, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least six police officers were killed and another nine were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/24/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Shewan, Farah, Afghanistan. Three soldiers were killed and another seven were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/24/2019: Assailants attacked the house of the Kananga mayor and a nearby church in Kanyuka, Kasai-Central, Democratic Republic of the Congo. One civilian was killed and another was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/24/2019: A sniper opened fire on civilians in a home in Maqbanah, Taizz, Yemen. At least one civilian was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/00/2019: Sometime between May 20, 2019 and May 23, 2019, assailants set fire to crop fields in Deir ez-Zor, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the attack. summary: 05/24/2019: Assailants set fire the Holy Family Catholic Church in Ballymagroarty, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no injuries but the church was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/24/2019: Assailants ambushed a cement truck and set it on fire in Arauco district, Bio-Bio, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, a pamphlet left at the scene stated "No to the indigenous law."

05/24/2019: Assailants attacked two Ghanaian drivers in Koury, Boucle du Mouhoun, Burkina Faso. Both drivers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/24/2019: Assailants ambushed the deputy police chief of Ghazni in Andar district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/24/2019: A roadside bomb detonated targeting a civilian car in Baiji, Saladin, Iraq. One civilian was killed and four others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 05/24/2019: Assailant extorted money and food from civilians in Pusog, Occidental Mindoro, Philippines. An unknown number of assailants were wounded in the ensuing clash. 05/24/2019: Assailants attacked the residence of Oba Walidu Sanni, the traditional ruler of Gedegede, in Gedegede, Ondo, Nigeria. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

05/25/2019: Assailants threw the body of executed abductee Mohammed Yahya Fatini al-Masoudi in front of his family’s house and forced them to bury his body without allowing access to a forensic doctor in Al Hudaydah, Yemen. summary: 06/17/2019: An assailant opened fire on the Earle Cabell Federal Building and Courthouse in Dallas, Texas, United States. Police officers responded to the assault and killed the assailant. The assailant was identified as Bryan Isaack Clyde and sources noted that he had posted several anti-government and incel-related memes on social media in the weeks and months leading up to the attack.

06/30/2019: An roadside bomb detonated in Kirkuk, Iraq. A civilian was killed and 10 others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/30/2019: Assailants attacked the residence of Qaderullah, a former police chief, in Gurbaz, Khost, Afghanistan. Qaderullah was killed and one of his bodyguards were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
06/30/2019: Assailants shot and killed Sameer Ahmad Ahanger, a shopkeeper, in Baramulla, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/30/2019: Assailants opened fire on Saleh al-Gharib, the Lebanese minister for migrants, in Bsatine, Mount Lebanon, Lebanon. Al-Gharib escaped unharmed but two aides were killed and another two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/30/2019: Snipers opened fire on protesters on a bridge in Omdurman, Khartoum, Sudan. At least nine people, including three soldiers and six civilians, were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/30/2019: Assailants set fire to the house of Malati Rajowar in Pilai, West Bengal, India. Rajowar, a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) panchayat member, was not harmed in the attack. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident through posters left at the scene.

06/30/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Taluqan, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least four police officers were killed and another police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/30/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Qorghan Tepa, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks in Qorghan Tepa on this date. At least thirteen soldiers were killed, seven soldiers were injured, and 20 security personnel were abducted across the attacks. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/30/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Qorghan Tepa, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks in Qorghan Tepa on this date. At least thirteen soldiers were killed, seven soldiers were injured, and 20 security personnel were abducted across the attacks. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/30/2019: Assailants attempted to extort civilians in Moro Gabey, Bakool, Somalia. In addition to eight assailants, four soldiers were killed and 14 people, including 12 assailants and two soldiers, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.
06/30/2019: Assailants opened fire on Barire, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/30/2019: Assailants attacked a village of ethnic Fulani in Saran, Mopti, Mali. This was one of three related incidents across the Mopti region on this night. At least 23 people were killed and 300 more were missing across all three attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Dogon extremists.

06/30/2019: Assailants attacked a village of ethnic Fulani in Bidi, Mopti, Mali. This was one of three related incidents across the Mopti region on this night. At least 23 people were killed and 300 more were missing across all three attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Dogon extremists.

06/30/2019: Assailants attacked a village of ethnic Fulani in Samankoro, Mopti, Mali. This was one of three related incidents across the Mopti region on this night. At least 23 people were killed and 300 more were missing across all three attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Dogon extremists.

06/30/2019: Assailants threw explosive devices at a house along Chalta Road in Kakinara, West Bengal, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/30/2019: Assailants attacked Qush Tepa district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least 36 people, including 30 assailants and six security personnel, were killed and 15 other people were injured in the ensuing clash with security forces which lasted until the following day. In addition, at least 96 Afghan security personnel were abducted in the attack. 42 hostages were released on July 3 while another 54 others released on July 9. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/30/2019: Assailants attacked an Afghan army outpost in Lwari, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least five soldiers were killed and three other soldiers were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/30/2019: Assailants attacked police officers along Maimana-Jawzjan Highway in Qaramqol district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were killed and eight other police officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

06/30/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Bodana Qala, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least two people, including one soldier and one police officer, were killed and three other people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/30/2019: Assailants attacked a military base in Chaharsari, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed and two other soldiers were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/29/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Gurziwan district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least six people, including two police officers and four assailants, were killed and another five people, including three assailants, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

06/30/2019: A landmine detonated targeting an Ethiopian military vehicle between Awdiinle and Berdaale in Baidoa, Bay, Somalia. This was one of two blasts targeting Ethiopian soldiers in Baidoa on this day. Eight soldiers were killed across both attacks. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/30/2019: A landmine detonated targeting an Ethiopian military vehicle between Awdiinle and Baidoa in Baidoa, Bay, Somalia. This was one of two blasts targeting Ethiopian soldiers in Baidoa on this day. Eight soldiers were killed across both attacks. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.
06/30/2019: An explosive device detonated near a rickshaw transporting traders in Yoro, Mopti, Mali. At least 10 traders were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/30/2019: Assailants set fire to a machine and vehicles at a construction site in Sukma district, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

06/30/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting civilians in Jukuk, Baghdad, Iraq. Two civilians were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 07/01/2019: A roadside bomb detonated targeting a military patrol in Mandali, Diyala, Iraq. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/01/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle driven by a suicide bomber detonated and assailants stormed the Afghan Defense Ministry building in Kabul, Afghanistan. At least 11 people, including five assailants, were killed and 105 other people were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/01/2019: Assailants attacked police in Sankhuwasabha, Province 1, Nepal. No casualties were reported in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

07/01/2019: Assailants attacked the Agudama Ekpetiama Police Station in Yenegoa, Bayelsa, Nigeria. At least four police officers were killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/01/2019: A landmine detonated near a security checkpoint in Kajran district, Daykundi, Afghanistan. It is unknown if the blast resulted in casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/01/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in Port Harcourt, Rivers, Nigeria. Two police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/01/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Colonel Syed Agha, the district police chief, in Pachir Agam district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and seven others, including Agha, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/01/2019: An assailant attacked a police checkpoint in Bamut, Chechnya, Russia. At least one officer and one assailant were killed in the incident. The Caucasus Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Caucasus Province of the Islamic State

summary: 07/01/2019: Suicide bombers detonated two explosives-laden vehicles and assailants opened fire on a military base in Inates, Tillaberi, Niger. In addition to the two assailants, at least 18 soldiers were killed and four others were reported missing. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/01/2019: Assailants fired mortars targeting Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/01/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Hafiz Bachah, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were killed and three other officers were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
07/01/2019: An explosive device detonated near a police headquarters in Kandahar, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/01/2019: Assailants attacked security checkpoints and outposts in Qadis district, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least six people, including three soldiers and three police officers, were killed and ten other people were injured in the attack. This was one of three attacks targeting security forces in Badghis on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/01/2019: Assailants attacked Afghan forces in Morghab district, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least four people, including three soldiers and one police officer, were killed and three other people were injured in the attack. This was one of three attacks targeting security forces in Badghis on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/01/2019: Assailants attacked a pro-government militia checkpoint in Ab Kamari district, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least one militia member was injured in the incident. This was one of three attacks targeting security forces in Badghis on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/01/2019: Assailants attacked security checkposts in Andkhoy district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least 39 people, including two security personnel and 37 assailants, were killed and two other security personnel were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/01/2019: Two explosive devices were discovered and safely defused in Jamuniadih, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

07/01/2019: Assailants on motorcycles opened fire on three civilians, including the brother and son of the Awami National Party (ANP) senior leader, in Peshawar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. All three civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/01/2019: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of Major Awil Nur Roble detonated in Galkayo, Mudug, Somalia. Roble, the Galkayo police chief, was killed in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/01/2019: Assailants opened fire on Fahimullah Fidayee, a judge, at his residence in Bagh-i-Dawood, Kabul, Afghanistan. Fidayee was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/01/2019: Assailants attacked security posts in Kajran district, Daykundi, Afghanistan. At least 41 people, including six soldiers and 35 assailants, were killed and 16 others, including 13 assailants and three soldiers, were injured in the attack, which lasted until July 2, 2019. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/01/2019: Assailants threw petrol bombs at a social activist while he was riding his bike in Alapakkam, Tamil Nadu, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/01/2019: Assailants opened fire on a 170th Brigade soldier in Taizz, Yemen. The soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/01/2019: Assailants shot and killed Jasper Iornem Dzughgba, an All Progressives Congress (APC) loyalist, in Kwande, Benue, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources stated that the attack might be related to his role as a witness in an election tribunal.

07/02/2019: Assailants attacked the Abha International Airport in Abha, Asir, Saudi Arabia. At least nine civilians were injured in the attack. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2019: An explosive device detonated prematurely as assailants were planting the device in Bati Kot district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/02/2019: Assailants attacked the home of a police officer in Third Police District, Kunduz, Afghanistan. The police officer was killed and another person was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/02/2019: Assailants attacked an Afghan forces convoy on the AH7 highway in Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed and three other soldiers were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/02/2019: An explosive device detonated in Pashtun Kot district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least five police officers were killed and nine other officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2019: Assailants fired a rocket that targeting Chamkani, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least two children were killed and another child was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/02/2019: Assailants attacked Taluqan, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least one NDS officer was killed and two security forces members were injured in the attack, which lasted until July 5, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

07/02/2019: Assailants attacked an outpost in Shahrak district, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least three soldiers were killed and another three soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

07/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on soldiers at the intersection of Gonzalo Javier Street and Oblate Drive in Cotabato City, Maguindanao, Philippines. One soldier was killed and one was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2019: Three explosive devices were discovered and safely defused in Jamuniadih, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

07/02/2019: A suicide bomber was identified and shot by security forces at the district police headquarters in 6th police district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. The assailant was intending to target the local police chief. A child was injured when the explosive device detonated after the assailant was shot and killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2019: Assailants fired projectiles at Joint Forces positions near Marinka, Donetsk, Ukraine. At least two medical volunteers were injured when their vehicle was struck. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to a pro-Russia militia.

07/02/2019: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of Mohammad Naeem, a local representative, detonated in fourth police district, Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Two people, including Naeem and the vehicle’s driver, were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

07/02/2019: Assailants attacked civilians in Diayal, Mopti, Mali. Six civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Dozo militia.

At least 19 people were killed and three women were raped across both attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Nduma Defense of Congo (NDC).

07/02/2019: Assailants attacked civilians in Kilondo, Masisi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of two related incidents in Masisi on the same day. At least 19 people were killed and three women were raped across both attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Nduma Defense of Congo (NDC).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/03/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting soldiers along the Line of Control (LoC) in Barnala, Azad Kashmir, Pakistan. Five soldiers were killed and one other soldier was injured in the attack. At least six NDS officers, including an NDS head, were killed and two other officers were injured in the incident. 07/03/2019: An explosive device detonated near an Afghan patrol in Morghab district, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed and another soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2019: Assailants attacked a checkpoint in northern Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/03/2019: Assailants attacked the Gargarak security outpost in Chashma Sher, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least six police officers were killed and 12 other officers were injured in the attack. This was the one of two attacks in Chashma Sher area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/03/2019: A suicide bomber was identified before targeting sit-in protesters at Zanbaq Square in Kabul, Afghanistan. The assailant was shot and injured by security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2019: Assailants attacked a military base in Gajiganna, Borno, Nigeria. Soldiers repelled the attack and there were an unknown number of assailant casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

07/03/2019: Assailants threw a crude bomb at Shakti Prasad Das, the Swami Vivekanand National Institute of Rehabilitation Training and Research (SVNIRTAR) director, in Kantapada, Odisha, India. Das and his driver were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2019: Assailants opened fire on Sanjesh Patkar, a former Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) councilor, in Gandhi Chowk, Maharashtra, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/03/2019: Assailants abducted Kazem Al-Sahlani, an anti-corruption civil activist, in Basra, Iraq. Al-Sahlani was released later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/03/2019: Six explosive devices detonated targeting an oil pipeline in Ayn al-Jahesh, Nineveh, Iraq. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

This was one of two related attacks in Kuwing on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

This was one of two concurrent attacks in Aleppo on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

07/03/2019: Assailants ambushed security forces responding to a previous attack in Chashma Sher, Baghlan, Afghanistan. It is unknown if there were any casualties in the attack. 07/03/2019: Assailants set fire to a Pokalain and a tractor between Madama and Barwatoli in Dumaro, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

At least 23 people, including six police officers and 17 assailants, were killed and 13 other people, including 12 assailants, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
