07/19/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in Prosperidad, Agusan del Sur, Philippines. One police officer and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

07/19/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle near Khogyani district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least five civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/19/2019: Assailants shelled positions of the Joint Resistance Forces near At Tuhayat district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/19/2019: A landmine detonated in Durayhami district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. One child was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
07/19/2019: Assailants set fire to the Old Church in Hyvinkaa, Uusimaa, Finland. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/19/2019: Assailants fired rockets at government naval boats in Kyaukmaw Paik Seik, Rakhine, Myanmar. An army captain and two naval personnel were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).

07/19/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in the first police district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and another person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/19/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting Turkish gendarmerie in Bitlis, Turkey. One major was killed and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

07/18/2019: Assailants shot and injured Reverend Father Ikechukwu Ilo, a Catholic priest, and Reverend Sister Chika Egbo in Nkanu East , Enugu, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

07/19/2019: Assailants attacked security outposts in Shirin Tagab district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least one pro-government militia commander was killed and another commander was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
07/19/2019: An explosive device detonated against a bridge in Mentao, Sahel, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/19/2019: Assailants attacked women in Bali, North-West, Cameroon. Three women were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

07/19/2019: Assailants attacked and killed Arbey Ramon Vargas, a former FARC member, in La Montanita, Caqueta, Colombia. The assailants were identified as Gerardo Romero Casallas and Alexander Lozada Ducuara, and were arrested in November 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 07/20/2019: An explosive device detonated as it was being planted on the Chamkani-Gardez highway in Afzal Khel, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least three assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/20/2019: Drones attacked military targets at King Khaled Air Base in Khamis Mushayt, Asir, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/20/2019: Assailants shelled residential areas in Ghayl district, Al Jawf, Yemen. Two children were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on soldiers guarding the Trans-Papua road project in Nduga district, Papua, Indonesia. One soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka).

07/20/2019: Assailants attacked Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) personnel in Saravan district, Sistan and Baluchestan, Iran. Two guards were killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/20/2019: Assailants shelled government military positions in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
07/20/2019: Assailants shot and killed a Nigerian civilian in Johannesburg, Gauteng, South Africa. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in Gulzar Aka, Khost, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/20/2019: An explosive device detonated near an army checkpost North Waziristan district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least six people, including four soldiers, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/20/2019: Assailants fired rockets at a civilian residence in Shinkai, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/20/2019: Assailants attacked a Frontier Corps (FC) patrol in Sararogha, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/20/2019: Assailants opened fire on security forces responding to a previous attack in Qurghan district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed and four other security forces members were injured in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks targeting Qurghan on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/20/2019: An explosive device detonated along the road in Ishakani, Lamu, Kenya. At least two people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by Al-Shabaab.

07/20/2019: A sniper opened fire on a National Directorate of Security (NDS) member in Qurghan district, Faryab, Afghanistan. The NDS member was injured in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Qurghan on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/20/2019: Assailants attacked Eringeti, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The local chief and two other people were killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/20/2019: Assailants shot and killed Humberto Diaz Tierradentro, the president of the Community Action Board, at his house in Guadalupe, Huila, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/20/2019: Assailants fired rockets at three naval boats in the Mayu river in Rathedaung, Rakhine, Myanmar. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army (AA).

07/21/2019: Assailants abducted three civilians in Okada, Ovia North-East district, Edo, Nigeria. The victims were released on July 23, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists were involved in the attack.

07/21/2019: Assailants opened fire on a security checkpoint in Kotla Syedan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least two police officers were killed in the assault. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Dera Ismail Khan district on the same day. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attacks were carried out in retaliation for the death of a group member in Dera Ismail Khan on June 23, 2019.

07/21/2019: A suicide bomber detonated at the emergency room of a hospital in Dera Ismail Khan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. In addition to the assailant, at least seven people, including police officers and civilians, were killed and 30 others, including police officers, were injured in the blast. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Dera Ismail Khan district on the same day. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attacks were carried out in retaliation for the death of a group member in Dera Ismail Khan on June 23, 2019.

07/21/2019: Assailants opened fire on civilians and set fire to the home of a village leader in Zango, Katsina, Nigeria. Ten people were killed and five others were injured in the attack. Three civilians were reported missing in the attack and their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists were involved in the attack.

07/20/2019: A suicide bomber detonated prematurely in Musa Kalim, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least 15 assailants were killed and at least 24 other assailants were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/21/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Gardez, Paktia, Afghanistan. A senior Afghan local police commander, Ahmad Aziz, was killed and six others were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/21/2019: An explosive device detonated inside Bright Future Public School in Banigawan, Uttar Pradesh, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/21/2019: Assailants shot and killed a contractor in Pahadpadar, Odisha, India. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victim was a police informant.

07/21/2019: Three explosive devices were discovered and safely defused near a market in Errabore, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

07/21/2019: Assailants abducted a construction worker in Babupadar, Odisha, India. The worker was found dead the following morning. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victim was a police informant.

07/21/2019: An explosive device detonated at an orchard in Islah, Diyala, Iraq. At least one person was killed and two other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/21/2019: Assailants launched mortar shells targeting Islah, Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/21/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a farmer near Dawr, Saladin, Iraq. The farmer was killed and his son was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/21/2019: Assailants attacked Karan wa Menjan district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least one security personnel was killed and three other security personnel were injured in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the district within 24 hours. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/21/2019: Assailants shelled a house in a residential area in Dar Nasser, Taizz, Yemen. Two people were killed and another was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/21/2019: Assailants stopped traffic and set fire to two vehicles in Valdivia district, Antioquia, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack and ensuing clash with police. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/21/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police post in Eyomujock, South-West, Cameroon. One officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.
07/21/2019: Three explosive devices detonated in Wargha Tangi, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/21/2019: Assailant stabbed and strangled Yelena Grigoryeva, a prominent LGTQ rights campaigner, in Saint Petersburg, Russia. Grigoryeva was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/21/2019: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Darabad, Farah, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Farah on this date. At least 16 people, including four police officers and 12 assailants, were killed and another 12 people, including three police officers and nine assailants, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/21/2019: An explosive device detonated against military personnel near Shchastia, Luhansk, Ukraine. At least four soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/21/2019: Assailants attacked an army convoy in Nalak, Farah, Afghanistan. At least three soldiers were killed and there were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/21/2019: Assailants abducted Noor Ahmad, a farmer, in Sangcharak district, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. Ahmad was executed and his body was discovered on August 3, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/21/2019: Assailants attacked Mangboko, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least two people, including the Bibiwisi Institute headmaster, were killed, one person was injured, and three other people were reported missing. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

07/21/2019: Assailants set fire to the Vuhesi Health Center in Vuhovi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/22/2019: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting the Aden Adde International Airport at a checkpoint outside Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. In addition to the assailant, 10 people were killed and 23 others were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/22/2019: Assailants shot and killed Jane Moneda, a Sangguniang Kabataan chairperson, in Ibaugan, Albay, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/22/2019: Two explosives-laden scarecrows were discovered and safely defused near a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) camp in Aranpur, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

07/22/2019: Assailants opened fire on Mago Munda in Hethgora, Jharkhand, India. Munda, a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) worker, his wife, and his son were killed and one other person was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the People's Liberation Front of India.

07/22/2019: Assailants opened fire on a village chair in Tumbras, North Cotabato, Philippines. Two people, including the chair Alcon Guiabar Talusan and a Barangay Peacekeeping Action Team (BPAT) member, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/22/2019: Suicide bombers detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at a French and UN peacekeeping mission in Mali (MINUSMA) military base in Gao, Mali. The two suicide bombers were killed and six Estonian soldiers, one French soldier and two Malian civilians were injured in the blast. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident. Source also attributed the attack to the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).

07/22/2019: Assailants shot and injured a man in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Dissident Republicans.
07/22/2019: Assailants set fire to a rail transformer room in Rovezzano, Tuscany, Italy. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Anarchists claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/22/2019: Assailants fired rockets that landed and detonated in Saraqib, Idlib, Syria. At least six people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/22/2019: Assailants fired mortars that landed and detonated in Jamiliyeh neighborhood, Aleppo, Syria. This was one of two projectile attacks in different Aleppo neighborhoods on the same day. At least seven people were killed and 20 other people were injured across both incidents. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

07/22/2019: Assailants fired mortars that landed and detonated in Hamdaniyeh neighborhood, Aleppo, Syria. This was one of two projectile attacks in different Aleppo neighborhoods on the same day. At least seven people were killed and 20 other people were injured across both incidents. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

07/21/2019: Assailants detonated explosives targeting several bridges in Karan wa Menjan district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties, though the bridges were damaged in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the district within 24 hours. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/22/2019: Assailants attacked military forces in Sirwah district, Marib, Yemen. At least 11 people, including eight assailants and three soldiers, were killed and 48 other people, including assailants and soldiers, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/21/2019: Assailants attacked and attempted to abduct construction workers in El Wak, Mandera, Kenya. The construction workers resisted and there were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

07/22/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a rangers vehicle in Bannang Sata district, Yala, Thailand. Four rangers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/22/2019: An explosive device planted inside the vehicle of a National Defense Force senior official detonated in Qaddam neighborhood, Damascus, Syria. The driver of the vehicle was killed in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) and Saraya Qasyoun separately claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/22/2019: An explosive device detonated at a city hall building in Msunduzi, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/22/2019: Security forces executed an airstrike against suicide bombers on their way to carry out an attack in Mazar, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Three assailants were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
07/22/2019: Assailants ambushed Nigerian Air Force soldiers in Kaduna, Nigeria. One soldiers, including an officer, were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/22/2019: Assailants fired projectiles at Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) soldiers near Masyaf, Hamah, Syria. At least two soldiers were killed in the attack. Ansar al-Tawhid claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/22/2019: Assailants launched a rocket at a residential area in Ceylanpinar district, Sanliurfa, Turkey. One civilian was killed and five civilians were injured in the blast. This was one of two rocket attacks targeting Ceylanpinar district on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the People's Protection Units (YPG).

07/22/2019: Assailants launched a rocket targeting Ceylanpinar district, Sanliurfa, Turkey. The outcome of the attack is unknown. This was one of two rocket attacks targeting Ceylanpinar district on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the People's Protection Units (YPG).

07/21/2019: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Haidar Qela, Farah, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Farah on the same day. At least 16 people, including four police officers and 12 assailants, were killed and another 12 people, including three police officers and nine assailants, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/22/2019: Assailants launched fireworks at Israeli homes in Jerusalem, West Bank, West Bank and Gaza Strip. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/22/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in Akhtarin, Aleppo, Syria. At least one person was killed and six other people were injured in the blast. This was one of three related attacks in Aleppo on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/22/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in Jarabulus, Aleppo, Syria. At least five people were injured in the blast. This was one of three related attacks in Aleppo on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/22/2019: Assailants attacked an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) military camp in Bulobarde, Hiiraan, Somalia. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/22/2019: Assailants abducted soldiers at a checkpoint in Jaghatai, Herat, Afghanistan. This was one of two similar attacks in Herat on the same date. At least three soldiers were kidnapped across both incidents and all three were killed a short time after the abduction. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/22/2019: Assailants abducted soldiers at a checkpoint in Ghazel Islam, Herat, Afghanistan. This was one of two similar attacks in Herat on the same date. At least three soldiers were kidnapped across both incidents and all three were killed a short time after the abduction. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/22/2019: Assailants attacked military personnel in Azagbene, Bayelsa, Nigeria. Two soldiers were killed in the attack. One soldier was reported missing in the attack and the soldier's whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/22/2019: Assailants shot and killed Edgar Tolentino, the father of a Sangguniang Kabataan chairperson, in Maopi, Albay, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/22/2019: Assailants attacked a security forces tank in Almar district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least five assailants were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/22/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in Azaz, Aleppo, Syria. At least one person was killed and nine other people were injured in the blast. This was one of three related attacks in Aleppo on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.
07/22/2019: Multiple explosive devices detonated in Block 37, Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/23/2019: Assailants set up a roadblock and attacked vehicles on the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway in Ajebo, Ogun, Nigeria. Seven civilians were abducted in the attack. Several hostages were injured before being rescued by the police on July 26, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists were involved in the attack.

07/23/2019: Assailants set fire to the ward office in Jorayal, Province 7, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the attack; however, property was damaged. The Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in opposition to the allotment of municipal funds to produce a film.

07/23/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused near a traffic police box in Dhaka city, Dhaka, Bangladesh. This was one of two similar incidents in Dhaka on the same day. The Islamic State in Bangladesh and Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) separately claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/23/2019: An explosive device was discovered and defused near a traffic police box in Dhaka city, Dhaka, Bangladesh. This was one of two related in Dhaka on the same day. The Islamic State in Bangladesh and Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) separately claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/23/2019: An explosive device attached to a bicycle detonated near Zarghoon medical store in Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least three people were killed and 18 other people were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 07/23/2019: Assailants raided Dikwa, Borno, Nigeria. At least six women and a baby were abducted in the attack. One woman was wounded and escaped and the mother of the baby was released. The whereabouts of the remaining five women and the baby are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

07/23/2019: Assailants detonated explosive devices and opened fire on a military checkpost in Paka Harang, Pattani, Thailand. Four people, including at least one soldier and one defense volunteer, were killed and two defense volunteers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/23/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the residence of Ramona Gehring, a Die Linke (The Left) party politician, in Zittau, Saxony, Germany. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/23/2019: Assailants abducted a civilian in Hulugho, Garissa, Kenya. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

summary: 07/23/2019: Assailants attacked Mukolo, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties in the attack. summary: 07/23/2019: An explosive device detonated prematurely in Imam Weis, 65 km northeast of Baqubah, Diyala, Iraq. One assailant was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Salvation Front (NAS), which denied involvement.

We can't let this continue, you gotta bump the race war threat in real life ... it's been fun." Sources also noted that Manshaus had posted anti-immigrant statements online.

09/08/2019: Assailants attacked members of the Banyamulenge community in Marunde, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were an unknown number of civilian casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara).

09/08/2019: Assailants opened fire and killed a Security Belt soldier in Wadea district, Abyan, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).

09/09/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in a vehicle in Creggan Heights, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. This was one of two related attacks in Londonderry on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New Irish Republican Army.

09/09/2019: Assailants threw petrol bombs at police responding to another attack in Creggan Heights, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. Two assailants were injured and several vehicles were damaged in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Londonderry on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New Irish Republican Army.

This was one of two related attacks in the city on this date. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incidents.

09/09/2019: Assailants attacked government forces in Hassan, Abs, Khadima, Hajjah, Yemen. This was one of two incidents that occurred in Hajjah on this day. 09/09/2019: Assailants shot and killed five farmers in Shamawa, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

09/09/2019: Assailants attacked a police station in Garbahaareey, Gedo, Somalia. Four people, including three assailants and one other person, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

09/09/2019: Assailants attacked Khwaja Ghar district, Takhar, Afghanistan. There were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the incident. This was one of three coordinated attacks in Takhar on this day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

09/09/2019: An explosive device detonated in Taimani, Kabul, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the city on this date. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incidents.

summary: 09/13/2019: Assailants shot and killed Jose Manuel Pana Epiayu, a traditional mediator and community leader, in Maicao, La Guajira, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/13/2019: An explosive device detonated near a civilian vehicle in Hammam al-Alil, Nineveh, Iraq. At least one person was killed and another person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/14/2019: Assailants launched drones and missiles targeting the Saudi Aramco Abqaiq oil facility in Abqaiq, Eastern, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties; however, the facility was significantly damaged in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks on Saudi Aramco oil facilities on this day. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident; however, the United States and Saudi Arabia accused Iran of carrying out the attacks.

09/14/2019: Assailants launched drones and missiles targeting the Saudi Aramco Khurais oil facility in Khurais, Eastern, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties; however, the facility was significantly damaged in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks targeting the Saudi Aramco oil facilities on this date. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident; however, the United States and Saudi Arabia accused Iran of carrying out the attacks.
09/14/2019: Assailants abducted and killed a suspected police informant in Kirandul, Chhattisgarh, India. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/14/2019: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device in the 5th police district, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/14/2019: Assailants armed with rocket-propelled grenades opened fire on a military checkpoint in Arish, North Sinai, Egypt. Three soldiers and three assailants were killed and two soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 09/14/2019: An assailant detonated an explosive device targeting a government vehicle in Gololey, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. At least five people, including deputy regional governor of finance Abdullahi Shatawe, former Hirshabelle state trade minister Sabriye Osman, and local humanitarian activist Hassan Baldos, were killed in the blast before security guards shot and killed the assailant. This was one of two related attacks in Middle Shebelle on this day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/14/2019: Assailants attacked a military command post and burned houses in Soueram, Logone-et-Chari, Extreme-North, Cameroon. Six soldiers were killed while nine others were wounded, including marines and gendarmes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

09/14/2019: Assailants opened fire on Pakistan Army troops while they were fencing the border in Dir, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Three soldiers were killed and one was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/14/2019: Assailants attacked and killed a border officer in Kalatah Porbuz, Herat, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks in Herat on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/14/2019: Assailants attacked a military operation in Salimi, Herat, Afghanistan. At least one soldier was killed and another soldier was injured in the attack. This was one of two attacks in Herat on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/14/2019: Assailants fired rocket-propelled grenades and machine guns targeting a military base in Qoryoley, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least nine people, including civilians, were killed and six others were injured in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/14/2019: Assailants threw a grenade targeting Somali Prime Minister Hassan Ali Khaire in Merca, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. One civilian was killed and several others were injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks targeting Khaire in Merca on this day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/14/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police vehicle in Cooch Behar, West Bengal, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Bharatiya Janata Party.

09/14/2019: Assailants abducted a district administration official from their residence in Beled Hawo, Gedo, Somalia. The official was shot and killed shortly after. This was one of three coordinated attacks targeting administration officials in Beled Hawo on the same day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/14/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting civilians in Waziiyah district, Taizz, Yemen. One civilian was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/14/2019: Assailants were arrested while planting an explosive device in a gas pipeline in Goth Mazari, Punjab, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/14/2019: Assailants launched a mortar shell targeting Somali Prime Minister Hassan Ali Khaire in Merca, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Two civilians were killed in the attack. This was one of two related attacks targeting Khaire in Merca on this day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/14/2019: Assailants ambushed a convoy of Burundian African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) peacekeepers responding to a previous attack in Gololey, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. Two soldiers were killed and three others were injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Middle Shebelle on this day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/14/2019: An assailant opened fire at the residence of Romeo Decin in Nalayahan, Siruma, Camarines Sur, Philippines. Decin, the Nalayahan village chief, was not harmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/14/2019: Assailants abducted a district administration official from their residence in Beled Hawo, Gedo, Somalia. The official was shot and killed shortly after. This was one of three coordinated attacks targeting administration officials in Beled Hawo on the same day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/14/2019: Assailants abducted a district administration official from their residence in Beled Hawo, Gedo, Somalia. The official was shot and killed shortly after. This was one of three coordinated attacks targeting administration officials in Beled Hawo on the same day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/14/2019: Assailants attacked security forces along Beni-Kasindi road, Kichanga-Rizerie, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. No casualties were reported. The Central African Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 09/14/2019: An explosive device detonated at a volleyball ground in Kakar Shakot, Kapisa, Afghanistan. At least three civilians were killed and two others were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which the group denied.

09/15/2019: Assailants threw a petrol bomb at a vehicle at the Tobacco Commission head office in Kanengo, Lilongwe, Malawi. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/15/2019: Assailants set fire to the Karghjad Awlia School in Babaji, Helmand, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack, but the school was damaged. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/15/2019: Security forces intercepted assailants attempting to attack police and army checkpoints in Gilbana, North Sinai, Egypt. An unknown number of assailants were killed or injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/15/2019: Assailants opened fire on Bernando Betancourt, a Conservative party mayoral candidate, in Tibu, Norte de Santander, Colombia. Betancourt was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/15/2019: An explosives-laden truck detonated outside Cobanbey Hospital in Al-Rai subdistrict, Aleppo, Syria. At least 12 people were killed and dozens of other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

09/15/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a police patrol in Nawa, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed and one other police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/15/2019: A suicide bomber detonated and assailants opened fire targeting military personnel guarding the University of Maiduguri (UNIMAID) in Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. At least one assailant was killed as security forces repelled the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

09/15/2019: Assailants stopped a bus and set it on fire in Bijapur district, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

09/15/2019: Armed assailants shot and killed municipal councilor, Claudio Gabiana, and his wife, former chairwoman of Barangay Jose Rono, Corazon Gabiana, in their residence in Jose Rono, Paranas, Samar, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources suspected the involvement of the New People’s Army (NPA).

09/15/2019: Assailants detonated explosive devices targeting power pylons in Shahabuddin, Baghlan, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three related attacks on power pylons in Baghlan and Kunduz on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/14/2019: Assailants abducted Tebeck Mbah, regional manager of state-owned Cameroon Telecommunications, and Pamela Miye, a Cameroon Tribune journalist, in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/15/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the convoy of Lower Shebelle Governor Ibrahim Adan Najah in Shalan Bood, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Najah was not harmed; however, two bodyguards were killed and four people, including two regional officials, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

09/15/2019: Assailants detonated explosive devices targeting power pylons in Sayilan, Baghlan, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three related attacks on power pylons in Baghlan and Kunduz on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/00/2019: Sometime between September 1, 2019 and September 30, 2019, assailants attacked a Mozambique Democratic Movement (MDM) delegate and his family in Chiuta district, Tete, Mozambique. The delegate and an unknown number of his family members were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/00/2019: Sometime between September 1, 2019 and September 30, 2019, assailants attacked a locality delegate in Calomwe, Tete, Mozambique. The delegate was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/00/2019: Sometime between September 1, 2019 and September 30, 2019, assailants attacked a locality delegate in Domwe, Tete, Mozambique. The delegate was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/00/2019: Sometime between September 1, 2019 and September 30, 2019, assailants attacked a delegate at his residence in Marara district, Tete, Mozambique. The delegate was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/15/2019: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Karez e Subhan, Farah, Afghanistan. At least five civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/15/2019: Assailants armed with firearms attacked civilians in Ruma subdistrict, Bandarban, Chittagong, Bangladesh. Six civilians were abducted and an unknown number of civilians were injured in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mog Liberation Party.

09/15/2019: Assailants destroyed a power pylon in Buz Kandahari, Kunduz, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported. This was one of three related attacks on power pylons in Baghlan and Kunduz on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
09/15/2019: Security forces discovered and safely defused a naval mine in Al-Khawkhah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/15/2019: Assailants shot and killed a civilian in Baylo, San Luis, Agusan del Sur, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/15/2019: Assailants opened fire on Mamman Bayaro at his house in Kadunu, Plateau, Nigeria. Bayaro, a village head, was killed and a neighbor was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/15/2019: Assailants set fire to construction equipment in Kutipi, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the group was in opposition to road construction in the area.

09/15/2019: Two cylinder bombs were discovered and safely defused along the Pan-American Highway in El Mango, Cauca, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 09/15/2019: Assailants opened fire on an ambulance transporting injured soldiers in Mahfad district, Abyan, Yemen. One soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/16/2019: An explosive device attached to a mini-bus carrying university students detonated in Alilala, Ghazni, Afghanistan. The bus driver was killed and five students were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/16/2019: Armed assailants abducted an international NGO doctor in Tiarza, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP), which denied involvement.
09/16/2019: An explosive device detonated near a police patrol in Rashad, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least two officers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/16/2019: An explosive device detonated in Alalam neighborhood, Baghadad, Iraq. This was one of two bombings in Rasheed district and one of four related attacks in Baghdad on this day. At least five civilians were injured across the two Rasheed blasts. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/16/2019: An explosive device detonated in Shurta neighborhood, Baghadad, Iraq. This was one of two bombings in Rasheed district and one of four related attacks in Baghdad on this day. At least five civilians were injured across the two Rasheed blasts. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/16/2019: An explosive device detonated in Shaab neighborhood, Baghadad, Iraq. At least two people were injured in the blast. This was one of four related attacks in Baghdad on this day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/16/2019: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire on a police motorcycle convoy in Khok Pho, Pattani, Thailand. Two village defense volunteers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/16/2019: An explosive device detonated as government forces attempted to defuse it near Mukalla, Hadramawt, Yemen. Two government forces personnel were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/16/2019: An explosive device detonated near a beach in Amoudi, Taizz, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
09/16/2019: Assailants shot and buried a woman in Guzang, Momo, North-West, Cameroon. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.
09/16/2019: Assailants attacked and killed Dieudonne Manenga, a doctor, in his residence in Uvira, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/16/2019 Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in Poblacion, Antipas, North Cotabato, Philippines. One assailant was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

09/16/2019: Assailants attacked Lwemba, Mambasa, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Health centers, a police office, and more than 18 Ebola response officers residences were set on fire in the incident. At least one police officer was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mai Mai Simba militia.

09/16/2019: Assailants attacked and set fire to Rutigita Monyi, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of five related attacks in the same area. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara).
gname: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara)

summary: 09/16/2019: Assailants attacked and set fire to Masha, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of five related attacks in the same area. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara).
gname: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara)

summary: 09/16/2019: Assailants attacked and set fire to Kalongozi, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of five related attacks in the same area. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara).
gname: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara)

summary: 09/16/2019: Assailants attacked and set fire to Rutigita Monyi, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of five related attacks in the same area. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara).
gname: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara)

summary: 09/16/2019: Assailants attacked and set fire to Kahwera, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of five related attacks in the same area. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara).
gname: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara)

summary: 09/16/2019: Assailants attacked an army position in Mikenge, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of six related attacks in the same area. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/16/2019: Assailants attacked an army position in Bukundji, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of six related attacks in the same area. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/16/2019: Assailants attacked an army position in Kipupu, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of six related attacks in the same area. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/16/2019: Assailants attacked an army position in Nyarurambi, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of six related attacks in the same area. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/16/2019: Assailants attacked an army position in Makutano, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of six related attacks in the same area. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/16/2019: Assailants attacked an army position in Bikuba, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of six related attacks in the same area. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/16/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated outside of a military camp in Ataq, Shabwah, Yemen. At least one soldier was killed and two were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/16/2019: An explosive device detonated in Bab al-Sheikh neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. At least five people were injured in the blast. This was one of four related attacks in Baghdad on this day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/17/2019: A suicide bomber detonated explosives targeting an office of the defense ministry in the 9th police district, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least 23 people, including the assailant, were killed and 38 others were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/17/2019: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden motorcycle, targeting an election rally where President Ashraf Ghani was speaking to supporters, in Charikar, Parwan, Afghanistan. At least 27 people were killed and 32 others were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/17/2019: Assailants abducted Kevin Lunney, Director and COO of Quinn Industrial Holdings in Fermanagh, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. Lunney was beaten and discovered in a field several hours later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Continuity Irish Republican Army (CIRA).

09/17/2019: An assailant stabbed a soldier in the neck with a letter opener near a train station in Milan, Italy. The soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on a timber truck in Zepinga, Manica, Mozambique. The driver of the vehicle was injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Zepinga on this date. The Renamo Military Junta claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on a food truck in Zepinga, Manica, Mozambique. Three people were injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Zepinga on this date. The Renamo Military Junta claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/17/2019: Assailants stopped a civilian vehicle and set it on fire in Warpora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The driver was physically assaulted and injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and stated that the attack was carried out because the civilian was driving during an Al-Badr business shutdown in Sopore, Kashmir.

09/17/2019: An explosive device attached to a police vehicle detonated in Puli Khumri, Baghlan, Afghanistan. The Baghlan Police Department chief financial officer was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/17/2019: Assailants attacked and killed three family members allegedly affiliated with the government in Khewal, Ghor, Afghanistan. Hizb-I-Islami claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/16/2019: Assailants set fire to the residence of Ines Alculete, the mother of the mayor of Quelimane, Manuel de Araujo, in Quelimane, Zambezia, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties, though the guard of the house was briefly held hostage during the attack. The Renamo Military Junta claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Mozambique Liberation Front (FRELIMO).

09/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Mohammad Iqbal Wazir in Abakhel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Iqbal Wazir, a Member of the Provincial Assembly (MPA), was not harmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/17/2019: Assailants opened fire on a construction worker in Muang Pattani district, Pattani, Thailand. The construction worker was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/10/2019: Assailants attacked a military base in Garbahaareey, Gedo, Somalia. Eight assailants were killed and one soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

09/17/2019: Security forces identified and intercepted assailants attempting to attack Manawadji, Extreme-North, Cameroon. 10 assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
09/17/2019: Assailants set fire to houses in Makhan Khuman, Manipur, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/17/2019: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Mohammad Agha district, Logar, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Mohammad Agha on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/17/2019: Assailants launched a mortar at a civilian residence in Mohammad Agha district, Logar, Afghanistan. Three civilians were killed and four others were injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Mohammad Agha on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/17/2019: Two assailants attacked a Somali military patrol in Kismayo, Lower Juba, Somalia. The two assailants were killed in an airstrike. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

09/17/2019: Assailants set fire to a chicken farm in Charencey, Normandy, France. No casualties were reported, but several buildings were damaged in the attack. Animal Rights extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and wrote "death camp" and "killers" at the targeted farm.

09/17/2019: Assailants shot and decapitated Hema civilians in Bukatsele, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Fourteen civilians including 11 children were killed and four others were injured in the attack. This was one of four attacks in this area overnight. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Lendu Militia.

09/18/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting a restaurant and the car of Abdukadir Arabow, the lower house MP, in Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. At least four people were killed and four others were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/18/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated near a road construction site on the outskirts of Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. At least one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/18/2019: Assailants, including a suicide bomber, attacked a government building distributing national identification (ID) cards in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least seven people, including three assailants, and 13 other people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/18/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the Transandino pipeline in Orito, Putumayo, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/18/2019: Assailants attacked judges and police along Shahzada-ha street in Herat, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/18/2019: An assailant, identified as an Afghan soldier, attacked and killed two of his colleagues at an outpost in Dobandi, Kunduz, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources noted that the assailant defected to the Taliban following the attack.

09/18/2019: Assailants attacked the center of Warduj district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least six security forces members, including three police officers, were killed and two other officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
09/18/2019: Assailants launched three rockets at Rafah, Gaza Strip, West Bank and Gaza Strip. Seven people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/18/2019: Assailants launched a rocket that landed near the border security fence in Gaza Strip, West Bank and Gaza Strip. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/18/2019: Assailants opened fire on commercial vehicle near Wukari, Taraba, Nigeria. A passenger was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/18/2019: An assailant attempted to stab Israeli Defense Forces members at a checkpoint in Qalandiyah, West Bank. The assailant was killed in the attempted attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ala’ Nafeth Wahdan, a Palestinian extremist.

09/18/2019: Assailants set a fire in a chemical factory in Tuzla, Istanbul, Turkey. At least two people were wounded in the attack. The Peoples' United Revolutionary Movement (HBDH) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out because the factory was producing goods that benefited the Turkish military.

09/18/2019: Assailants attacked a farm in Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. Nine civilians were killed and an unknown number of civilians were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
09/18/2019: A landmine detonated in Maw Harn, Shan, Myanmar. A civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/18/2019: An assailant armed with explosives stopped traffic on a bridge and opened fire at vehicles before being arrested by security forces in Kyiv, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/18/2019: Assailants attacked Hema civilians at an internal displacement camp in Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of three related attacks in Ituri on this date. At least 14 civilians were killed and five others were wounded across all three attacks. This was one of four attacks in this area overnight. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Lendu Militia.

09/19/2019: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden truck targeting the National Directorate of Security (NDS) and a nearby hospital in Qalat, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least 40 people, including the assailant, were killed and 140 others were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/19/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Imphal, Manipur, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/19/2019: Armed assailants abducted a polio doctor from his home in Charmang, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The hostage was rescued on February 14, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
09/19/2019: An explosive device detonated at a post office in Athens, Attica, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/19/2019: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting a security forces vehicle in Sheikh Zuweid, North Sinai, Egypt. One security forces member was killed and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/19/2019: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting a passenger bus in Wadia, Hadramawt, Yemen. Four passengers were killed and 21 others were injured in the attack. This was one of two attacks in Hadramawt on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
