09/25/2019: An explosive device detonated near a private microfinance office in Imphal, Manipur, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/25/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Moreh, Manipur, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/25/2019: Security forces identified assailants attempting to attack a Century Peak Energy Corporation (CPEC) hydro power plant with petrol bombs and explosive devices in Igcabugao, Iloilo, Philippines. It is unknown if there were any casualties among the assailants. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

09/23/2019: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Singa-Mossi, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. At least three people were killed in the assault. This was one of three related attacks in the area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by Muslim extremists.

09/23/2019: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Singa-Rimayibe, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. At least two people were killed in the assault. This was one of three related attacks in the area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by Muslim extremists.

09/25/2019: Assailants attacked Carlos Celimo Iter Conde in Las Juntas, Cauca, Colombia. Conde, a demobilized FARC member, was killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/25/2019: An assailant armed with a crowbar threatened people and smashed items inside of the Chapel of the Holy Cross in Sedona, Arizona, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Timothy Larson, a QAnon conspiracy theorist, claimed responsibility for the incident and wrote #QAnon Mission Success on social media after the attack. Witnesses stated that Larson accused the church of taking part in "human trafficking" and wrote "evil" at the scene of the attack.
09/26/2019: An explosive device detonated in Hassan Khail, Paktia, Afghanistan. Two members of Public Uprising Forces were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/24/2019: An explosive device detonated outside a campaign office for President Ashraf Ghani in Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least four people, including journalist Abdul Hamid Hotaki, were killed and seven other people were injured in the blast. This was one of two attacks targeting Ghani campaign offices within 24 hours. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

09/26/2019: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire on soldiers escorting vehicles carrying fertilizer in Sevare, Mopti, Mali. Seven soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by Muslim Extremists.

09/25/2019: Assailants ambushed Sgt. Abejay Dandan, a police intelligence officer, in Kitulaan, Carmen, North Cotabato, Philippines. Dandan was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/26/2019: Assailants attacked a gendarmerie station in Iolonioro, Bougouriba, Sud-Ouest, Burkina Faso. One assailant was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/26/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Darzab district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least four police officers were killed and five other police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/26/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Dara-i-Sufi Payin district, Samangan, Afghanistan. At least five police officers were killed and five other police officers were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/26/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Dehandara, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least 18 people, including seven public protection officers and 11 assailants, were killed and 9 other people, including four other public protection officers and five other assailants, were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/26/2019: A landmine detonated targeting a civilian vehicle near Kamuya, Borno, Nigeria. Six civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

09/26/2019: Assailants attacked a commuter bus in Maza, Marte, Borno, Nigeria. Ten civilians were abducted in the incident. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

09/26/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle carrying Turkish engineers of the Maarif Foundation at KM-5 junction, Mogadishu, Somalia. Two people were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/18/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Turkish engineers near Wedow, Banaadir, Somalia. Three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/26/2019: An assailant armed with a knife attacked police officers near the Shalshelet gate in Jerusalem, West Bank, West Bank and Gaza Strip. One police officer was injured in the attack, and the assailant was arrested. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Palestinian extremist.
09/26/2019: Assailants attacked Mafa, Borno, Nigeria. Two civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
09/26/2019: An explosive device attached to a vehicle was discovered and safely defused in fifth police district, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/26/2019: Assailants abducted four civilians who were celebrating the September 26 revolution in Sanaa, Amanat Al Asimah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded a ransom payment.

09/26/2019: Assailants abducted a shop owner along Tahir street in Sanaa, Amanat Al-Asemah, Yemen. Al-Wasabi was released at an unspecified time. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) and noted that the victim was celebrating the September 26 revolution when he was kidnapped.

09/26/2019: Assailants opened fire on government soldiers and police officers at the Mountain Ridge in Aguid, Sagada, Mountain Province, Philippines. At least one soldier, identified as Jordan Manawa, was killed and another soldier, identified as Melvin Modes, was injured in the assault. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility and stated that the attack was meant to be offensive in nature.

09/26/2019: Assailants set fire to construction equipment in Bhainsadohar, Bihar, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

09/27/2019: Assailants opened fire on Tofaha checkpoint in Beir al-Abd, North Sinai, Egypt. At least four people, including military personnel and civilians, were killed and four others were injured in the attack. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 09/27/2019: Assailants abducted Rosina Ejansantos Singua, a teacher, in Walled City, Jolo, Sulu, Philippines. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

09/27/2019: Assailants attempted to abduct Sandra Maribel Sanchez, a Radio Progreso journalist, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, Honduras. The kidnapping was unsuccessful and there were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/27/2019: Assailants attacked Nigerian and Chadian security personnel in Gajiram, Borno, Nigeria. At least eight people, including a police officer, a hunter, and six civilians, were killed in the incident. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

09/27/2019: Assailants attacked a military post in Banki, Borno, Nigeria. A soldier was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Boko Haram.

09/27/2019: Assailants attacked the residence of a pro-government militia member in Laman, Badghis, Afghanistan. The militia member and his father were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/27/2019: Assailants attacked a border forces outpost in Tah Kham, Herat, Afghanistan. At least six soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/27/2019: Assailants attacked security forces in Kurak, Ghor, Afghanistan. It is unknown whether there were any casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Kurak on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

09/27/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting security forces responding to a previous incident in Kurak, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least three police officers were killed and two other officers were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in Kurak on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

09/27/2019: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Tegab Esmail, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least two security forces members were killed and two other members were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/27/2019: Assailants attacked the district bazaar entrance in Khwaja Ghar district, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least 30 police officers and pro-government militia members were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/27/2019: Assailants attacked Dara-i-Sufi Payin district, Samangan, Afghanistan. At least 22 people, including 10 police officers and 12 assailants, were killed and 10 other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/27/2019: Assailants fired a rocket that landed and detonated in Aliabad district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least two people were killed and six other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/27/2019: Two assailants opened fire on Rahmatullah Nekzad, a journalist, in Ghazni, Afghanistan. Nekzad was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/27/2019: Assailants intercepted and attacked Marlon Ferney Pacho in Taravira, Cauca, Colombia. Pacho, the Talaga indigenous council secretary, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants attacked Komsilga, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. Eight civilians were killed and one person was abducted while shops and motorcycles were set on fire during the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) carried out the attack.

09/28/2019: Assailants attacked Dungeon, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. Seven civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) carried out the attack.
09/28/2019: Assailants attacked an army unit in Deou, Sahel, Burkina Faso. One soldier was killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants attacked a border guard outpost in Mikhas, outskirts of Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. At least three civilians were killed in the incident. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/28/2019: An explosive device detonated inside a polling station at the Shah mosque in Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 15 people, including one police officer and an unknown number of election officials, were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/28/2019: An explosive device detonated at a polling station in Kabul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/28/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a polling center in Ghazni, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: An explosive device detonated near a polling station in Surkh Rod district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least one person was killed and two others were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/28/2019: Assailants shelled Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least one election observer was killed in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/28/2019: An explosive device detonated at a polling station in Kabul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants fired missiles at a polling center in Kork Ozbakia, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. This was one of 19 related incidents in Sari Pul on the same day. At least three people, including one National Directorate of Security member and two civilians, were killed and 40 other people were injured across all 19 attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/28/2019: Assailants opened fire inside a polling station in Paktika, Afghanistan. One child was killed in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants fired at least 12 rockets targeting Maidan Shahr, Wardak, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two attacks in Wardak on this date. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in the yard of a polling station at the Awal Baba School in Maidan Shahr, Wardak, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two attacks in Wardak on this date. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated targeting Maulana Mohammad Hanif, the leader of Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam, in Chaman, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least three people, including Hanif, were killed and 17 others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/28/2019: Assailants fired rockets targeting Ghazni, Afghanistan. There were two people wounded in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/28/2019: A suicide bomber detonated explosives in Kunduz, Afghanistan. The assailant was killed and 16 people were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting Malik Nadar Khan, a tribal elder, in Mulla Kili, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Khan was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants abducted eight people, including electoral commissions members and electoral observers, in Shinwari district, Parwan, Afghanistan. All eight hostages were released on December 9, 2019. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants fired mortars near a polling site in Paktia, Afghanistan. This was one of three related mortar attacks on this date. At least one civilian was killed and 24 others were injured across the three attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants fired mortars near a polling site in Paktika, Afghanistan. This was one of three related mortar attacks on this date. At least one civilian was killed and 24 others were injured across the three attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants fired mortars near a polling site in Kunar, Afghanistan. This was one of three related mortar attacks on this date. At least one civilian was killed and 24 others were injured across the three attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

09/28/2019: Assailants fired a rocket targeting the provincial governor’s office in Tarin Kot, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. At least two people were killed and six other people were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants fired a mortar targeting the polling center at the Latifa Shahid Female High School in Fayzabad, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. There were no casualties in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants set fire to vehicles and machines engaged in laying a water pipeline in Masenar, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Maoists.

09/28/2019: Assailants attacked a truck in Amatongas, Manica, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Renamo Military Junta.

09/28/2019: Assailants attempted to stop a passenger bus in Batote, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The assailants took hostage Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) activist Vijay Kumar and his seven family members in an ensuing encounter with security forces. In addition to three assailants, a soldier was killed and two police officers were injured in the attack. The hostages were rescued the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Hizbul Mujahideen (HM).

09/28/2019: A suicide bomber on an explosives-laden bicycle prematurely detonated en route to a polling station in Kunduz, Afghanistan. The suicide bomber was killed in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants threw a hand grenade targeting Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: An explosive device detonated near a police vehicle in Adraskan district, Herat, Afghanistan. At least one officer was killed and two other officers were injured in the blast. This was one of two attacks targeting police in Herat on this date. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants attacked a polling center in Obe district, Herat, Afghanistan. At least one person was killed and two other people were injured in the incident. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants attacked Bilchiragh district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least two people, including one territorial army soldier and one assailant, were killed in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants attacked Tuli, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least seven pro-government militia members, including commander Abdul Ghayor, were killed and two civilians were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: An explosive device detonated near an Afghan commando vehicle transporting ballot boxes in Khawaja Etoop, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least two commandos were killed and three other commandos were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants attacked the police headquarters and other government buildings in Darzab district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least 10 police officers were killed and nine other officers were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Gulran district, Herat, Afghanistan. At least one police officer and 13 assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. This was one of two attacks targeting police in Herat on this date. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants attacked several security outposts in Fayzabad district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least two people, including one National Directorate of Security member and one pro-government militia member, were killed and a civilian was injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device in Hassu Khel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/28/2019: Assailants set fire to wheat fields in Al Hasakah, Syria. At least 10 people were killed and five other people were injured as they attempted to put out the fire. The victims included civilians and Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) members. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/28/2019: Assailants fired projectiles and attacked Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) soldiers in Hamah, Syria. At least 26 soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Muslim extremists.

09/28/2019: Assailants set fire to a truck carrying World Food Programme aid supplies in Bambili, Mezam, North-West, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/28/2019: Assailants ambushed a road opening military party along the Mbau-Kamango road, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Three assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

09/28/2019: Assailants ambushed a lorry in Rizerie, along Beni-Kasindi road, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

09/28/2019: An explosive device detonated in Shaykh Baba, Diyala, Iraq. At least two farmers were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 09/28/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a military convoy in San Jose, Norte de Santander, Colombia. Two soldiers were killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

09/28/2019: Assailants attacked Vasyl Davydenko, a Donbass security operation veteran, in Kyiv, Ukraine. Davydenko was injured in the attack. Anti-LGBT extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and accused the victim of giving "intriguing interviews" to journalists about his sexual orientation.
09/28/2019: Assailants shot and killed a former jihadist leader in Daraa, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/28/2019: Assailants abducted an unknown number of Saudi soldiers in Najran, Saudi Arabia. Seven soldiers were released on December 26, 2019 after a ransom payment. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/29/2019: Assailants attacked military personnel in Gubio, Borno, Nigeria. At least nine people, including civilians, were killed and many more were injured in the incident. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/29/2019: An explosive device detonated targeted an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy in Huriwa, Mogadishu, Somalia. Two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/29/2019: Assailants attempted to abduct Rehan Ghauri, the coordinator for Sindh Assembly opposition leader Syed Firdous Shamim Naqvi, in Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan. Police officers intervened, stopping the abduction. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/29/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Konjak, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least seven police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/28/2019: Assailants attacked Takhar, Afghanistan. At least 12 security force members were killed and 18 other people, including security force members and civilians, were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/29/2019: Assailants abducted two people accused of cooperating with the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) in Barakhanah, Ghor, Afghanistan. One hostage was killed and the other hostage was injured and later released. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/29/2019: An explosive device detonated in Gulran district, Herat, Afghanistan. This was one of two similar attacks in Golran on the same day. At least two people were killed across both blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

09/29/2019: An explosive device detonated in Golran district, Herat, Afghanistan. This was one of two similar attacks in Golran on the same day. At least two people were killed across both blasts. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Taliban.

09/29/2019: Assailants fired a mortar at a civilian residence in Bilchiragh district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least three people were killed and three other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/29/2019: Assailants attacked Khwaja Sabz Posh, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least 21 people, including one soldier, one police officer, and 19 assailants, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/29/2019: Assailants attacked Tuly, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least 11 people, including eight pro-government militia members and three civilians, were killed and 26 other people were injured in the attack. Additionally, at least eight people were abducted and their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/29/2019: Assailants, armed with metal rods and sticks, attacked Stanley Ho, a Labor Party member and pro-democracy activist, in Sai Kung neighborhood, Hong Kong, China. Two people, including Ho, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 10/09/2019: An assailant, identified as Stephan Balliet, attempted to attack a synagogue in Halle, Saxony-Anhalt, Germany. The door to the synagogue was locked and the assailant was unable to gain entry. He then shot and killed a woman outside the synagogue. This was one of three related attacks carried out by Balliet on this day. Balliet, an Anti-Semitic extremist, claimed responsibility by live-streaming the attack on Twitch and through a manifesto he had posted earlier online. During the attack, Balliet "ranted about Jews, feminism and immigration" and in his manifesto stated "If I fail and the but kill a single jew, it's worth it. After all, if every White Man kills just one, we win."

At least 15 hostages were freed and an unknown number of assailants and hostages were killed in the ensuing clash. At least 25 more hostages were released on November 5, 2019. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. The Arakan Army (AA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/30/2019: Assailants shot and killed Rana Mehmood-ul-Hassan, a Pakistan Senate member and Pakistan Muslim League Nawaz (PML-N) chairman, in Gujranwala, Punjab, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/30/2019: A roadside bomb detonated in Shati Meena, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One person was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2019: Assailants fired two rockets into the Green Zone in Baghdad, Iraq. One soldier was killed and at least two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2019: Security forces discovered and defused explosive devices planted in Mandhar, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

10/30/2019: Assailants set fire to an under-construction school in Lanao, Sapu Masla, Sarangani, Philippines. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
10/30/2019: An explosive device detonated in Daraban, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Three children were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2019: An explosive device detonated against the vehicle of Ahmed Abdul-Qawi Al-Humayqani in Bayda, Al Bayda, Yemen. Al-Humayqani, the Houthi-appointed director general of Zaher district, was killed and two bodyguards were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2019: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Asaba, Delta, Nigeria. One police officer was killed and three others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/30/2019: Assailants shot and killed Nerio Gabriel Chourio Solorzano, a Bolivarian National Guard (GNB) soldier, in Maracay, Aragua, Venezuela. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/30/2019: An explosive device detonated near the Communist Party headquarters in Tahsiniya, Basra, Iraq. No casualties were reported in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2019: An unknown number of explosive devices detonated targeting civilians in Jani Khel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/00/2019: Sometime between October 27, 2019 and November 2, 2019, assailants attacked Gorongosa district, Sofala, Mozambique. Five people, including two police officers, were killed in the attack. The Renamo Military Junta claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2019: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Dempary, Mopti, Mali. Six civilians were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2019: Three explosive devices were discovered and safely defused near La Antena military base in La Gabarra, Norte de Santander, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Luis Enrique Leon Guerra Front of the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).
10/30/2019: Assailants attacked a bus in Koro, Mopti, Mali. Four civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2019: An assailant set fire to a mink farm along Stibyvagen road in Solvesborg, Blekinge, Sweden. There were no reported casualties in the attack, but there was significant damage to buildings on the farm. The Eco-fascist cell of the Base Movement claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "we take real-world action and put a tangible effort into the progress of our cause." A Swedish Animal Rights militia also claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack took place in the town of Solvesborg, which is home to "animal abusers and extreme racists." The group also issued a warning to all fur farmers in Scandinavia.

10/31/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated at al-Hal Market in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. At least eight people were killed and 30 other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the People's Protection Units (YPG).
11/01/2019: A pipe bomb was discovered and safely defused outside a home in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2019: A vehicle transporting explosive devices prematurely detonated in Jangal Aregh, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least 17 people, including 15 assailants and two civilians, were killed and 14 other people, including assailants and civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
10/31/2019: Assailants attacked a police station in Sanaba, Boucle du Mouhoun, Burkina Faso. One police commissioner was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/31/2019: Assailants fired a rocket targeting Eshkol, Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

10/31/2019: Assailants stole a local government vehicle in Thung Yang Daeng, Pattani, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack, though a security guard was briefly held hostage. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/31/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting a police station in Mai Kaen district, Pattani, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. The explosives-laden vehicle had been stolen in a previous attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/31/2019: Assailants opened fire on a military post in Khao Tum, Pattani, Thailand. The two assailants were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/31/2019: Assailants opened fire on a truck in Mbau, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least 10 people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

10/31/2019: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Charsiha, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least nine people, including eight soldiers and one police officer, were killed and three other security force members were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/31/2019: Assailants threw two pipe bombs at Rachel's Tomb in Bethlehem, West Bank. There were no reported casualties, but two vehicles were damaged in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

10/27/2019: Assailants abducted a farmer identified as Sameh Mohamed Abu al-Doh in Tofaha, North Sinai, Egypt. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/31/2019: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint with explosive devices in Baghdad, Iraq. One member of the security forces was killed and five others were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 10/31/2019: Assailants shot and killed a civilian in Arghandab district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

summary: 11/01/2019: Assailants fired a rocket targeting a house in Sderot, Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) and Hamas.

10/31/2019: An explosive device detonated near Turkish Armed Forces (TSK) soldiers in Tal al-Hawa, Aleppo, Syria. At least one soldier was killed and six other soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/01/2019: Assailants set fire to two vehicles, including the vehicle of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) general secretary, in Bonigam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/01/2019: Assailants threw petrol bombs at a school in Kundalan, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2019: Two assailants planted an explosive device near a Rangers checkpost in Paseyawor, Pattani, Thailand. Rangers personnel intercepted the assailants as they were leaving the scene, killing both of them. Authorities defused the device a short time later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2019: Assailants attacked Darwazbala district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least nine security officials were killed and eight others were injured, while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clashes that lasted for two days. Additionally, two other security force members were abducted and their whereabouts are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2019: Assailants attacked a military base in Gwon, Mafa, Borno, Nigeria. Six assailants were killed and an unknown number of other assailants were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/01/2019: Assailants opened fire and detonated a grenade at a bar in Bujumbura, Bujumbura Mairie, Burundi. Three people were killed and three others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2019: Assailants attacked and captured outposts in the Aab Frosha area, Imam Sahib district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/01/2019: Assailants armed with make-shift explosive devices attacked a Golden Dawn office on Deligianni Street in Athens, Attica, Greece. At least two police officers were injured in the ensuing police chase. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2019: Assailants fired eight rockets targeting Southern, Israel. The rockets were safely intercepted by the Iron Dome defense system. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

At least 13 people were killed and 20 other people were injured in the blast; the victims included civilians and Turkish soldiers. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) and the People's Protection Units (YPG).

11/02/2019: Assailants set fire to civilian homes in Sabira, Ad Dali, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Manjit Singh along the Barnala-Raikot road in Sehjada, Punjab, India. Singh, the former Mehal Khurd sarpanch and the husband of the Mehal Kalan block samiti chair, was unharmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/02/2019: Assailants shot and injured Ramesh Mitra, a journalist, in Isanagar, Uttar Pradesh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2019: Three explosive devices were discovered and safely defused on a road in Borno, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/02/2019: An explosive device detonated at a festival in Imphal, Manipur, India. Three Border Security Force (BSF) officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2019: Assailants shot and killed Ibragim Eldzharkiev, the police director of the Ingushetia anti-extremism center, and his brother along Academician Anokhin Street in Moscow, Russia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on Patrick Kumbul, the head of ICT at Radio Nigeria Harvest FM Makurdi, in Makurdi, Benue, Nigeria. Kumbul and one other civilian were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in Balo Khan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One police officer, identified as constable Zahirullah, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2019: Assailants attacked security outposts in Darwazbala district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least 12 people, including four security personnel and eight assailants, were killed and four other security personnel were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2019: Assailants attacked a Land Cruiser in Miyoe, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. Ten people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

11/03/2019: Assailants opened fire on a barangay chairperson in Lapnit, San Ildefonso district, Bulacan, Philippines. Rosteo Salao was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2019: Assailants raided Rann, Borno, Nigeria. Three farmers were killed and six women were abducted during the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/03/2019: An explosive device detonated in Santa Rosa, Lopez, Quezon, Philippines. One off-duty soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People’s Army (NPA).

11/03/2019: Assailants prematurely detonated an explosive device before planting it in Khas Uruzgan district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. Fifteen assailants including Mullah Musafir, a Taliban local commander, were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

Mahamba, a journalist who hosted a radio program on Ebola awareness, was killed and his wife was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Mayi Mayi.

One hostage died in captivity, while eight hostages were released the following day on November 4, 2019. MP Tin was released January 21, 2020. Arakan Army (AA) claimed responsibility for the incident, claiming they did not know that the Indians would be travelling in the are that day and had detained them for security reasons. The group had detained MP U Hwai Tin in order to interrogate him for his possible role as a military informant.

11/03/2019: Assailants fired a rocket targeting a military camp in Landi Kotal, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The rocket landed on a house and there were no reported casualties. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Landi Kotal on the same day. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Soltani, Paktika, Afghanistan. At least seven people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/02/2019: Assailants attempting to extort civilians clashed with soldiers in Santa Cruz, Agusan del Sure, Philippines. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People’s Army (NPA).

11/03/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in At Tuhayta district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least two people were killed and three others were injured in the blast. 11/05/2019: Assailants shot and killed Judge Mario Anacleto Banez in Mameltac, San Fernando, La Union, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/05/2019: Assailants attacked the west entrance of Kunduz, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and four security officers were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
11/05/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Poshta, Faryab, Afghanistan. One soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2019: Assailants attacked Nigerian troops with gun trucks in Marte, Borno, Nigeria. Ten assailants were killed and two others were captured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/05/2019: An assailant driving an explosives-laden vehicle was intercepted by security forces in Tall Abyad, Raqqah, Syria. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

11/05/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a market in Alasay District, Kapisa, Afghanistan. One Afghan soldier was killed and 12 others, including two soldiers and 10 civilians, were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/05/2019: Two explosive devices were discovered and defused in Bahrami Shahid district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2019: Assailants fired missiles and explosives-laden drones targeting Giants Brigades military warehouses in Mukha, Taizz, Yemen. At least six people were killed and several people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/06/2019: Assailants ambushed a military patrol in Damboa, Borno, Nigeria. Ten soldiers and nine assailants were killed and nine soldiers were injured in the attack. An unknown number of soldiers were reported missing and their whereabouts are unknown. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack while sources also attributed the incident to the Shekau faction of the group.

11/06/2019: Assailants detonated explosive devices and opened fire on a convoy of Semafo gold mine workers in Tapoa district, Est, Burkina Faso. At least 37 people, including civilians and soldiers, were killed and 60 others were injured in the attack. An unknown number of people were reported missing following the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 11/05/2019: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting an electric pole in Lam Phaya, Yala, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of four attacks in Yala on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Barisan Revolusi Nasional (BRN).

11/06/2019: Assailants opened fire on a border post in Ishkobod, Districts of Republican Subordination, Tajikistan. At least 17 people, including 15 assailants and two border officers, were killed in the ensuing clash. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources doubted the veracity of the claim.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/06/2019: An explosive device was thrown at the home of Omar Mohamed Elmi, the Lower Shebelle deputy governor, in Afgoye, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Elmi was killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and stated the attack was carried out in retaliation for the victim's role in assisting African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) forces in the area.

11/06/2019: Assailants shot and killed Aziz Ahmad Panjshiri, a prominent academic and former Kabul University professor, near Baghlan, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban; which denied involvement.

11/06/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a military convoy in Qarqaj, Badghis, Afghanistan. Six police officers were killed and four others were wounded in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2019: Assailants attacked a district police headquarters in Chahar Bolak district, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least seven people, including the district police chief and six assailants, were killed and seven others, incluidng three police officers and four assailants, were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2019: An assailant attacked tourists with a knife near the Roman ruins in Jarash, Jordan. At least eight people, including three Spanish tourists and a Swiss tourist, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/06/2019: Assailants ambushed a minibus and opened fire on its passengers in Pindanganga, Manica, Mozambique. Two people were killed and three others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Renamo Military Junta.
11/06/2019: An explosive device detonated in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Mohammad Agha district, Logar, Afghanistan. Three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2019: Assailants burned the boat of David Torres, the founder of and reporter for El Original, in Simiti, Bolivar, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2019: An assailant armed with a knife attacked Junius Ho, a pro-government lawmaker, while campaigning in Tuen Mun neighborhood, Hong Kong, China. In addition to the assailant, Ho and two other people were injured in the attack. An Anti-Government extremist claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2019: Assailants abducted a Kurdish civilian near Rajo, Afrin district, Aleppo, Syria. The hostage was killed and his body was discovered on February 1, 2020. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Ahrar al-Sharqiya.
11/06/2019: Assailants tortured and killed a civilian in Afrin district, Aleppo, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/07/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police officer in Cambanez, San Fernando, Masbate, Philippines. The officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/07/2019: Assailants shot and killed Dindo Generoso, a radio broadcaster at the intersection of Hibbard avenue and Ej Blanco drive, Piapi, Negros Oriental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/07/2019: Assailants attacked Damaturu, Yobe, Nigeria. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, at least one soldier was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/07/2019: Assailants attacked Ngok Dinka civilians in Miodol, West Kordofan, Sudan. Seven people were killed, two others were injured, and two people were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of two coordinated attacks in West Kordofan on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Misseriya Arab Tribesmen.

11/07/2019: Assailants attacked Ngok Dinka civilians in Dungop, West Kordofan, Sudan. Two people, including a community leader, were killed and two others were injured in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks in West Kordofan on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Misseriya Arab Tribesmen.
11/07/2019: Assailants abducted Dr Confidence Ngam, a university lecturer, in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. no group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/14/2019: Assailants attacked the Rimenze Catholic Church compound and set fire to homes in Rimenze, Gbudwe, South Sudan. Four people were abducted during the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/07/2019: Assailants attacked a Doctors Without Borders clinic and surrounding buildings in Mukha, Taizz, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/07/2019: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle carrying judges in Baqi Abad, Logar, Afghanistan. Four people, including three judges and an administrative officer, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/07/2019: Assailants attacked police officers with fire bombs in Athens, Attica, Greece. Three officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Rubicon (Rouvikonas).

11/07/2019: An explosive device detonated in a tourist bus park near the Office of the Chief Returning Officer in Pokhara, Gandaki, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/07/2019: Assailants destroyed medical supplies and set fire to an Ebola health center in Ngoyo, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Mayi Mayi.
11/07/2019: Assailants shot and killed Amjed Al-Dahamat, a journalist, near his home in Shabanah, Amarah, Maysan, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/07/2019: Assailants set fire to an Independent Democratic Union (UDI) headquarters in Concepcion, Bio-Bio, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/07/2019: An explosive device detonated in Amsehli, Shirqat, Saladin, Iraq. One civilian was killed and another was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/08/2019: Assailants abducted Jean Ndel Ndongo, an army officer, in Yoke, South-West, Cameroon. Ndongo was killed later the same day when the assailants buried him alive. Separatists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated they carried out the attack in retaliation for the killing of one of their commanders, Wazuzu, in the prior week.
11/08/2019: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Ahmad Shah Baba Mina, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/08/2019: Assailants fired 17 rockets targeting a United States military base in Qayyarah, Nineveh, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, security forces arrested individuals in connection with the attack and attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/08/2019: Assailants launched rocket-propelled grenades at a Kenyan military base in Qooqaani, Lower Juba, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/08/2019: Assailants opened fire on a truck transporting vegetable oil in Zimpinga, Manica, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Renamo Military Junta, which denied involvement.
11/08/2019: Assailants attacked a gendarmerie post in Sevare, Mopti, Mali. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/08/2019: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device planted in Kondaswali, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

11/08/2019: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden truck outside a police building in Al-Rai, Aleppo, Syria. In addition to the assailant, at least two people were killed and four other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/08/2019: An explosive device detonated prematurely while being planted in Ghayl Ba Wazir, Hadramawt, Yemen. An assailant was killed in the blast, and two additional explosive devices were later discovered and defused at the site. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/08/2019: Assailants abducted Fuad Abdo Farea Al-Idrisi and Mohammed Ali Al-Idrisi from their homes in Dhuran Al-Hasha, Ad Dali, Yemen. The outcome of the abductions are unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/08/2019: Assailants abducted two people accused of cooperating with the government in Feroz Koh, Ghor, Afghanistan. Both hostages were killed on November 11, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/08/2019: Assailants attacked security outposts in Atghar district, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least four people, including one police officer and three assailants, were killed and another four people, including two police officers and two assailants, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/08/2019: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of a local police commander detonated in Yamgan district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. The commander was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/09/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Rafah, North Sinai, Egypt. Two soldiers were killed and another two were injured in the blast. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 11/09/2019: Assailants fired rockets targeting the home of Sheikh Jehanzada, an Awami National Party (ANP) committee member, in Nawagai, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/09/2019: Assailants, including a suicide bomber, detonated an explosives-laden vehicle and attacked a highway police camp in Chinarto, Kandahar, Afghanistan. In addition to the suicide bomber, one police officer was killed and four others were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/09/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Soum district, Sahel, Burkina Faso. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/09/2019: Assailants attacked civilians in Eringeti, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Four civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

11/09/2019: Assailants opened fire on soldiers in Tukanalipao, Mamasapano, Maguindanao, Philippines. One assailant was killed and two others were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

11/09/2019: Assailants opened fire on a police station in Titao, Nord, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/10/2019: Assailants attacked a student hostel at the University of Bamenda in Bambili, North-West, Cameroon. One student was killed and eight others were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of separatists.

11/10/2019: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Suluk, Raqqah, Syria. At least five people were killed and 13 other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) and the People's Protection Units (YPG).

11/10/2019: An assailant threw an explosive device targeting a police patrol in Kyone Doe, Kayin, Myanmar. Four people including three police officers were killed and 10 other people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/10/2019: Assailants set fire to the site of a future asylum center in Bilzen, Flanders, Belgium. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Neo-Nazi extremists.

11/10/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting an Italian military convoy in Makhmur, Arbil, Iraq. Five Italian soldiers were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/10/2019: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of Nasser Pangandaman Jr, along Marawi-Masiu road in Gata, Lanao del Sur, Philippines. Pangandaman, the Masiu mayor, was not harmed; however, one police officer was killed and two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/10/2019: An explosive device detonated prematurely in Haji Mehrab, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/10/2019: An explosive device detonated prematurely in Chamkani district, Paktia, Afghanistan. Four assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/10/2019: Assailants threw petrol bombs targeting the house of a New Democratic Front supporter in Vakarai, Eastern, Sri Lanka. An unknown number of people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Tamil Makkal Viduthalai Pulikal (TMVP).

11/10/2019: Assailants attacked a convoy of Afghan security forces in Dahan-e-Alander, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least one civilian was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

11/10/2019: Assailants attacked a Jubaland Forces (JF) base near Kismayo, Lower Juba, Somalia. There were an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/10/2019: Assailants threw a grenade at police personnel in Baghdad, Iraq. At least 48 police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/11/2019: Assailants detonated six explosive devices and opened fire on soldiers in Bangon, Pinanag-an, Eastern Samar, Philippines. Six soldiers and one assailant were killed and 20 soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People’s Army (NPA).
11/11/2019: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Kafr al-Hasafa, Qalyubia, Egypt. Three police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/11/2019: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle transporting priests and a deacon in Zar, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. Both Hovsep Petoyan and Abraham Petoyan, Armenian Catholic Church priests, were killed and Fati Sano, an Al Hasakah Church deacon, was injured in the assault. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/11/2019: Two explosives-laden vehicles detonated near a market along Al-Wihda Street in Qamishli, Al Hasakah, Syria. This was one of two related bombings in Qamishli on the same day. At least six people were killed and 21 other people were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources separately attributed the incidents to the People's Protection Units (YPG) and the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

11/11/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated near al-Amin Hotel in Qamishli, Al Hasakah, Syria. This was one of two related bombings in Qamishli on the same day. At least six people were killed and 21 other people were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources separately attributed the incidents to the People's Protection Units (YPG) and the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

11/11/2019: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Alisher, Khost, Afghanistan. At least four officers were injured in the incident. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Alisher on the same day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

11/11/2019: Assailants detonated an explosive device, fired rockets, and opened fire on a police convoy responding to an attack in Alisher, Khost, Afghanistan. At least six officers were killed in the incident. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Alisher on the same day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

11/11/2019: Assailants attacked a gendarmerie brigade in Foutouri, Est, Burkina Faso. Three assailants were killed and two soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/11/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy in Muuri, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/11/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated targeting a police van on Spinny Road in Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. Nine people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/11/2019: An explosive device detonated in front of the Indian Infra Project Limited office in Langthabal Kunja, Manipur, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/11/2019: An explosive device detonated near a civilian vehicle in Tanai, Khost, Afghanistan. At least one civilian was killed and four other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/11/2019: In an insider attack, an assailant shot and killed five local police officers, including a commander, while eating dinner in Jinawa, Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

11/11/2019: An assailant stabbed several performers in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. Four performers were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).
11/11/2019: Assailants fired a rocket targeting a market in Iskan, Mansour, Baghdad, Iraq. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/11/2019: Assailants fired a rocket targeting Shaab South, Adhamiyah, Baghdad, Iraq. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/11/2019: Assailants attacked a military outpost in Bazar-e-Zekher, Logar, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/12/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting a military patrol vehicle in North Waziristan district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Three soldiers were killed and one soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/12/2019: A landmine detonated in Lehri, Balochistan, Pakistan. A laborer was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/12/2019: Assailants abducted Sebghatullah Samim, a Ministry of Interior official, from his residence in Iskan, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Iskan on the same day in which two officials were abducted. Both hostages were publicly executed on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

11/12/2019: Assailants abducted Waisullah Hamidi, a Ministry of Interior official, from his residence in Iskan, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Iskan on the same day in which two officials were abducted. Both hostages were publicly executed on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.
11/12/2019: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused on a road in Jadeed, Taizz, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/12/2019: Assailants threw an explosive device at Mathiya police station in Mathiya, Province 2, Nepal. A police officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/12/2019: Assailants ambushed a passenger bus in Mutare, Sofala, Mozambique. Three people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/12/2019: Assailants attacked Hamra, Taizz, Yemen. At least seven people, including four assailants and three soldiers, were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
11/12/2019: Assailants fired upon police officers at an outpost in Fadan Karshe,, Kaduna, Nigeria. Three police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/12/2019: Assailants attacked civilians on Tsokundi road, Wukari, Taraba, Nigeria. One school principal was killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Tiv Militia, which the group denied.

11/12/2019: Assailants fired a rocket targeting a factory in Sderot, Southern, Israel. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of ten related attacks within 24 hours. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the killing of one of the group's commanders.

11/12/2019: Assailants fired a rocket targeting civilians at the Shtulim junction along highway 4 in Shtulim, Southern, Israel. At least one civilian was injured in the attack. This was one of ten related attacks within 24 hours. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the killing of one of the group's commanders.

11/12/2019: Assailants fired a rocket targeting Rishon LeZion, Central, Israel. The rocket landed near a civilian residence. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of ten related attacks within 24 hours. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the killing of one of the group's commanders.

11/12/2019: Assailants fired a rocket targeting a civilian residence in Netivot, Southern, Israel. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of ten related attacks within 24 hours. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the killing of one of the group's commanders.

11/12/2019: Assailants fired a rocket at a civilian residence in Sderot, Southern, Israel. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of ten related attacks within 24 hours. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the killing of one of the group's commanders.

11/12/2019: Assailants fired rockets targeting power lines in Jerusalem, Israel. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of ten related attacks within 24 hours. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the killing of one of the group's commanders.

11/12/2019: Assailants fired rockets targeting power lines in Southern, Israel. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of ten related attacks within 24 hours. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the killing of one of the group's commanders.

11/12/2019: Assailants fired a rocket targeting a civilian residence in Eshkol Regional Council, Southern, Israel. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of ten related attacks within 24 hours. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the killing of one of the group's commanders.

11/12/2019: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting a United States military convoy on Kabul-Paktia highway, near a military base outside Puli Alam, Logar, Afghanistan. The driver of the explosives-laden vehicle was killed in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/12/2019: An assailant armed with a knife attacked an employee of the Passports, Nationality and Foreigners’ Affairs Department in Benghazi, Libya. The employee was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/12/2019: An explosive device detonated targeting Federal Police Forces in Rashad, Kirkuk, Iraq. One Federal Police Forces member was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/12/2019: An explosive device detonated near a police vehicle in Tangi Qarchaghi, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least three officers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/12/2019: Assailants attacked Lucuamba, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least eight people were beheaded and an unknown number of residences were set on fire in the assault. This was one of two similar attacks in villages along the Tanzania-Mozambique border on the same day. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident and accused the victims of being spies for the Mozambican Army.
