summary: 11/12/2019: Assailants attacked Dire, Timbuktu, Mali. There were no reported casualties; however, a prison, a police station, and a National Guard base were set on fire and an unknown number of prisoners were released in the attack. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/12/2019: An explosives-laden drone was safely intercepted as it targeted a rally attended by Ahmad Ahmad al-Maysari, the Yemeni Interior Minster, in Ghaydah, Al Mahrah, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/13/2019: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting a GardaWorld Security Company convoy in the 10th Police District, Kabul, Afghanistan. 13 people, including the assailant, were killed and 20 others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/13/2019: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vest in the yard of a police station in Medan, North Sumatra, Indonesia. The assailant was killed while six people were injured, including four police officers, one police employee and one civilian. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Jamaah Ansharut Daulah (JAD).

11/13/2019: Assailants opened fire on a United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA) vehicle in Panjsher, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/12/2019: Assailants gathered farmers and opened fire on them in Ngongo, Mtwara, Tanzania. At least six farmers were killed and seven other farmers were injured before being released. This was one of two similar attacks in villages along the Tanzania-Mozambique border on the same day. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed repsonsibility for the incident and accused the victims of working as spies for the military.
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 11/13/2019: Assailants shot and killed a shopkeeper in Tral, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Hizbul Mujahideen (HM).

11/13/2019: Assailants fired rockets targeting a government military base in Marib, Yemen. At least five soldiers were killed and ten others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/13/2019: Assailants opened fire on the district chief's house in Adayga, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. The district chief and the deputy were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/13/2019: Assailants forced residents to pay taxes and stole livestock in Beledweyne, Hiiraan, Somalia. Five assailants were killed when security forces intervened. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/13/2019: An explosive device detonated between Tahita and Khokha in Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/13/2019: Assailants fired projectiles at military positions in Hays district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/13/2019: Assailants fired a rocket targeting an assisted-living facility in Ashkelon, Southern, Israel. At least one civilian was injured in the attack. This was one of ten related attacks within 24 hours. Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the killing of one of the group's commanders.

11/13/2019: Assailants attempted to fire a rocket in the Gaza Strip. The rocket misfired and struck the Palestinian Independent Commission for Human Rights office. This was one of ten related attacks within 24 hours. One person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ).

11/13/2019: Assailants attacked civilians in Quibunjo, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties in the assault. This was one of three related attacks in Cabo Delgado on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/13/2019: Assailants attacked civilians in Fungi, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties in the assault. This was one of three related attacks in Cabo Delgado on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/13/2019: Assailants attacked an army base with one suicide bomber, an anti-aircraft gun, and a rocket-propelled grenade in Mallam Fatori, Borno, Nigeria. Three assailants were killed and six soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed it to Boko Haram.

11/13/2019: Explosive devices detonated targeting a Tatmadaw units in Thayat Tabin, Rakhine, Myanmar. A battalion commander and two soldiers were killed and at least two soldiers were injured in the attack. The Arakan Army claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 11/13/2019: A landmine detonated targeting Ukrainian Army personnel in Donetsk, Ukraine. A commander and a soldier were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/14/2019: Assailants opened fire on two barangay councillors, identified as Felipe Condez Jr. and Jonesis Condez, in Napac-an, Kalumboyan, Negros Oriental, Philippines. The two councillors were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/14/2019: Assailants attacked a security post in Char Tut, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Four people, including a local police commander, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/14/2019: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated at a local bazaar in Sabari district, Khost, Afghanistan. At least one person was killed and two others, including one soldier and one civilian, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

The victim's family doubted the veracity of the claim.

12/10/2019: Two assailants opened fire on JC Kosher Supermarket in Jersey City, New Jersey, United States. In addition to the assailants, three people were killed and three others were injured in the attack. David Anderson and Francine Graham, Anti-Semitic extremists, claimed responsibility for the incident and wrote in a note later discovered in the their vehicle, "I do this because my creator makes me do this and I hate who he hates." Sources noted that Anderson and Graham had both anti-Semitic and anti-police motivations and that Anderson had previously been linked to the Black Hebrew Israelite movement. Anderson and Graham were also responsible for the death of Detective Joseph Seals earlier that day along with the murder of Michael Rumberger, a taxi driver, in Bayonne, New Jersey the previous weekend.

12/10/2019: Assailants armed with grenades and firearms attacked the SYL Hotel near the presidential palace in Warta Nabada neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incident.

Thomas was arrested in connection to the attack and authorities discovered in his journal that he had referenced Hitler, "Nazi culture," and stated that "Hebrew Israelites" had taken from "powerful ppl (ebinoid Israelites)." He had also searched online for "why did Hitler hate the Jews," "prominent companies founded by Jews in America" and "German Jewish Temples near me."

12/31/2019: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Gurziwan district, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of three attacks in Faryab in one night. Four police officers were killed and five others were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/31/2019: Assailants killed a woman in Konjak, Balkh, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Taliban was involved in the attack.
12/31/2019: An explosive device detonated in Gulran district, Herat, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed and another was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2019: Assailants attacked a government vehicle in Qala-e-Rig, Herat, Afghanistan. One National Directorate of Security officer was killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/31/2019: Assailants raided a railway construction site and set fire to a number of vehicles in Malhan, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Tritiya Sammelan Prastuti Committee (TSPC).

12/31/2019: Assailants attacked a truck in Munkeri, Jharkhand, India. The driver was beaten and the truck was set on fire in the attack. The Tritiya Sammelan Prastuti Committee (TSPC) claimed responsibility for the incident in a note left at the scene.

12/31/2019: Assailants raided the house of Al-Khader Ali Salem Buglida, the Oil Office General Director, in Ataq district, Shabwah, Yemen. Buglida's brother was abducted and his whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Islah Party.

12/00/2019: Sometime between December 29, 2019 and January 1, 2020, assailants attacked a family in Tabqah, Raqqah, Syria. At least three people were killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/31/2019: Assailants shot and killed Abdullah Nilong II, the Lapu barangay chair, at a market in Polomolok, South Cotabato, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2019: Assailants abducted Higaynon tribal leader Bontola Tinaghao Mansinugdan and his son, identified as Gali, in Kinamaybay, Agusan del Sur, Philippines. Mansinugdan was shot and killed while Gali was released on January 1, 2020 and his son was released. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

12/31/2019: Assailants attacked a traffic police checkpoint in Magas, Ingushetia, Russia. At least two people, including an assailants and a police officer, were killed and four people, including one assailant and three officers, were injured in the ensuing clash. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Caucasus Province of the Islamic State

summary: 12/31/2019: A grenade detonated at the house of Hayder Manibpal, a businessperson, in Pikit, Inug-ug, North Cotabato, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2019: Assailants abducted 16 Road Transport Administration Department employees from a ferry between Sittwe and Buthidaung in Rakhine, Myanmar. The hostages were released on January 1, 2020. The Arakan Army (AA) claimed responsibility and stated that the kidnappings were conducted in order to levy taxes on businesses for the people Rakhine state.

12/31/2019: Assailants abducted Godlove Abanda Ndi in Njap, North-West, Cameroon. Godlove, a suspected military informant, was found dead on January 2, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

12/30/2019: Assailants attacked a security post in Nada, Diyala, Iraq. At least one soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/31/2019: An explosive device detonated outside the residence of a tribal leader along Palestine Street in Baghdad, Iraq. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2019: Assailants attacked the police headquarters building in El Geneina, West Darfur, Sudan. Two police officers were killed and one officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2019: Assailants attacked the West Darfur Legislative Council building in El Geneina, West Darfur, Sudan. Two police officers guarding the building were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/31/2019: A landmine detonated targeting a civilian in Bagiot Dora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/31/2019: Assailants threw petrol bombs at government offices in Lai Chi Kok, Hong Kong, China. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2019: Assailants attacked Security Belt Forces in Al-Mahfad District, Abyan, Yemen. Two soldiers, including Security Belt leader Yasser Al-Kazami Al-Maqroumi, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/31/2019: Assailants armed with incendiary devices and flagpoles who were part of a broader sit-in protest attacked the United States Embassy in Baghdad, Iraq. No casualties were reported, though several structures were set on fire during the attack and ensuing standoff which lasted for several hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, United States officials indicated that leaders of Kata'ib Hezbollah had orchestrated the attack. A Kata'ib Hezbollah spokesperson acknowledged the group's role in the protest, but denied that the group had any intention to storm the embassy.
